I-YFZfhjHOF5LkjvGBrerQ.review_text: Amazing food, incredibly friendly staff, menu changes daily. Prices are on the higher side, I wish they accepted credit cards and used Square, no wifi. Everyone seems to get confused with the hanging Enricos Menu next to theirs. Use of Enricos patio seating is great, heat lamps on a cold day is a nice touch. When they get their own place it will be even more awesome. A great secret is they are open on Sat.

yRmMD_MALXV2JfKORqqpTg.review_text: We came here after reading good reviews online, and gravely regretted the decision.  I felt so strongly about them deserving a low score that I had to create this Yelp account.  Let me put it this way: they've got one person taking orders and four in the back assembling sandwiches.  Within the first 15 minutes of us standing there holding greasy number cards with the tip of our fingers, they cranked out 2.  No wonder a sandwich that's mostly bread and lettuce costs a whopping $16... gotta pay everybody's minimum wage, right?  In this dark and dirty hole-in-the-wall with an ambiguous name amongst strip clubs and sex shops, we stood helplessly for 35 minutes before getting our orders.  In that much time someone on Food Network could have slaughtered a whole pig and made sausage, and it would have tasted better than my sandwich.  Thanks to the wait, all five of us missed an important office meeting.  What's worse was their management skills and attitude.  Several people arrived much later and got their orders before we did.  Just because one guy claimed to be in a hurry, they bumped his (large) order ahead of ours.  Well, I sure hope that guy didn't have to miss any meetings.  When we complained, they gave us lame excuses that were untrue and made no logical sense.  No apology and no respect for their paying customers.  In conclusion, if you don't know what to do with your time, don't have enough intelligence to be insulted, and enjoy staring at ugly strippers across the street, Naked Lunch should be your destination.

JPD4yBb5iOBwBkz-zQCqqw.review_text: I'm a fan. Love the foie gras proscuitto sandwich and the bacon sundried tomatoe sandwich. My sister brought me here, she told me that if we share the sandwich I would want the other half, and I did. There's not much else except for sandwiches, but thats they do well. They use good ingredients and great flavors. I want to go back for the fried chicken on tuesdays

a_izSbeJFpOyS3G_ml94gQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in the area.  The creative sandwiches are absolutely delicious.  The steak, fried chicken, and korean chicken are some of my favorites and they've got some great veggie options as well.  It's not the quickest place for lunch, but its well worth the wait!

NpU44ANnUUNQWY4U0eUGvA.review_text: omg im in love.  we shared two sandwiches the skirt steak and also the foie gras torchon with duck proscuitto, butter lettuce, and truffle salt.  i kept thinking about the foie gras sandwich all weekend.  it was really flavorful.  the flavors were strong but clean.  i want to come back just to get that sandiwch

1msi6Jx7PshfHtnfyRhcoA.review_text: The rating is targeted at the fried chicken sandwich alone. The best fried chicken sandwich in the city. I keep trying other restaurants hoping for a more convenient-to-downtown contender and they all fall short. I can't speak to any of the other items on the menu because the opportunity cost of not ordering the chicken sandwich is too high.  As a bonus, they handle large group orders very well. I have come with groups and ordered over a dozen sandwiches and they all come out at the same time. It is an ideal location for a long group lunch.

UayU6PjzeOQrdQSGJXpITA.review_text: I made it in today and had the Pork Belly sandwich and lychee lemonade. I enjoyed both, though the pork belly sandwich was so rich (as to be expected!) that I only ate half. The lychee limeade was nice and tart, though the lychee was overpowered.  I will definitely be back and try some more as it was only their second day!

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: They deserve every accolade, rant and rave..   Simply one of the best sandwich shops in the City. They just keep it very simple here.  They don't have 30+ items here, just 4 to 5.  I had the bbq chicken sandwich and it was unbelievable. I will definitely come back here on Tuesdays for their fried chicken sandwich. The bbq chicken was lightly charred and you can taste that smokiness from the grill.  The chicken was moist and juicy.  The sauce wasn't too tangy or overwhelming, it was perfect.  The toasted bun was fantastic and the peppers and slaw gave it that crunchy texture to make this sandwich, the best sandwich I have ever had.  Remember I really don't care for sandwiches. I really don't care for it but I actually will crave for their sandwich.   Bottom line............just try it!!!

ek9Maokx9kR2AUMs2qDt3w.review_text: I am visiting from out of town and meet my cousin here for lunch.  This place is a gem.   Total rustic-hole-in the wall; real people really passionate about real food!  I had the pear and balsamic rocket salad sandwich and it was great.  Thanks a bunch!

ojvZZ_ZWRlfJDJN_kV1ESQ.review_text: I only wish my office was closer to Naked Lunch. We went  today and split the Fried Chicken Sandwich and the D' Anjou Pear & Ricotta Salata Sandwich - both of which were amazing. The menu is limited, but since they change it up a little every day it is okay. As far as the price for the standard sandwiches, I think it is fine when you compare it with places like The Sentinel and Little Skillet - both tend to be the same price and not nearly as good in my opinion (although I do like the egg salad sandwich at Sentinel). Give it a try and enjoy.  Last note - if you order the Fried Chicken Sandwich, I would suggest eating it on the patio of Enrico's - stays crisper that way.

jIC6cKP1JB8Vr9A07jY9Ew.review_text: I needed to take two friends from NY out for lunch and chose Naked Lunch (over Carte415). They were a bit surprised when we got there but quickly came around. The service was great, and we took a table out on the patio, in the sun, with a nice view of the various local sex shops...  We ordered the Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich, the Fra' Mani Dried Chorizo & Egg Sandwich, the Roasted Golden Beet & Green Bean Salad, the Marinated Olives, and two Watermelon & Basil Coolers. All told we spent $34.  Everything was excellent - I would recommend to a newcomer anything that we ordered. It was a great lunch experience, and I'll definitely be back if I have guests in town again.

JxfGpZn9WHEI3BLOFbgksg.review_text: Fantastic service from the staff!!! Very accommodating!  I will have the PigFig over the Foie Gras sandwich any day.  =)

kqlN-k5PtDm4MEdwbrPVuA.review_text: Oh dear.  I don't want to create a riot, but yelp has let me down again. The Fried Chicken sandwich was really not that good...unless you like the taste of gooey fat or chewy almost rubbery chicken saturated in mayo.  I think what failed in this sandwich is that the fried chicken was a fried chicken thigh full of fatty parts.  Don't get me wrong.  I love me some fried chicken thigh.  But I don't think it works in this sandwich esp since it almost felt like it wasn't cooked all the way because of the rubber like texture.  Taking a bite into a sandwich and having to basically yank it to chew through a piece of chicken...not good.  I kept checking to see if the chicken was pink but it wasn't.    And the nuggets of fat included with the thigh and near the skin was just too overwhelming for me.  And it didn't help that the sandwich was drowned in mayo.  Oh and finding some chicken hairs still on the skin was a bit unappetizing.  The lemonade however was good.  Not overly sweet like other places.  And I did like the bread they used for the sandiwch.  I don't know.  I think the sandwich would fare better if the chicken thigh meat was pulled and the fatty slime removed.

m7ulbgBB7Z-0STPpBMiOuw.review_text: Super yummy and juicy fried chicken sandwich.  I don't know how they get their chicken that juicy, but I don't care.  Also, the cinnamon iced tea (free refills!) is delicious.  Not super crowded either, which is a refreshing change.

Lx7X31l2snPfdu9lHemgMA.review_text: Sometimes outstanding, sometimes sloppy. The cod sandwich is outstanding but overwhelmed by mayo. Obviously anything with foie gras is going to be splendid. The grilled cheese was sadly small. Soups are good, so are salads. But note to the staff: don't ever call me "ma'am."

Ql1htoTzmmhVjIHr0eII7w.review_text: I just ate here and wow.  I spent a good amount of time talking with the owners and chef and these guys are awesome, they actually care about their customers, are super friendly, and spent several minutes answering all my food questions (I'm a bit of a health nut).  Pretty much everything they make is hand made from scratch with the best quality ingredients.  While this might be a bit on the higher end for a lunch (sandwhich, salad, soup $20) it's well worth it.  If they have the cappuccino mushroom soup then do yourself a favor and get it, make sure you ask for an extra piece of bread on the side...it's that good.  I'm always looking for small quality places that serve good food and Naked Lunch is definitely one of them.

qjBuaL6LapSDKpV7MIhrPQ.review_text: Ehhhhhh....  Overhyped chicken sandwich. I finally tried you. And you were MEH. The chicken is dark meat WITH skin, deep fried. This makes for an overly rich, fatty fried chicken. Accompanied with a huge dollop of aioli makes for an extremely gluttonous sandwich (the little bit of shredded lettuce ain't savin' you). The worst part was that the fried chicken wasn't even crispy. Sloppily fried. My friend's chicken was even COLD.  Simply, it's a more gluttonous version of a McChicken. Yep, I said it.  I'll be back for that sandwich with kimchi in it, but so disappointed...

B1IQ5YmKz4WSSQXvqzZqNQ.review_text: Probably the most memorable thing about Naked Lunch is the logo by artist Jeremy Fish. If you're even somewhat into the SF art scene you'll know who this guy is.  I have to admit I visited this place a LONG time ago.I don't really remember which sandwich I got. It was either a pork or duck sandwich. I remember it being seemingly well constructed although all the insides began to slide out upon chewing. A good sandwich with honest ingredients but something I wouldn't crave especially with the price tag. I hear the soups are good so I might return for them. Hopefully it will be a more memorable experience.  Even though I can't recall exactly what I had, I still remember having my first Ike's sandwich. Naked Lunch? Not so much.  Note: Only open for a few hours for lunchtime.

ZKWWW5JVW-_g_hwDif7sFg.review_text: Came here for lunch and snagged a sunny table out front. I got the veggie and my handsome date got the chicken sandwich. Both were friggin' YUM. The bartender we ordered from was nice. I wish they served fries or something on the side with the sandwiches, for $10 I usually expect some potato action.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: The BEST Fried Chicken Sandwich I've ever had! Juicy chicken thigh perfectly coated with deliciously spiced batter yummy slaw..I'm drooling right now. Oh I have to add the staff was kinda cute! haha

BjnKGhst96DvmF6VGjDCOA.review_text: I didn't love this place. It was okay. Maybe I didn't order the right thing. The staff wasn't extremely friendly and the food was good, but not great.

-1pSQDWlS3HUU__Xt5Veow.review_text: I don't think you could go wrong ordering anything here! It is a more expensive sandwich but with the acme bread and the amazing filings... it's so worth it if you're in the area.   My friend and I split the foie/duck proscuitto and the pork belly and both were really good. They are quite generous with the foie -- definitely give it a try if you can before the ban takes effect in July! The pork belly sandwich was very flavorful and not overly fatty. We also cut the richness with a small citrus salad on the side and it was delightfully plated and dressed with a very light vinaigrette.  Made for a perfect lunch on a sunlit day in the city.

YC4xH6hxgAQks-ngsr_Whg.review_text: I've been curious about Naked Lunch ever since getting a Daily Candy about it, but have been too lazy and cheap to check it out until now.  They've got a limited selection of gourmet sandwiches and soups.  They heat the bread, which I will always give out bonus points for (hate cold bread on a sandwich).    I was curious about the Fois since it seems to be their signature, but decided it was a bit much for lunch, so  I decided to go for the grilled cheese with tomatoes and ham and the black grape  with pepper cooler.  The sandwich is self was good - lots of tomato both fresh (Heirloom I believe) and sun dried.  There was a thing slice of ham which gave it a nice flavor, but I don't think 1 slice of ham is sufficient to bump up the price by $2.00.  I also would have liked to see a tiny bit more cheese.   As for the drink, I don't know if I could recommend it.  It was cool, refreshing and I initially thought that the pepper just rounded it out and gave it more body.  With each sip, though, the pepper became more and more pronounced.  Towards the end, I felt like my mouth was covered in cracked white pepper.  I enjoyed about 50% of it, then started feeling a bit like Tantalus - drinking but getting no relief from my thirst.  Finally, it's a bit on the pricey side.   I'll be back on nice days when I want to stretch my legs and get something fancier than safeway.

asL1d04xS3y8YQtU5ota-g.review_text: This is a unique spot that the locals go to. We just found this through our Yelpers. They only serve two sandwiches, two salads, and a soup. The fried chicken sandwich was so good. It had a nice little kick to it. The salad was really good and you have to get the cinnamon sweet tea. It's really good.  Overall I liked this place and the server was nice. Bathroom was little dirty, but I will be back at my next visit.

gsqEbb3TMJ9h3kHGdFh86Q.review_text: I come here like once a week almost, and I don't know what to say other than they are seriously awesome... I've had the pleasure of trying almost all the sammiches they make, and they're all good! Also, try the different drinks they make, everything is good here!  I think my favorite sandwich would have to be the softshell crab or the fried chicken one... definitely try those out when they have it but you gotta check out their site cause they don't always have the same things on their menu (cycles daily and seasonally I think...)

z62CMQElJvWzu40HeGUCEQ.review_text: This just describes the duck prosciutto foie gras sandwich.  Sandwich: good Price: bwaaahh  They either forgot to put the prosciutto on mine or I misread and it is duck prosciutto foie gras meaning the foie is made with prosciutto because all that was on my sandwich was paste, or I guess pate, lettuce and tomato, but honestly it was still pretty damn good.  Has duck prosciutto? not really Worth $15? no worth trying for $15 one time? yeah, at least they don't put tax on top Will I go back and try the 5 star BLT I just read about when it is on the menu? definitely  also, CASH ONLY so bring some green backs

UYArdBgkiHvSg2kUR8dWYw.review_text: Only went at night, but this was a chill bar  Played some pool with my friends Emma and josh and chilled on a local brew  Not crowded. In fact almost empty for a Saturday night. The music was pumping from an iPod.   Good times

COc1EABn7Gn0JEfm6Gj6AQ.review_text: On Tuesdays, Naked Lunch serves up a Fulton Valley Fried Chicken Sandwich. Loved it! The chicken was dark meat, which I liked - it was super tender. My friend and I arrived at around 12:15 and there were only 2 people in line in front of us. No line for gourmet food is a rarity around these parts during peak lunch hour.  Definitely coming back for the chicken sandwich, to try the foie gras sandwich and any other special goodness these guys will cook up.

M6vv_thbXnji_EF_Gq1P2Q.review_text: They said Bakesale Betty's in Berkeley made the best fried chicken sandwiches ever...only because they've yet to discover Naked Lunch -- hands down BEST FRIED CHICKEN sandwich to have ever blessed my tounge!  It may be a lil steep ($8ish), but MY GOD. It's heaven's chicken fried in a perfectly golden crisp batter - super flavorful, juicy, hot, huge hunks of succulent goodness all layered in between two warm lightly buttered buns. With a slap of fresh, tangy coleslaw.   Apparently, this place is the lunch kitchen version of the fancy Enrico's and is a MUST try if you work in the area or even...for a quick hole-in-the-wall trip if you happen to be in North Beach.  Talk about eating in the back of the kitchen of a gourmet restaurant!  I am sooooooooooo coming back.

AAvEN337yxa0P0fP9zrN6w.review_text: Contrary to the name, this establishment frowns upon nudity while inside. They claim it's about health codes and not disgusting other people, but I think it's more of a bait and sandwich technique.   Naked Lunch specializes in expensive and good sandwiches that offer a variety of surprising taste combinations.  The other day, they were serving a whole fried soft-shell crab sandwich for $14. For that cost, you could be rolling in nearly 3 feet of sandwiches at Subway.  Their beverage selection is tasty and unexpected too: cinnamon sweet tea, coconut lime juice, and basil lemonade.  Word has it that they are expanding into the large space next door. In the meantime, the booths are available to sit in. This is good because the main restaurant has minimal eating space inside, and only a small table or two out front.  It's not on the menu, but I recommend ordering the "Omnibus."  This sandwich is a mega sandwich made from all the sandwiches on the menu. It costs the same as buying them all individually, and is so big that they have to custom order a take out bag from a big and tall store nearby. But once you sink your mouth into this massive contraption, you'll wonder why you ever listened to me.

B8h0JIKorcV8LbDouurNIw.review_text: Broccoli Rabe Sandwich with manchego cheese, slivered almonds, lemon juice, garlic aioli, and asparagus.   One of my favorite summer sandwiches in the city. This thing is HEAVEN!!!

mRk0-Fag3DPEsdqJb4SjuQ.review_text: WHOA! 100% worth the hype.  This is the best nom nom nom chicken nom nom nom sandwich nom nom nom EVER.  Sweet tea is fabulous too and service couldn't be friendlier.  Now back to my sandwich...

-HdCz4esoe_sFoFFsRIlxQ.review_text: I was in town for work and needed a quick lunch. I usually try to eat healthy foods when I'm traveling and Naked Lunch did not have many healthy options. However, they did have very fresh ingredients and splurging was worth it here. I sat at the bar and ordered the fried chicken sandwich. YUM! The ambiance alone is worth the visit. The pool tables and wine barrels really make it a fun scene.

saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q.review_text: After hearing about this place from Genevieve, I finally tried it on a weekday morning. It's a simple process: a) check their website for their daily menu b) choose from the selections, some regular and some daily specials c) email, call, or fax them with your order d) pick up at appointed time At 11:30 am, I placed my telephone order and he told me to pick it up in ten minutes. Here's what I had: 1) Potato and Garlic Soup - A cup of creamy potato soup with a subtle yet rich garlic flavor. Taking it to my office, it was just warm, but still very yummy. (yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao…) 2) Duck prosciutto and Foie Gras Torchon Sandwich - Yes, this sandwich is as rich as it sounds. Tender duck prosciutto (is that a meat?) was delicious. What kind of sauce or spread on the bread? None needed as the Foie Gras made the sandwich plenty moist. Seeing Acme Bread paper bags lined to the side, no need to ask for their bread source. (yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao…) Overall, a very nice, gourmet lunch. The cashier immediately informs customers that, if they'd like to dine-in, they are welcome to seat themselves in Enrico's outdoor tables next door. Rating this a 4.5 star experience, minus 0.5 star for the limited menu... but what do you expect from this small place.

dVHL4K-c50SgSDkawlZeVw.review_text: Two words: FOIE-GRAS.  I know, I should hate myself for eating foie, but I can't help it.  It's so amazing!  So as you can tell from fellow Yelpers, it's all about the foie gras sandwich at Naked Lunch.  Yes, it's a $16 sandwich, but they're quite generous with the foie, so it's well worth it.  It comes with a little duck proscuitto to add a little saltiness, as well as heirloom tomato and butter lettuce.  It's just one of those sandwiches that you have to savor...savor...each...bite...mmm....  It's like those times when you get a piece of sushi or sashimi that is simply sweet, tasty, fatty perfection, and you just want to take a bite and savor it before taking another....mmmmmm......  On another note...I've tried their lamb sandwich, that is really good as well.  Makes me sad that I don't work in FiDi...or in SF for that matter... :P

Z2w3mz_zyvPGKVW78A8hRQ.review_text: Extremely fancy, hipster sandwiches. I've been there twice, and the first time I got a Korean BBQ style sandwich containing juicy, tender chicken. The second time, I got their infamous fried chicken sandwich. Both rank among the most perfect sandwiches I have ever tried. Naked Lunch doesn't get five stars from me, though, because it's pricey for takeout and smallish portions, and the wait is pretty long even when there's no line. Still, I consider it highly unfortunate that I no longer work anywhere close to this place. It's pretty out of the way... even when I was working way on the other side of FiDi, near the Transamerica Building.

eS04DdTrqf4aJggGUbuT7g.review_text: Best Choco Chip Cookies (albiet expensive) in San Francisco. For that alone, they get 5 stars. The sammiches are stellar.  Love this place except on Monday's when they are closed.

jKn87iD_qNNvYxFg1S642A.review_text: got the famous fried chicken sandwich, but really didn't like the taste, not the chicken...  environment was nice though.

H9LVW5HzFvsLzUxC-0W4hA.review_text: It's been a habit of mine to eat olives whenever I consume alcohol. I have a savory palate, so they go well with just about anything I'm drinking.  I must've asked the bartender about five times, "Can I get some olives?" His response? "I'm sorry, we are reserving our olives for customers who buy martinis." Fair enough, but my party purchased a total of about 20 shots of tequila within the few hours we were there, on top of all the beer and food. He was only able to spare me TWO OLIVES. He wasn't rude, but his response was just unjustifiable, especially after I saw that they had a huge bucket of olives in the kitchen. Let me just say, the container may have been as big as my torso. It made me wonder a lot of things. How expensive are these olives? Is the purchaser of the olives on vacation and cannot purchase more for a while? Were they expecting 500 orders of martinis that night? It was mind boggling why I was deprived of olives after the beau and I alone spent almost $200 at the bar.  As for the food.. the beau ordered the cucumber soup, which was a huge mistake. It is served cold and was super liquidy. Why isn't it thick? Did someone forget to simmer this so the soup can thicken up? Did someone forget to add some heavy whipping cream? They might as well have served it in a cup.  My three stars are for the fried chicken sandwich and fries. I'm not big on sandwiches, but this one was so juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside, with just enough seasoning. I'm also not a big fan of fat fries, but these were fingerlickin' good!

2kIaaPrwYC6TGG620ZDgFA.review_text: I'm not a fruo-frou kind of guy which is what I thought when I saw the menu,  come-on, artisan foie gras torchon sandwich?   Don't know about that, but the chicken sandwich which I do know (they only serve on Tuesday) is pretty darn good.  Tastes fresh, skin is just crisp right, and the meat was super moist.  The soft-shell crab is a can't miss as well, just don't look and think too much about those little crab legs sticking out of the side of your buns and you'll enjoy it whole hearted.      When you first go the place it looks small, but they use next door's restaurant front patio space, so plenty of room there.  They rotate certain items on the menu, so check the website to see what's serving.

r2KuUY0GJGZozUOSz8tJ3A.review_text: Salt.  Everything tasted like salt.  Nearly burning our mouths salty.  My sister had been here 3 or 4 times before and was really excited to take me while I was visiting in town.  We went, the pulled pork was sold out, and the vegetarian option was based around asparagus, so we went for the dungeness crap and the foie gras to split between us.  The foie gras torchon was undercooked and raw, my sister described it as a "salt lick," and true enough it was not cooked through and you couldn't taste it through the overwhelming salty flavor. Nor could you taste the prosciutto. My (pregnant) sister had to put the foie gras sandwich down immediately,  The tomatoes were pretty wan, to boot.  The dungeness crab was also salty and lacked any noteworthy characteristics, overwhelming the remoulade and other elements. The pickled vegetables were good, though.    The cinnamon sweet tea was good, and needed to get the sodium bite out of the mouth.  Seems like it was a super off day from the other reviews, and maybe I'll try again, but I will rarely ever throw food out and both of these sandwiches went unfinished. At about 15 bucks a pop, far from a pain free mistake.

asuaPJVpu7ECtHbbUX1bGw.review_text: If you want a great sandwich in the city, this is the place to go. Get there early because there will usually be a line for lunch and sometimes items do sell out.   I came here with about 15 coworkers, which is crazy enough because the place is super tiny. If I worked there I would have definitely been annoyed with the fact that nobody could decide between 3 different items on the menu, but the guy at the register was very patient and helpful. He offered recommendations to each of us, I was very surprised!  The menu changes everyday so don't be surprised if the sandwich you fell in love with isn't on the menu for a while. I got the asparagus sandwich on ciabatta bread. I don't usually try vegetarian options on the menu, but this sounded to good to pass up (i was right).

y3Gb0zhTZQO1SMS8xluoxA.review_text: I've only had the fried chicken sandwich here (why would I get anything else?!) at lunchtime.  It is a fun vibe and escape from a workday if you are anywhere near here.  Grab a PBR and a game of pool while you're at it and make a good hour of it before you head back to the grind.

sH_t9HCv3hIxVagul3J3gQ.review_text: Ah, one of those spots you hit all the time and just assume you've already reviewed.  I religiously come here on Fridays with coworkers to get my fix. Sure, the sandwiches aren't the cheapest you can find in SF.  They also aren't the biggest.  But hot damn, they sure do taste the part!    The people who work here are all friendly and will help you make your way around the menu even if you are an aspiring vegetarian that just can't say no to a lamb cheesesteak.  By the way, get the lamb cheesesteak.  I'll usually get that or the cod when in season, and split whatever rotating veggie sandwich they have that day.  Maybe I'll get a cookie or the cinnamon iced tea if my paycheck was particularly fat... or I had some leftover whiskey from the night before that needs help getting soaked up.  I haven't ventured to the prosciutto and foie, but I've been pretty happy without it up to this point.  Come during a sunny day for a relaxing lunch on the now Txoko patio and you won't regret it.

MemRJ7L9jS3BOngZnWeYlQ.review_text: Disclosure: I ate here for lunch on a Friday. I love visiting SF, mostly for the food.   Ambiance:  Poorly designed flow and layout. Stand at the bar to order sandwich? With everyone walking in and out the doors? Exceedingly inefficient and uncomfortable for the customer. Otherwise the space itself is comfortable, after you've sat down. Time until food arrival, probably about average.   Food:  Pretty darn good, but a little heavy on the mayo in some cases. We had the fried chicken sandwich, short rib sandwich, brussel sprout sandwich, and the fries. The fries are fantastic. Thick cut with plenty of seasoning. The bread on all the sandwiches is great. As a whole, each sandwich is very good (4/5 stars), but nothing is blow-you-out-of-the-water type of good.   Overall: For lunch, a good, reasonably fast place with SF quality food. Worth a visit, but not a must and not a place I'm eagerly trying to return to.

Kr-WatD-MizLfiM-sQM47w.review_text: Great place to start the evening .  They have a friendly staff and the bar meets all of my whisky loving needs.  I really enjoyed the fries and pools tables.  The atmostphere is somewhat trendy with a younger working class. Parking is a challenge with high priced lots near by, but what can you expect for the city.

_W4Gts5BdOdQ1ElQ0FXPAQ.review_text: I never miss to visit this place when I am in SFO, some of the best Sandwiches I have ever had. Everything is great here, never been disappointed. The Skirt steak sandwich is the best ! I also like their seared tuna sandwich. I always recommend this place to all my friends who are visiting SFO. And I always tell them that in between all the strip clubs on Broadway you got to visit Naked Lunch ! "Ëven If the strip clubs disappoint you, Naked Lunch will never !"

BBTFyjdgWSEdzhQFEQx65g.review_text: Naked Lunch only got to first base with me.   Hey, I'm harder to land than the Il de France.  Since I was a NL virgin, I had to try the foie and duck prosciutto sandwich. The foie was silky and rich as promised. However, I think the tomato in the sandwich didn't add any value- I would recommend a fig jam instead for a bright fruity note.  Also there was too much bibb lettuce.  I would have used a mache so the foie could stand out more.   NL has a lot of promise - I'd be back for another makeout session.

bwo6wT5yv7FtV2kSo8fGNQ.review_text: All of my doubts about paying $11 for a salmon sandwich were obliterated the second I took my first bite.  So freaking delicious. The other reviewers are right, the sandwich rolls puts this one over the top.

EtEhzvBxvjhMbZBYLmSyXA.review_text: Food: Fantastic quality, small menu with slight changes every day - the sandwiches are all great and don't forget the soups/salads Ambiance: Heated outdoor seating under the awning at Enrico's, very pleasant even on colder days Proprietors: Couldn't be any nicer Price: One of, if not the best, quality per dollar options in North Beach

VuWCFQVSyH87J4UKK1IlbQ.review_text: Been here for lunch twice. They do very few things, but do them right.  I tried the fried chicken sandwich and the asparagus sandwich. Both were good. I did especially like their chicken sandwich which seems to be their main staple.  Casual seating in a large bar-room type place with additional outdoor seating. Custom illustrations on the wall which looked great and are fun. Nice spot for lunch.

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: Soup: not so great... - came on a non tuesday and failed at getting a legit lunch because i did not order ahead and i have a short lunch.  i bought the soup, recommended by the cashier, which was $6 for a moderately sized cup of a creamy corn soup... that took a good 7 minutes to come out in a to-go cup.   it tasted like cream and salt.   it was big dissapointing waste of money  Fried Chicken Sandwich: a simple sandwich with simple flavors that work together - i would highly recommend - i came back for their fried chicken sandwich which is only offered on tuesdays.  i called ahead of time, and the sandwich was actually ready when i got there ~10 minutes later.   it was a more substantial amount of food (more than fist sized) for only $8 ($2 more than the soup).   bread was unremarkable but the chicken was juicy, the slaw was crunchy and fresh, and there was a good amount of lemon juice (?) to give the whole sandwich a kick!  the spicy sauce is given on the side so you can add it to suit your taste/tolerance.     ike's is still my #1 in terms of sandwiches however, i will be back to try some of Naked's other sandwiches

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: One of the tastier veggie sandwiches I've had -- zucchini, roasted peppers, herb chevre, crispy shallot, balsamic, and mixed mesclun greens. YUM. I loved the crunchiness the fried shallots added to it.  Everything was so flavorful. I could've probably eaten 2 of these in one sitting because it was that good. (And also 'cause it's not that big).   No one was there when we arrived and ordered, but it took around 10 minutes to get our sandwiches, so I'd recommend calling ahead.

2JeI_lY2OyPM-kfa4yZufw.review_text: Alright.. I'm a fan... of the Tuesday's Fried Chicken and Coleslaw sandwich. I had to check out what all the fuss was about and it wasn't so hard since its down the street from the office.  Initial thoughts was that it looked like a normal chicken sandwich. The more fancier version of a Mc-Chicken... And I must apologize that I just put those two sandwiches in the same category.   The chicken was nicely fried to a crisp and the slaw complimented the greasy-ness of the sandwich. It all came together nicely on a nice little bun.   I feel guilty eating that sandwich and must work it off after work today!

0yTadAboOpS-swpJ4kA1QQ.review_text: My coworkers and I had lunch here today.  3 of us had the artisan foie gras/duck prosciutto sandwich.  1 had the beet salad. Service was friendly and the seating area was nice and sunny.    However.  The sandwich was so much better on the wall menu than it was in real life.  The bread was good and crusty.  The truffle salt good.  Duck prosciutto was measly (and I am not a sandwich filling hog I just want something I can taste) and the foie gras was well...just foie gras.  For 15 bucks I want something better than the pitiful paper-wrapped package I got.  Maybe some potato chips would have appeased me, make me feel like I was not totally scammed by this flimsy sandwich that I could have put together myself.   And the beet salad, well it was probably made with 1/2 a beet.    For the fact that they were serving from what looked like the back of a kitchen I feel gypped.  When we got back to work someone from the group would pipe up every now and then and say "Jeez that was such a stickup / Ok but totally not worth the money / etc)

u0dOq2TrwW4sLd8TPAodaQ.review_text: Horrible service and rude staff! They make a fuss over the free self serve water! I would never recommend this place at all. I have to ask if there are even interviews when hiring staff because those people are not friendly at all and are the most rude and they seem to have a problem with everything and take it out on customers! I wish there was an option of not giving any stars at all on Yelp because they do not even deserve one!

YCiIa96Nb4HOUTgdAW1mIg.review_text: I work in the neighborhood and was lucky enough to stumble onto this epic find in a land of over-priced tourist food and italian eateries. (don't get me wrong, I love Italian, but I can't do it more than once every couple of weeks) The first sandwich I had was the salmon sandwich with a fried egg, pickled onions, avocado and a light garlic sauce....and blood orange juice..and I came back the next day...and the next...and the next.  The food is amazing, and the drinks are just as awesome. One of my faves is Coconut fun thyme. It was so delicious, the best I could do was try not to hover around the register, saying "Please sir, can I have some more?"  I love that they change the menu every day, and I must say that the soups that I've had are phenomenal and surprisingly filling.   I don't usually buy sweet tea, but Ryan totally does it right. Not too sweet, just the right hit of cinnamon and citrus to blend with the earthy taste of black tea...and it figures-- he is from the south!  Overall, one of my new favorite places to go for lunch. A bit pricey, but worth every cent.

w5D3YHeYFBh-pqR3pYaO7Q.review_text: This placed is over-hyped! If I could rate the Foie Gras sandwich it would be 3.5 stars. I ad Foie Gras many times before and it always delighted my palette however, this foie gras sandwich did not  It could be because it was just overwhelming with Foie Gras. My girlfriend also ordered the Korean BBQ sandwich and she said it was good but there was no "WOW" factor. We got the Foie Gras, Korean BBQ sandwich and a sweet tea for $27, it was a bit overpriced. Would I come here again? Sadly...no.  Check out Rhea Deli and Market instead!

mR1gI04swOCbouyUHPlcAg.review_text: WTF. Had literally the worst sandwich I've ever had in my life at this place. My boyfriend and I both ordered the famous fried chicken sandwich and it was super nasty. The chicken was fatty dark meat. It was slathered with sauce and coleslaw making the whole thing soggy and sloppy. We each had about 2 bites before walking out. This sandwich pretty much ruined my day.

5JuIY8xT6MnZAfdrpxMByA.review_text: OH MY GOD! The sandwiches are THE BEST in town, in the whole Bay Area in my opinion. They have seasonal sandwiches, My favorite is the Asparagus During the Asparagus season (March or so) ITS A MUST YOU TRY THIS!! TRUST ME IT IS AMAZINNNNG! The Chicken sandwich they have is year round and its unlike anything I've ever tasted in my life. The service is amazing! Everything about this restaurant is AMAZING! HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMEND! 5 STARS!

Ub7_eU6tHduSPQVHdeLDOg.review_text: If you like sandwhiches that are not on the norm than this place is for you. if you are into subway do not come here, but if you like sandwhiches made with figs, or strange vegitables come here.  A bit pricey

aWBEoN92mrHvuOipEpg4pQ.review_text: Just had the pork sandwhich and cinnamon sweet tea. Both excellent and can't wait to try the other creations. Wish they were open on weekends!!

2BVIx-1VWWsD8WBAx5X8WQ.review_text: Fried chicken sandwich is insanely great. Ice tea...too good.

V1eNHdi9Uzgsh2msIovFpg.review_text: naked lunch will always be my favorite place to get a sandwich in SF, hands down.  really delicious sandwiches every time exploding with flavor. Keep up the good work, guys!

jEifVwXXZ8FlGIE_u8uYPg.review_text: Dirty kitchen!!! Nobody sees this but a select few, stay away!! Nasty, I'd rather eat from a high school lunch room than this SHIT HOLE!!!!

bgOjO-HX-7wzUlXeXJJ2pA.review_text: Foie Gras Torchon &amp; Duck Prosciutto Sandwich W/ Heirloom Tomato, Butter Lettuce, &amp; Truffle Oil $15  Fried Chicken Sandwich W/ Creamy Slaw, Pain De Mie $9  Cowgirl Creamery Mt. Tam and Roasted Squash Sandwich W/ Baby Spinach,  D'Anjou Pear, Pickled Onions $8 Add Serrano Ham $10  Chilled Beet Soup Citrus Cream  $5  Corn Cappucino W/ Truffle Oil  $5  Sweet Tea  $2  Salty Dulce de Leche &amp; Thai Iced Tea Ice Creams By Flash Freeze $3  Blackberry and Sage Sorbet By Flash Freeze  $3  Hours Monday to Friday 11.30am - 2.00pm  Menu changes daily .  With this fine weather, a Ferry ride is in order.   Need I say more? Except maybe it looks like puppy will stay home again

08mOpJRCpZe3D8UHszP4FA.review_text: CASH ONLY!  Naked Lunch is open on Sat for lunch.  Walked here from Bart, about 15-20 min.  It's the old Enrico's on Broadway @ Kearny.  There's an ATM inside. I got the Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich Tomato, Butter Lettuce, Black Truffle Salt $15.  I thought it was just ok, did like that it was warm when I got it. Should have gotten the Butter Basted Rock Cod Sandwich (LIMITED) Garlic Aioli, Butter Lettuce, Marinated Cucumber $9 - guy said only 1 left to the people after me, darn it. Blood Orange Blaster $2 - looked good, will try another time.  He made it in the morning. No bathroom available to public, Purell if you need it - ask for it.  Patio to sit out out the door on the Right.  Some counter seats inside the shop. CASH ONLY! website: nakedlunchsf.com

id97cmQmqNJAglcMFbKPaQ.review_text: There was a time when the girl who sat in the cube next to me would ask "want Naked Lunch today?" and I wouldn't be able to turn it down. I rarely had anything bad at Naked Lunch from the duck sandwich to soups and salads. The chiccarones are addictive as is the cinnamon sweet tea. However, I just went there last week and was a little disappointed with the food. The sandwich had too much mayo (aka aioli), the lettuce in the salad was clearly not fresh and brown around the edges, and the soup was kinda bland. Cash only.

w26B2W0n63W6hvGN9c7dng.review_text: I now go nowhere else for lunch tues Thru-Fri. I was so sick of my choices in NB (I know that sounds crazy)....but this place changes the menu every day....so I never have to think...and so far Ive loved every meal Ive eaten here. Service is great....and the outdorr seating makes for great people watching and reading.

dCKYpm0gzc1DJVQwDYwi1A.review_text: It's unfortunate that YELP doesn't allow for zero stars because that is what this place deserves.  1. It shouldn't take 30 minutes to make a cold sandwich when I arrive pre-lunch rush at 11:40am and there are 4-5 people in the kitchen preparing the food. 2. The people who order after me shouldn't receive their food before me, especially when my order is 1 sandwich and their order is 10 sandwiches.  3. The person in the front should look up the definition of customer service. Instead of apologizing, he made excuses.  I don't mind paying $16 dollars for a sandwich, and how it "tastes" can be subjective. But I definitely don't appreciate blatantly bad service!

Rg8PKMeWxS_8oaQNe9KNjA.review_text: FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH! NOMNOMNOM!  i love going here on Tuesdays, it's like the ultimate sandwich spot! There's a reason why they're only open a few hours a day and a few days a week! It's because these guys KNOW how to make a BOMB sandwich; they don't need to be open 24/7! The environment is so chill and the customer service is awesome. I always feel welcomed here, and am never rushed with my order. Even when I leave, I get a free refill! HOW AWESOME IS THAT? They only use the freshest ingredients to makes their foods, and they make everything themselves. The drinks are good too and plus free refills at the end if you're done.   Their fried chicken sandwich is so good, nothing can compare. The buns are toasted just to perfection, and the chicken is so juicy. I usually don't get cole slaw on anything, but for this sandwich I'll sacrifice because it goes so well with the chicken. The ultimate sauce though, is the hot sauce. YOU MUST PUT THAT ON THE SANDWICH, it's like it was meant to be - the hot sauce and the chicken.   The lines are long but when you get your food, it's definitely worth it. I try to get their when they first open, so I don't have to wait. But for their sandwiches it always seems like I play the waiting game. After consuming my sandwich, and celebrating those 20-30 mins of happiness,  I die a little inside just hoping to make it throughout the week so I can have it be Tuesday for another awesome lunch at Naked Lunch again.   Tip(s):-bring cash! I think they have a card fee.  -They're only open from 11:30-2 on the days they open.

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: Having worked in the area for a few years, I can tell ya we needed a place like this.  Naked lunch offers inventive lunch items that are about five steps above your average sandwich place.  You really can't go wrong here.  The services is friendly, too.

_3UUxvN9HAob4TSZXyEM4A.review_text: This place is great. Went with a co-worker last Friday and had the best sandwich in a while. Fresh with just the best ingredients, great bread and good service. It was an egg sandwich, with smoked ham, caramelized onions and spinach. All in good measure, seasoned just right. I did not want it to end. We finished with a salty dulce de leche ice cream!   I hope it stays as good it is right now!

d-5gWThyELEJZdFKUx5Pzg.review_text: As the culinary bar is continually raised, and in an age where everyone is a  "foodie" we see new ideas, concepts, and culinary bells and whistles. And seriously, who isn't a foodie these days? Know how to snap an iPhone picture, know the definition of sous vide, formulate a critique, and voilà you're a foodie with a Yelp page to be read by the masses. I digress.   The concept at Naked Lunch is a novel idea bringing higher end meats and proteins with other fresh organic ingredients to create fine gourmet sandwiches. The headliner on the lineup is the Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich with Heirloom Tomato, Butter Lettuce, and Black Truffle Salt at $16. To accompany my "foodie" feast between a sliced, crusty Acme roll I ordered the Melon Agua Fresca at $3.  The Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich tasted better as I read it in chalk on the blackboard menu than as I devoured it bite by bite. Don't get me wrong, it was a good sandwich but it seriously read better than it tasted especially at a $16. At such a price point and with such ingredients you would expect high level execution and taste. While good, the sandwich could've been better on many levels. The first thing I noticed was the odd, jelly-like consistency of the foie gras torchon. I would've liked it to be more of a pâté consistency, and left me yearning for a traditional Banh Mi sandwich with liver pâté ($3.50 at Saigon Sandwich. The duck proscuitto was tasty but the serving was small, and it left me yearning for a Prosciutto Sandwich ($6 for a small) from the sandwich institution of North Beach, Freddie's Sandwiches. The sandwich was also sporadically overly salty at times which may have been a function of the truffle salt.   The Melon Agua Fresca was different from most every version I've had before. This was not the dressed up, leftover juice of melon cutting you find elsewhere. The agua fresca here was a frothy cup of melon goodness with purée of melon accented with what seemed to be vanilla and/or cinnamon. A bit sweet for my taste, but it was the best agua fresca I had ever.  I'd like to go back to Naked Lunch to try out their soup creations, the Salty Dulche de Leche Ice Cream (from a third party vendor), and the Fried Chicken Sandwich on Tuesdays, but I feel this is more of a new fad place than the start of an institution. To reflect on my previous digression we live in a new age of food where all you need is to mention foie gras or truffled, and the masses will come streaming in and sigh your praises. With this being said, we sometimes lose the simplicity and more importantly the soul that good food has.   I could be wrong about this place, and I do like the new culinary bells and whistles at times. But you can keep your $16 foie and prosciutto sando for now while I indulge on a $3.50 banh mi from Saigon Sandwich, a $6 prosciutto sando from Freddie's, and still have enough left over for a nice IPA and a bag of sea salt & vinegar kettle chips.

ak3cYyd1ol_IsZAAZtBBYw.review_text: So this is an update about the best sandwich I've even had in my life.  Whenever they have the Braised Short Rib Sandwich you have to get it.  It is so tender and flavorful.  I love how the slices of beef are tender but they don't fall apart so it seems like you are eating a super tender steak sanwich.  I fell in love with this at first bite and has now claimed my number 1 spot of all of their sandwiches.  To me, the sandwich was so good that I kept making moaning sounds at my desk.  It felt like I needed to be in a private place but it was that good.  The only thing is that it gets very messy.  You need lots of napkins because the juice will be running down your hands.  I really want to go back for another one but only one does not sufice.  So yeah when it's on the menu, get it, it is so amazing.

R13wkg1QRn-B1PijC5XTuQ.review_text: The food here is nothing short of epic.  I had the Fulton Valley Farms Grilled Chicken Sandwich for $8 and it was the best decision I've made in a long time. I signed on to Yelp for the deliberate purpose of giving this place 5 stars because I am STILL thinking about how good the sandwich was. EVERYONE needs to give this place a try.  You guys rock!

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: As Thomas Keller writes, "The best thing about foie gras is that it's just that - foie gras. It's a luxury on its own."  So why they feel the need to pair it with duck prosciutto, truffle salt, and other things is beyond me. Foie gras (or liver in general) really just needs something sweet or fruity to go with it, and nothing else. The last thing I want is more salt though, even if it's truffle salt.  Definitely disappointing, would have thought that two former restaurant chefs would know more about how to let ingredients speak for themselves.

kIzt9Ob7ENH9vhPFAbpfIA.review_text: The Devil created the McChicken sandwich.  GOD created NL's Chicken sandwich.  ITS SANDWICH! NOT SANDWHICH!  (pet peeve)

VnuUzsULiau-7UXsJTfmig.review_text: I initially gave this place a raving review but recently have become really frustrated with it. Literally half the time I go there, I can't get what I want because they change their menu so much. And when they are serving something good, another reason pops up as to why I can't get it. One time I went there, and they had a "special" menu of all thai food, ew. Another time they were closed for a private event (thanks for posting that small detail on your website). They don't serve french fries at lunch time (makes no sense, like that's hard to make). They run out of supplies, "sorry we are out of figs, but we can substitute pears instead." I hate pears no thanks. What good is good food when it's so hard to get. Stop trying to be a trendy hipster place and just serve people what they want, jesus.  AND THEN...one time I come in for a late dinner. Mid meal the dude interrupts me and hands me a paper plate and asks if I wouldn't mind using it so they can clear my dish. "Sorry the dishwasher really wants to go home." ummm ok. Sure I'll use a paper plate, what the hell? so ghetto. Dishwashers definitely should take priority of your paying customers. Or just let the dude go home and wash the dish yourself buddy, let me eat in peace.

CveaC8QXi5Toje4Cay-3Ng.review_text: The "artisan foie gras torchon & duck prosciutto sandwich" is way overrated.  Overly salted and overpriced at $16 leaves me appreciating only the bread. I was very hungry when I ate this which usually means that whatever I end up eating will seem like ambrosia.  Alas, even in my deprived-state, this sandwich did nothing.  Plus, they only take cash, are located in the ghetto, have no sign (look for Enrico at the corner of Kearny and Broadway...Naked Lunch is the restaurant below) and I think the servers might be a touch retarded (the guy had to write down an order five times before getting it right...really?? really?!!!!)  End conclusion? San Francisco "foodies" see "artisan" and lose all sense of "good."

SEoduTSekk-lI3EYH6zA3w.review_text: Don't need to say much, everything I have tried here has been excellently executed.

bRYbDgY_Fo3a1XthliDXfQ.review_text: This joint is just TOO good! My office is nearby so my coworkers and I came here once at week at one point.   Their staple fried chicken sandwich is the bomb diggity. They also have a pescatarian and vegetarian sandwich option, as well as a soup or salad. Each ingredient in a dish is meticulously curated to play a part in a yummy orchestra. Even the french fries are coated in a special Pimentón spice and the olives are spiced with fennel and star anise to make something ordinary taste extraordinary.   Everything on their menu is a hit and I never disliked anything although I may prefer some dishes over others.  Service is quick - you order and pay at the bar and the friendly server will bring the food to your seat.The venue is spacious with lots of indoor/outdoor seating and has a pool table and indoor basketball hoop arcade. This is a great spot for lunch although I'm curious to try their happy hour!

8p-kv82J5uP3583thTPa4Q.review_text: The bottom line: Pricey gourmet sandwiches, no table service, but Enrico's Tables. Quick Bite!  So I'm looking on Yelp and seeing something called "Naked Lunch". Hmmmm its on Broadway... is the strip club hosting a buffet lunch? I know I know it might sound perverted but Naked Lunch, you know strip clubs naked women and a buffet lunch at the strip club right?  WRONG - it is next to strip clubs, but done out of Enrico's Kitchen along with their outdoor seating. You go inside, the menu is simple, on the blackboard, 5 or 6 selections only. Its a bit pricey at 10-15 dollars a sandwich, but they're not just any sammie. Mine had Foie Gras and bacon in it. My friends had huge chunks of salmon. It turned out it was somewhat worth the cost of a 15 dollar sandwich.   I would say come here on a nice day or get your sandwich to go. The price could be a bit cheaper, but hey everything is kind of expensive, including Enricos

l0PYkotRgNgz4ZqAjGFzPg.review_text: I decided to indulge in what could be a great sandwich guilty pleasure (its $16!). I tried the illustrious Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich. While it was tasty, it was somewhat salty, likely because of the rich ingredients. The sandwich was upon a soft, not chewy Acme Bread roll, which held up very well. The foie gras was layered on surprisingly thick and the duck prosciutto is what added the extra layer of salt. Duck prosciutto is much softer, silkier and tenderer than the traditional type.  The sandwich was delicious, yet is better to be shared. A whole sandwich was just too rich and too everything for me. It would be good to trade halves with someone else and order an alternative sandwich. The cinnamon sweet tea was awesome, but the highlight of my lunch was the 4505 Chicharrones! These chicharrones were so crispy but melted when they touched your tongue. Slightly spicy, slightly sweet, these were by far the best chicharrones I've ever had, period.   Although the location is small, there a outside, covered patio area next door that they use. Great for people watching, and they will bring you your food. I just wish they were open on Sundays.

RDTVzWPoCeGaUujrHIWRBQ.review_text: Ahhh Naked Lunch, I miss you!  Now that I am no longer staying in North Beach on my work from home days, I don't get to visit Naked Lunch as frequently as I'd like.  I've never had anything here that I didn't like.  The food is always unique and creative with great flavor combinations.  Their Thai Iced Tea ice cream cup is a very special treat.  On my most recent visit (which was a few months back), I had some variety of a pulled pork sandwich that knocked my socks off.  It's cash only, so come prepared.  Very limited seating area (although now that Enrico's has closed, maybe those tables are also an option?)  But I love sitting out in the sun, waiting for my order to come up.  Service is always friendly and prompt.  Naked Lunch, I hope to be reunited with you soon!

UQ6SHvkTz0ekf2EK4217Bw.review_text: My colleague at work recommended Naked Lunch. I tried the fried chicken sandwich that was topped with coleslaw and a garlic aioli. The sandwich had  a crispy and well seasoned fried chicken filet that was complimented by the garlic aioli and slaw. In my opinion their fried chicken sandwich tastes better than BakeSale Betty's. But BakeSale Betty wins on size of the sandwich, as Naked Lunch's sandwich was small and probably a healthier portion size. The sandwich was $8. I give the sandwich a solid 4 out of 5 stars. I loved the sandwich and the only reason that I took a star away was just because of the portion size, but I would order it again.   I also had the Yukon potato and garlic soup. The soup was creamy, frothy, and just so-so. The description on the menu sounded better than the soup really was. The cost $6.  I give the soup 2.5 stars. You can skip the soup.  I washed down my fried chicken sandwich with the cinnamon sweet tea. The sweet tea was tasty, sweet, tangy, with a hint of cinnamon flavor. A few of my fellow co-workers also had the sweet tea and we all agreed that it was a big hit. The cinnamon sweet tea is $2 and I give it a whopping 5 stars.   In closing, Naked Lunch is not the only thing that is naked in San Francisco's red-light strip club district. The restaurant's Fried Chicken Sandwich was a crispy, crunchy, poultry treat and highly recommended. I also recommend the cinnamon sweet tea, but do not recommend the yukon gold potato soup with garlic (i know, it sounds so good, but just failed to hit the mark at $6).

1l3g8Jo_8TJCaSL1Vd7kxg.review_text: I love this place.  The food is always good, and it is the perfect kind of place to go and have a relaxed lunch. As a lunch spot I would say this is top 5 within walking distance of FiDi.    They always are serving a healthy option as well, which makes it an easier sell when half the group wants a fried chicken sandwich and the other half are counting calories.  The only bad part about this place is that it suffers from what I call the "Chik-Fil-A tragedy", which is that the one day the place is closed (in this case Mondays) inevitably is the day that you are in the mood for a fried chicken sandwich and try going there, only to be met with closed doors.

xDqGPRY2nTRGWvuDH85mgA.review_text: In all the Ginsberg and Kerouac in this danged neighborhood, it's nice to finally find a place referencing Burroughs. I'd heard rumors that they had an awesome chicken sandwich, so I had to try it. Deep fried chicken breast on a bed of coleslaw with an amazing bun. I slathered it with Crystal hot sauce.  The thing that made me a fan is what I DIDN'T eat. Homemade Chicharrones? Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich? Fuyu Persimmon & Chevre Sandwich? Why am I on a budget? I really really want that duck proscuitto sandwich. The offerings are never the same, so I am going to have to come back here a lot to find out when they are going to have that on the menu again. .

7z4aymWihntyPqRikJqnfA.review_text: I came here because of the yelp reviews, but I have to say that i found the food overpriced and hit and miss. The salmon sandwich was served nearly raw with the skin still on. I ended up throwing the sandwich away.   I usually do not let a first experience dictate a review, but when the customer behind me was as disappointed as I was, it might be a trend. However, I shall give it another go with another menu item, as it might have been a new cook.   The service was average too, but again, will revisit and let you know.

MJK8c2oPTxv-tqjjr5KhVg.review_text: Ok...So every Tuesday I wake up in the AM and ask myself "Tuesday?" and "How much $$ I have?"....Then, "Chicken Sandwich at La Naked Lizunch?"  Yes, it is freakin good and yes it is fried...Perfect combination of high quality chicken fried to perfection with a perfect buttery bun with a perfect blend of cold slaw type of topping...Yes, it is PERFECT...  Have not tried any other sandwiches but come on, I'm convinced after having that one special sandwich, the place can't go wrong...  It is pricey however for a 'wich so be prepared to spend mula and be sure to call in your order ahead of time...line can get long...  Enjoy this one rascals!

Xn9tMywAs5Vif0JLbxclTQ.review_text: Finally,  a creative lunch place in the neighborhood.  The people are really nice.  The foie gras sandwich can't be good for your health or your pocketbook, but it was sure tasty.  I didn't want it to end. The next day I had a shrimp mousse sandwich and it was almost as good.  The next day I had the cold cut sandwich and it was a bit too raw. I only tried the cooler once, but it was good.  It had plum and basil and some other stuff.  There have been days when the cooler sounds quite interesting, but I will keep on trying them.  Eating on the patio is a nice touch.  The chairs are big, comfortable, and great for watching strippers head to work.  Minus one star for being too expensive for me to enjoy everyday.   Plus four stars for being good at everything else.

_qY8U7QYq6LzkHbyxUy6xg.review_text: I work a couple blocks away and was stoked about finding a new, delicious-looking lunch spot! I called in my order and appreciated the friendly customer service both on the phone, and in the restaurant! The gentlemen working the bar honestly made the experience very pleasant. The establishment is spacious, clean, and appears to be a fun hang out spot (although I'm never in the strip-club area haha!)  The chicken sandwich was so tasty! The Iced Tea was nothing out of this world, but still refreshing on a warm day.  The reasons for deduction of two stars: *I felt the chicken sandwich was a little small, but I decided that the quality made up for the size and price.   *What really pissed me off was the size of the soup. The second time I returned to explore the menu, I decided to try the soup (I don't remember which one it was exactly since the menu changes; maybe the creamy asparagus?) I paid, grabbed my to-go bag, and when I got back to the office, pulled out a SMALL coffee cup, 2/3 full of soup....I know I paid over 7-8 dollars for it....not ok....   Co-workers and I were looking at each other laughing, wondering if that was a joke.  I'm willing to try this place again. But some places need to understand that just because you make good food, doesn't mean you can serve them in pigeon portions.

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: Pleasantly surprised on my first visit. Amazing fried chicken sandwich and cool North Beach I-don't-give-a-fuck vibe.

7vXq-tFtxkQZcE8JBkYsnA.review_text: Fried Chicken is yum! My goodness, yes I adore anything fried but this chicken is delicious and turned me into a food zombie after I ate it. Luscious butter lettuce on soft bread that turned me into a carb slave and as I write my mouth waters to taste bread, chicken and lettuce from Naked Lunch.  Staff mad skills too; no register just her summing everything in her head with accuracy and keeping her cool as more and more hungry customers lined up. Although it was almost 2pm still a long line for lunch. I must remember to bring my smart phone there is a wait to get your yummy food but very much worth it. My sandwich was juicy; dark meat and sauce mu-ah!

X6FILzWJ83X39hiydbVV5Q.review_text: I went there on the last day before foie gras was banned. Waited in line even before the store opened and had such a high expectation since I went there the day before and they sold out of the duck proschiutto and foie sandwich. Pricy but I'll pay extra for food... So took a bite and thought um... Okay... Alright... Nothing's special and regretted my last meal before the foie was banned from the entire land of San Francisco

xV0zwASagIV-5wqMZZF_XQ.review_text: I came here for lunch today and had the best steak sandwich I've ever had! This is the first time I've had an $11 sandwich that I thought was worth it. Everything was fresh, and the steak was done perfectly. The people who work here are very friendly and polite. I might not come if I were in a huge hurry, but I'll definitely be back for lunch again. I'm looking forward to trying their other sandwiches. Be prepared, they are cash only.

DjXEUA6ltpOCgzy3Q8D_xg.review_text: Chicken fight!! Chicken fight!!! Chicken fight!!!  Ok there isn't really a fight nor is it just chicken. More like Fried Chicken Sandwich, conflict.  Over the past few weeks I've had some pretty good fried chicken (sandwiches included). There was BakeSale Betty's, Ad Hoc and now I add Naked Lunch to my list of Bay Area fried chicken hot spots!  We had the day off yesterday and the only thing I kept thinking yesterday morning was...It's Tuesday &  FINALLY I can get my hands on a Naked Lunch fried chicken sandwich. I didn't care that I just had fried chicken the night before @Ad Hoc. There would be nothing that stopped me from visiting Naked Lunch. Except the gf....oh wait she was down to go too. So we're good.   We get there @11:45. There wasn't a serious line there. More like 3 people waiting and a few patrons already eating.   Looking behind the register I saw a big bag of Acme Bread on the prep table. That is cool because Acme Bread is a staple in our house, so the good vibes began to flow. We placed our order for 2 chicken sandwiches and some Cinnamon Tea. The clerk was very nice and really cool, explained to me exactly how she makes her tea(which I will attempt) and even offered us a refill if we wanted one, while waiting on our order. Refill really?! SLLLLLLUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr­rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrpppp-p-p-P-p...sip sip. I'll take that refill now. Sorry to be greedy but that tea is WOWZA and I mean really really WOWZA!  With it being a small place I can see it getting packed but they are pretty efficient and do a great job of getting orders in & out. Haven't seen that kind of efficiency except from Willy Wonka Oompha Loopa's. Too bad they didn't have a cool song too?!  We got our order pretty quickly and decided to take it to go. Finally got to sink my teeth into their sandwich. First I tried it with no hot sauce. This is a good sandwich, not as crisp in some places because of the slaw but still good. Tried it with the sauce (by the way they get SUPER BONUS pts for giving us hot sauce without even asking for it....did I mention it's Crystal's?!). With the sauce even yummier!!   Loved the flavor of the chicken and to wash it all down with that cinnamon ice tea.....yeah that put me in fried chicken sandwich heaven. I feel like I could literally taste the LOVE they put into making it.   I've come to find that there are some special fried chicken/fried chicken sandwich spots in the bay. The good ones have their own special way of doing things and put a lot of LOVE into their product. Naked Lunch falls under that category. I like BakeSale Betty's but I like Naked Lunch too. I'm just glad....CORRECTION...blessed to live in a area that offers multiple great options and plan on exploring these options over and over again.   2 sandwiches and 2 teas(with 2 refills) for 20 bucks even-steven is a very great deal for the quality of food & service you're getting.

fxSCIV1Ha8HbZgemAvUWug.review_text: My staff and I were in SF for a catering job, and decided to head to Naked Lunch for a bite at the end of our work day, which was just at the end of lunch service.  We each had a chicken sandwich at the bar and Chef Ian came out to sit and chat with us as we ate.  Firstly, the sandwiches were scrumptious!  Even the finickiest eater in our group was enamored with this marvelous combo of crisp, juicy hot chicken, creamy slaw, chewy bread.  We were all swooning over our lunch.  Chef Ian himself, was very charming and thoughtful.  Our meal was satisfying and delicious, and our experience was fantastic.  Thanks Naked Lunch for a great finish to our trip to SF!

K9UCL5zroxiczuS4iZTSNw.review_text: I've only tasted the salad, which is good, but nothing to write home about.  It said it contained avocado, but it was really just avocado sludge.

5xyhV0AScRmprjRQ97mBJA.review_text: I went here on St. Patricks day, and the incredibly douchey bartender made quite a terrible impression. The bar had about 12 people in it (not busy at all), and I asked the tall bearded bartender if I could try an (ONE!) IPA, and he said, "well allllright, but it will be like 5 minutes", and rudely turned around to help other people. I was shocked and my friend and I swore he must be changing the keg or something... Five minutes later he came back and asked if I still wanted to try (like how you ask a toddler something) the IPA or if I would just order it. I said i'd still like to try, and he said "well, now these girls are ready to order, so it'll be awhile" and walked away again.  I'm not exagerating, he was 3 feet from the IPA tap, and it was not a biggie for me to ask to try it.  Yes, it was st. patricks day. Yes, I was wearing green. No, I was not hammered and undeserving of decent behavior.

kuRZJ2Xa6JDPVVXdlt6DJA.review_text: Fried chicken sandwich on Tuesday. You must eat this. These guys are super friendly and serve of some food love and quality.

ZSUg9VNz150bLHEYGc6GQw.review_text: I walked on Broadway with a heavy heart, understanding that my destination would upset Princess Carewee.  The voices from the fancy girls of Broadway enticed me like the Sirens did Odysseus. Some were singing songs of bargains, while others were humming the melodies of lust. But my resolve was firm and my will was strong. I was going to see Mary, and only Mary.  I looked into my wallet. I had eight $1 bills. That alone would suffice, but I always bring an extra $2 for Mary. I know she appreciates the little extra tip. I looked over my shoulder one last time and walked into the establishment that was my destination.   I nodded to the bartender and ordered a shot of whiskey. I casually asked for Mary and he smiled. The bartender knew Mary well, and said she needed 10 minutes to prepare herself. I grunted at the notion of having to wait for her, but inside, I was delighted knowing that Mary would freshen up herself for me.  Mary appeared before me almost in the nude. She was lightly dressed with cole slaw and a thin coat of crispy flour. Her large breast overwhelmed the two pieces of Pain de Mie that barely held them in. I tried to appear composed, but my saliva betrayed me. I was excited.  I pulled Mary into me. As I put my lips closer, a rush of anticipation took over. I can imagine her. Her enticing aroma, her welcoming appearance, her succulent touch and...... a pang of guilt.  What would Princess Carewee think? She would be decimated by jealousy. I stepped away from Mary and sent Princess Carewee a message.  "Yo I'm at Naked Lunch eating the Mary's Farm Fried Chicken Sandwich without you. I'll bring you here next time if you promise to read all my Yelp reviews ok?"  Feeling much better, I returned to my intimate moment with Mary ;)

lIM5d1HsNmdkn9LzV8gKNw.review_text: For clarification ...  1) The Naked Lunch is not a strip club, even though it's next to several strip clubs, and has the word 'naked' in it's name.   2) The Naked Lunch is not a restaurant. It's a night club that opens it's kitchen during the day. You sit at the night club's outdoor tables (next door) when you dine.   3) You won't find a menu here, just a chalk board with at least 3 sandwich options (veggie, sweet, and savory)  4) Cash only.  5) No soda machine.   6) Not sure why this place is considered 'not kid friendly' walked up with my enormous stroller and felt no sense of awkwardness.  Now on to the food ...  I shared the $18 duck sandwich with my husband and for an $18 sandwich, I'd say they packed closer to $50 worth of foie gras on this baguette. The salty squishy slab of foie gras paired well with the dry chewy texture of the duck prosciutto. Then the tomato and lettuce cooled it all off and balanced out the sandwich quite well.

DQQHR9lLcLuHVCfrHvKioQ.review_text: I did not eat here.   Had a drink with my boys. Fair prices. Young scene when we were there.   The basket ball game thing was way out of place. Is this a Dave and Busters?

EeTEFv6pbcCDU0DLP50XRw.review_text: We arrived there at about 11, too early for lunch, so we took the opportunity to walk around the block to do a little...uhm...sightseeing.  Naked Lunch is just a stone's throw away from Hustler, and other like entertainment venues.  It's probably usually hopping at night, but it was pretty dead there in the afternoon.  We got back to the restaurant at around 11:20, waited outside, and started to get razzed by a man who clearly had some unresolved issues.   Thankfully, we were allowed in the restaurant early, and the issue-filled man moved his attention to other bystanders and anyone else that walked in front of the restaurant.    Safely esconced in the little itty bitty restaurant (cafe?), we ordered the foie gras-duck prosciutto sandwich and the chorizo-egg sandwich.  Both were absolutely delicious.  I have never had foie gras in sandwich form, so it felt both casual and indulgent at the same time.  The egg sandwich is not as decadent, but, dare I say, I liked it better.  Not the biggest fan of chorizo, but they sliced the chorizo very thinly so the flavor didn't overwhelm the egg sandwhich.  The star of the sandwich -- the egg -- was perfect: fresh, cooked over-medium.  The carmelized onions were a nice added touch.  The place is, no doubt, pricey (cash only).  But the sandwiches are good.  The folks who work there were very nice, and the man behind the counter remained pleasant despite the fact that someone stole their cash register the night before.  We opted to eat inside the restaurant which was small, and only had a few stools.  Many others opted to eat outside at Enrico's next door, which we would have done had we known we could, and if we were not being harassed by the man with issues.  I hope the next time I'm back to SF Naked Lunch is still around.  I'm already looking forward to trying out their other sandwich creations.

w4v_umMwvFCmNdC69Y7RSA.review_text: Tried the famed chicken sandwich and what a disappointment! Dark meat, greasy, lacking flavor...there is also a limited beverage selection during the lunch hour. Friendly staff and nice location/space but not worth a return...

fzRlihqWivPIefkyPL-ISg.review_text: The beets in the salad were delicious.  I've been hearing about this chicken sandwich for awhile, but it must have been overhyped.  The chicken is dark meat and didn't look or taste appetizing.  Everything else on the sandwich was terrific including the roll.  But I didn't enjoy it because I was kind of grossed out by the chicken.  In some photos online the chicken looks like it breaded fluffy, so I'm wondering if they changed the recipe and are using a lesser quality chicken these days.   I'm hoping to try some other things on the menu.  The burger sounds good.  I also plan on going to hang out at the bar because it looks fun, so perhaps I'll just go for the drinks and fun in the future.  Broadway could use some more bars like this one.

JA675BvcF7K1B_B3bZTRfA.review_text: Who knew that Peach and Basil sorbet could be so amazing?!?

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: Fried chicken sandwich is one of the best I've ever had. I like to pile on the Crystal hot sauce and get dirty eating this satisfying sandwich. Their cinnamon iced tea is refreshing and best of all, free refills while you're there so take advantage of it!  I loved their foie gras duck prosciutto sandwich before they banned foie gras. I miss the foie gras days.....

ZcrmkuKC34E9UNVfJhJ8Gw.review_text: My favorite fried chicken sandwich!! (Bakesale Betty's is a close second). It's a fried chicken thigh with a creamy slaw on a soft roll - perfect with Crystal hot sauce on every bite. The cinnamon iced tea is sweet and refreshing, with free refills. Parking in this area is impossible, but it's worth it.

CKE7bImVY81KJD8PiiuDPQ.review_text: Holy moly. This is amazing. I read about this on DailyCandy, Thrillist, Flavorpill and send it to my boyfriend who ate there first. He had the grilled cheese and his friend got the fois gras. He told me that they couldn't stop grunting in pleasure. Yesterday, I got my moment too. I had the butternut squash sandwich and it was just too good. I need that recipe. I need to have it more often. It was just superb. The people who work there are so nice too. It was a lovely afternoon to sit in the sun and enjoy one of the best sandwiches ever.

1oLpFu6lvmw494GtXkPtkg.review_text: This place has been on my "to try" list for a while, and last week, I finally experienced the pleasure.  I was in SF for a quick visit up from LA, and staying in Mission/Noe Valley.  Headed to NB so I could finally check out Naked Lunch, and was so happy to have done so!  Just booked a return trip in a handful of weeks so my husband can come enjoy.  That good.  The salmon was perfectly poached, the mizuna greens perfectly dressed.  The basil lemonade amazing - not too sweet.  Very friendly service, and it was obvious the food was prepared with much care.

ePY4FMzYvu0QVAeSLeHf3w.review_text: FINALLY! I got to try their famous fried chicken sandwich! It was amazing with the buttery "Pain De Mie" (bread) with garlic aioli (my favorite), buttermilk coleshaw and of course the CHICKEN! It wasn't a big ol' fried chicken inside, it was pieces of moist and juicy fried goodness! The line gets a bit long to order but goes by quickly. I also tried their cinnamon sweet tea and its delicious. Free refills too so that's a plus.   In addition, I tried the "Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich." It was very salty and this sandwich reconfirmed my dislike of foie gras. I loved the bread (which is from Acme). Very expensive sandwich ($16).  Ingredients are fresh and I look forward to coming here for their fried chicken sandwich with an order of cinnamon sweet tea!

EEBcB3Sm8LDASwBeu8UKsA.review_text: 1/27/11 Had the Rock Cod today.  Easily the best fried fish sandwich I've ever had.  Generous piece of moist and flaky cod, lightly battered and fried.  A touch greasy, but in that evil-good way.  2/03/11 Braised Lamb Shoulder Sandwich - the rich tender braised lamb was coated in a sauce made up of the lingering braising liquid and mint pesto.  Nice outer sear on some end pieces made for some good texture balance.  Damn good.  Shooting for brevity on sandwich reviews from here on out since this place already got close to 10, 000 words of praise from me.  (Did you know the max # of characters allowed on a yelp review is 5001?)

HorQ90eiUPfnesQlIraaJA.review_text: Thank you Naked Lunch for your 1 year chicken sammy lunch pricing today. one half off the fried chicken sandwich, normally $8, was $4 today.   I had been waiting to try this but considering my current fiscal situation, $8 lunch was just a wee bit too much. So my prayers were answered.  The bun was perfection, soft, and glossy.  The chicken was perfectly fried. I would maybe have liked a double portion of the coleslaw on top, but who am I to complain on half price day?  Once I get a job, I'll be getting this again and trying the $15 fois gras sammy.

SqAsyuxCCufXWsV9Z9aJUg.review_text: Loved this place! The waitstaff was super friendly and the food was yummy. Just taking off one star bc my brussel sprout sandwich, while delicious, was a bit too greasy. I'll still be back though! Can't wait to go when I have some time to kill because I will slay it on their skee ball machine!

iY6kcazlSZKYxOvDbJ652w.review_text: Uh oh, I think I just added a new spot to my lunch rotation (and possibly a happy hour hangout)! I was getting tired of my usual haunts for lunch, and decided to venture out to North Beach with a friend to see what the hub-bub was about this fried chicken sandwich. Not huge on ordering fried anything but from time to time I'll nix my rule for something worthy, and believe me, THIS was worthy!  We walked into the bar and ordered our sandwiches. $9 for that is just awesome - especially when everything else in SF is so overpriced. We noticed it was full of old furniture, which was cool because it felt like old SF, a bunch of arcade games, and a couple TVs as well. Both of us immediately thought, let's come back for happy hour! Dive bars are lots of fun, and this one has plenty of seating inside and outside for those rare nice SF days.  We got our sandwiches, which were huge, delicious, and well-seasoned.
