The sweetness of the coleslaw helped to tame the saltiness of the chicken, and the bun wasn't too big or dense - just perfect. Definitely messy, so be ready to get your hands dirty, but it's oh so delicious! I will be back here the next chance I get to try other items on the menu, but I might just have to get the fried chicken sandwich again for "good measure".

-8ZM-jzJEGkKCxYEJnFrqQ.review_text: Yum and yum. Today I had the roasted salmon sandwich and asparagus salad w/ manchego and Meyer lemon.  Awesome.  The guys that work there are super nice.  The only drawback is that I can't spend $20 on lunch every day.  Because I so would.

ASrb1t1ufOKeKzk4e7hWrQ.review_text: You MUST try their Chicken Sandwich.  The sandwich was juicy yet crunchy, filling and not overly heavy, and worth every bite.  They serve this beauty only on Tuesdays, so be sure to visit then if it's your first time!

ZCyqVnPSHkMZ92PTncoIXA.review_text: Just finished vacuuming up a fresh salmon sandwich and a heirloom tomato soup from Naked Lunch.  I'd consider this place to be similar to Sentinel -- great fresh sandwiches and other lunchey/foodie items -- both are pricey but you get what you pay for.  If you want a 5 dollar lunch, go to Lee's Deli.  If you're feeling more like $10-20 today, you'll be happy here.  Minus one star for being in an relatively inconvenient location, minus a half star for being pricey, plus a half star for being able to sit on the patio at Enrico's next door to enjoy your delicious heirloom tomato soup and salmon sandwich.

Tf5cKL2LMI2EaM9MBFAaOA.review_text: As an upstairs neighbor, I fully endorse and support Naked Lunch. When my friend first contacted them about offering vegan options, they were gracious and eager to help out. Since then, we've stopped by on nearly a weekly basis to grab a sammy for lunch.   Although it's never on the menu, you can always request a vegan sandwich and they are always happy to oblige. These aren't some sad-sack consolation-prize vegan sandwiches, either- this is some seriously delicious, gourmet nosh. I still remember my very first Naked Lunch sandwich- thinly sliced apples, toasted almond slivers, arugula, and sauteed onions so soft and flavorful I almost brought the sandwich back because I thought it was butter! They even went the extra mile of stocking vegan mayo.   Don't even get me started on the drinks- the cinnamon sweet tea is ridiculously addictive, but the rare and elusive coconut lime cooler is really where it's at. On a recent hot day, someone came in with one and I FLIPPED. MY. SH*T. I whipped our whole office into a frenzy and ended up buying a whole quart of it.   Also, did I mention the people that run/work Naked Lunch are SUPER friendly and wonderful and nice? They are the coolest.  The only reason I give this four stars instead of five (or A MILLION) is because they serve foie gras sandwiches and everyone knows that foie gras makes baby kittens cry.

9xi0QUx4e-HCMO1FifqDgg.review_text: What? What? A total hidden gem away from the tourist craziness of Columbus and North Beach?   Yes...I love this neighborhood gem for 3 reasons:  1- Awesome food. Limited menu means everything is good. Always order the soup. Don't even bother asking the flavor. Just get it..trust me.  2- Super friendly staff. Even though it's pretty much self-serve. You order at the bar and get utensils from a side table. I like how the staff comes around to make sure you like everything and there are no problems.   3- Dog friendly!!!!! Super dog friendly patio. Thank you for accommodating the furry members of the family. Poodles especially like the fried chicken sandwich.

6in4OJrKAbAU9_VO3p_syQ.review_text: I went here after hearing all the hype about the food and the expanded location.  At first I was set on trying the fried chicken sandwich everyone was talking about but then opted to be healthy. Maybe this is why I was a little disappointed.  I ordered the apple and cheese sandwich which came with green apple slices, cheese, arugula and honey.  To be it was a little dry and lacking in flavor.  I took a bite of my boyfriends chicken sandwich but not enough to really get an idea of the true flavor.  On a positive note though we were able to site outside on a gorgeous day and the service was very friendly.    I will be back for happy hour, their beers on draft and to shoot some hoops.

D5KrVZAM1bDeTkSai5W4xQ.review_text: MMMMM DIS SAMMICH IZ DELISHIS NOM NOM NOM NOM  I don't usually go for sandwiches, but that part of me gets shoved out of the way as soon as I walk into Naked Lunch.  I've been a number of times and I'm never disappointed.  There's always something new, everything is well thought out and seasonal, and the ingredients' quality speaks for itself.  It seems like they put just us much care into these sandwiches as a chef at a special occasion restaurant would put into a dish that would cost at least twice as much.  If you still have room for it, don't miss out on the amazing ice cream!

UsvYnHz5M6jJh01mGUWYzA.review_text: The number one thing I miss about my old job was its proximity to this place.   The chicken sandwich is the best I've had anywhere. I now work in Oakland where everyone is all "OMG Bakesale Betty" which pales in comparison. The chicken at Naked Lunch is crisp but not crunchy, the bread is soft. a little hot sauce. yum. it's just perfect. I miss it so.  Honorable mentions: seared tuna with a fried egg (or really anything with a  fried egg), short rib, pig & fig. Portions are Just Enough. There's usually a meaty sandwich, a veggie one, and a soup. They make their own drinks as well, and they are always fresh and tasty.  I once ordered the foie gras sandwich. "Foodwise" I felt it was a little too advanced for me. "Otherwise" I felt a little dirty afterward. It was really decadent and it should maybe come with a cigarette. If you're the kind of hussy who eats foie gras at lunchtime, you should go and get this sandwich. It's just kind of a lot to take in, with the daylight and the rest of the workday and all that.

JC99U5y-KAchZIjBhf_DiQ.review_text: The chick at the counter had her nose up in the air, and had the aura of "I'm better than you, and you wait on my time frame." For example, my friend and I ordered our sandwiches on the first ticket, and he paid for my meal as it was my birthday. Then I wanted to order another sandwich, which I was going to pay for. The chick however had me wait for everyone else in line to order first because "they were hear first." Service not great, and not worth the trouble for some snobby sandwiches.  That being said: friend chicken sandwich was juicy, flavorful and not greasy. I like that. Foie gras sandwich was underwhelming. I think I would have preferred them to seer the foie gras first.   I don't know if I'll ever return. People need to check their attitudes before working. You wouldn't be doing so well if it weren't for your customers.

XdL2yMu0ZqF1d-dHZtCrBg.review_text: Liked the tea a LOT! Fish sandwich okay.  Chicken sandwich was good but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to get here.   Good find If you are in the neighborhood and need a quick lunch.

h2u6zWZSAnwVg28I2AmPZw.review_text: Had the burger for lunch at it was fantastic.  Friendly staff. Great beer

J74LahNA2VsmpTQpYPTneg.review_text: Seriously.  Worth a trip to North Beach mid-day.  Especially on a Tuesday.  Especially while I'm unemployed and my man is buying.  And even if not all or some of those things.  The fried chicken sandwich. . .I can't explain it. Just go eat one. You won't regret it.  We also had celery root soup with apples and bacon. Gah.  And a sandwich with ricotta and asparagus and aioli and lemony drippy goodness.  After I was done eating, I felt like I could eat the same meal again. Immediately. True sign of goodness.

pZG_1SM9vnNxZ9mjAGtWzg.review_text: You should NOT go naked for a while if you eat at Naked Lunch, because the fare is simply so decadent and rich that you'll have to eat salads for a week to get back into shape.  I sought out Naked Lunch solely because I wanted to try foie gras without having to dress up and spend $$$$, and the foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich ($18) was an excellent way to complete my first foie gras adventure. The fatty richness really comes out due to the simplicity of the rest of the sandwich. The duck prosciutto was sharp and savory, although the flavor was slightly lost due to how strong the foie gras was. The sandwich was quite salty overall, but I really, really enjoy sodium. Not coincidentally, I also have high blood pressure. :(  The pork tenderloin with eggs ($12) was just okay. I liked each individual ingredient of the dish, but I didn't think they had any special magical synergy when combined. The pork was fairly dry and chewy and the whole meal felt strangely incomplete. Props for the fries staying crunchy after 20 minutes of soaking in the brown butter hollandaise, though. And a shoutout goes to the oven baked tomatoes for being some of the most flavorful, juicy tomatoes I've ever had; I'd even say it was more succulent than the bacon!  There's very little space to sit, so plan on takeout, and it's cash only. Pretty kid friendly - two small families showed up while I was there. The wait is about 5-10 minutes depending on what you order (my wait was 10 minutes due to the pork tenderloin with eggs; others' foie gras sandwiches came out quite speedily). The cashier was charming, and was nice enough not to call me a dope when I referred to the pork tenderloin as a sandwich even though the description never said sandwich. Oops.  Naked Lunch is a great lunch venue, especially if you want to get in on the foie gras craze before the July 1 ban rolls around. The extra bonus? There are several strip clubs close by, so hey, if you're too stuffed to go naked afterward, someone can go naked for you...

zWyf_kJoN42PK1120zXz5w.review_text: When you spend $8 for a chicken sandwich, it had better be good.  This one was pretty amazing.  I'll be back.

zEEMKVoTrBhomd-8bvbTjw.review_text: This place is an awesome lunch option if you are in North Beach or can make the short walk up from the Financial District.  They serve super high-quality ingredients in creative and tasty sandwiches.  Today was a gorgeous day in SF so my buddy and I walked over there and sat at the lone table on the sidewalk in front right in the sun.  They have limited inside seating as well plus you can sit on the outdoor patio of Enrico's (Naked Lunch is the little place connected to Enrico's using the same kitchen).  I had the foie gras torchon and duck prosciutto sandwich - DELICIOUS!  My friend had the skirt steak sando that looked killer (perfectly rare steak - yum!) and he seemed to thoroughly enjoy it.  They had an amazing "honey tangerine cooler" that was ridiculously good too and was particularly fine on this lovely SF day.  The guys that work here were super friendly and cool and seemed to have a great sense of humor.  The other beverage du jour was a coconut milk based deal called a "Harry Nilsson" after the "lime in the coconut" singer guy.  I'm not a  huge coconut guy, but I liked the naming.  Anyway - I left off one star because its a limited menu and a bit pricey for these economic times, but you def get what you pay for (in quality not necessary quantity, but its better that way, isn't it, fat boy?).  I need to go back on a Tuesday for the fried chicken sandwich.

Op8pA3E_tpg4707Pkja_jA.review_text: The menu is really simple: there are only two options! I had a fried chicken sandwich, which seemed simple enough but was surprisingly good. Typical San Francisco lunch prices (about $11 in the end), so while not the cheapest place in the world, definitely worth a grab every now and then.

4kfTglFC5RBcZsXOX6d5vw.review_text: everything that i could possibly want in a samwich!  warm, crusty bread. crunchy, salty, sweet, soft and chewy insides. so fine!  menu chages daily, always a vegetarian option and they can make anything vegan if ya want....im just sayin. also have other goodies like iced teas, soups, olives, truffled devil eggs, and ice creaaam!  cha$h only..., no crazy lines;)....a weekly staple in my opinion. you can sit outside on the patio at Enrico's too! thank U Naked Lunch, thank U!

mdCAsnSP3uCH2859UYW66A.review_text: I love everything about them especially how they're conveniently located next to me! :)   Some time last week I tried their new item, their  Ahi Tuna sammie... Who thought Ahi tuna would make such a great sammie!? OMG it's good! Their watermelon cooler is back on the menu and i couldnt resist but to order one to go with my sammie!  Im waiting for their coconut drink! It's reallly good :)   Will be back next month to try a new sammie :)

nHfRlRN-wCu6roGhbiLZcw.review_text: Naked Lunch is Alimentary delight pork, beef, duck, vedge and fried chicken yum.

CBwF2a2qEXpiHulN7MjCyQ.review_text: My friends rave about this place like it's 2nd to heaven's sandwich shop. So I came with one of them and understand why they feel the way they do.   We shared the foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich $16 and also the salmon sandwich $9. Both were good but the first one blew us away. It's a shame we didn't start with the salmon sandwich because it pale in comparison to the blasting flavors of the foie gras & prosciutto. After finishing the rich sandwich, his first bite into the salmon one, he said "it's good, but we should have started with this one and finished with the foie gras.." He was so right! Now we know.   Can't wait to not be on a diet and try their fry chicken sandwich someday soon.   The staff were great and service was excellent. We sat and ate at the outdoor seating of Enrico's (actually the first time I've ever been in there, and I grew up in in sf!).   I now even follow them on Twitter so I know and can drool over what's on their menu that day ;)

3SZCT6klYdI81TQrOJOcHA.review_text: For what I experienced from this place.. i think 4.5 stars are way hyped up.  As it wasn't Thursday when we were there, we couldn't get the fried chicken sandwich but instead we got to try their foie gras sandwich and korean bbq sandwich.  they were okay. the breads weren't really my thing. they are quite expensive but there weren't really anything exciting or inventive about it.  I really wanted the bbq sandwich to be good, but it was rather quite disappointing. i'm not sure if korean bbq is a trend in sf or something, but i think chefs really need to understand the flavors first before messing with them.  For the price of the sandwiches i would give 2 stars but their soup and cinnamon iced tea were quite good,, but it's a sandwich place after all, right?  i have decided to postpone my reservation at Txoko based on this experience.. but will definitely try again sometime.

608u33flNeT1Ofts1kFLpg.review_text: I am briefly going to ignore the fact that I got towed in San Fran and had to spend $500 dollars to get my car back and will probably hate San Fran, and California for that matter, for the rest of my days.   *deep breath*  I had the two best sandwiches of MY LIFE here:  Foie Gras and Duck Prosciutto: Great ingredients, great execution. They were not skimpy on the foie gras or duck prosciutto which is probably why it cost me $15. But whatever, this was the best sandwich I have ever eaten in my entire life.   Grilled Peach and Goat Cheese: Second best sandwich I have ever eaten in my entire life. This one also had some arugula on it and some balsamic reduction. And it was a mere $8.  The restaurant is a little hole in the wall, in a very sketchy area where you should NOT attempt to park your car. Ever.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: One of my favorite sandwich spots in SF.  The menu changes except for the fried chicken sandwich.   I haven't had a bad sandwich yet.

2XKA9NwN499NjkePsWS8BA.review_text: The sandwiches are good, but the prices are just too high to justify them.

UdBgCRXFx6YIZpQFg7hLkw.review_text: EVERYTHING THEY MAKE IS SO TASTY  and it's 2 blocks from my work, which is bad news for my wallet. I'm vegetarian, so I don't partake in their more famous sandwiches, but damn, I've never been disappointed.   My favorite lunch is their cipollini confit sandwich. Everything is gooey and delicious, and the subtle flavors all run around chasing each other.   Also of note -- their outdoor heaters are usually sufficiently warm to make eating outside in SF a possibility, which I appreciate. Go early to snag a comfy booth :)

xgSzThXuJEbolk3gznrdqg.review_text: when i eat out, even if its just lunch, i'd much rather spend $ on something unique that i can't make myself.  decided to splash out and try the foie sandwich. all i could taste was the good stuff melting in my mouth.  i hope they keep this on the menu...i'm gonna need a regular fix.  its a little out of the way for me but worth going back.

D1DtY25nPkLfWq8dlJE91Q.review_text: I had to try to Fried Chicken Sandwich after reading about it in everyone else's review.   I give it a 4 out of 5 stars. It was juicy and I loved it with the Crystal sauce - poured sauce per bite =) The only reason it did not get 5 out of 5 stars is because it fell apart pretty easy so I had to keep restuffing my chicken back in.  The Cinnamon Sweet Tea is unique and delicious. My bf ordered water and then stole my tea so I only got to enough a half cup instead. 5 out of 5 stars.  French fries are seasoned and yummy!!! Also had a salad which was fresh and tasty. 5 our of 5 stars.  Service was friendly. Order at the bar and they will bring the food to you. 4.5 out of 5 stars.   The inside was kind of a dark bar area with 1 TV for sports and 2 pool tables. Decent outdoor seating with two cute booths and some standard tables. Not much of a view though (right by Broadway strip clubs) but fun to people watch.    4 out of 5 stars.

ELMd4udvM3372ZCS7a4Weg.review_text: I wish there were more than 5 stars that I could give this place. This review is long overdue, but better late than never. My fiancé and I had our engagement party here back in May and it was absolutely perfect. This is all thanks to Ryan (the owner/manager). He was so helpful throughout the whole process and executed the event seamlessly. On top of this, the food is unique and delicious, and the place has the best vibe. I highly recommend this place all around for either a chill night with friends or for a private event. Thanks so much Ryan!

4aSerSuK8o9dNJqF359iEA.review_text: Hands down the best fried chicken sandwich ever.  Bakesale Betty has nothing on this sandwich. Paired with refreshing cinnamon sweet tea this is definitely a lunch to remember.

gXCaO5dmMNAA6Y5IqJ-cDQ.review_text: Amused by the name, proximity and menu ingredients I wandered over here for lunch and was very impressed. The staff was super friendly, and even though I came in near the end of their lunch hours, they warmingly assured it wasn't a problem to stay and take my time.  Their menu is small and rotates regularly - check out their website to see the latest. You'll find a a few sandwiches (or sandwich-like entrees), one which is always vegetarian, a soup and a veggie-friendly salad. Being a veggie, I tried their eggplant sandwich and butternut squash soup. Both had quality ingredients and well-crafted flavors that deliciously came together. I'd order either of them again in a heart beat.

Hrw6KciXE8g3DdSjkZvzEw.review_text: Awesome place we just happened to try out on a walk thru the city. Friendly, generous service. Had the Sunday night Chow Mein -- special meal that changes each Sunday -- and it was delicious. Best dumplings I've ever had. If I lived in SF I would make this place a regular!

XUc-ZO32UI40ocApF5R6qQ.review_text: I came here solely on other reviews and could not recommended this place highly enough. Had the Manchego & Pear Sandwich and Cinnamon Sweet Tea - the staff was nice, the food came out in a timely manner, and most importantly, the sandwich was delicious. Definitely coming back soon!

37HswRimgBEf7_US-c3CDA.review_text: Naked Lunch has a menu that changes daily & uses ingredients that are super fresh - you'll want to come here multiple times for sure  First visit, I chose the Roasted Butternut Squash Sandwich - comes with huge slabs of Manchego Cheese ( ! ) Radicchio, Lettuce, & Garlic Aioli.  ( I picked off the onions cause I like the flavor but not the texture )    The squash was cut paper thin & I didn't taste it at all.  Had there been more, I'd have been in heaven.  This was more of a grilled cheese w/ the squash as 1 of the condiments.  Still a very tasty sandwich though  Potato & Garlic Soup - cream fraiche gave it a lemonny taste that didn't sit quite right (as I'm not a citrus fan)  Next visit I opted for the Triple Creme & Apple w/ Almonds, Honey & Thyme - creamy Triple Cheese & lots of it, combined w/ thinly sliced apples all mixed w/ honey - Mmmmmm  Potato & Garlic Soup - this time it came w/ Blue Cheese & man oh man was that thing the bomb!  Just enough blue to give it a flavor kick w/out making it too savory or heavy  I've found my perfect pairing & overall, have to say - I'm a fan!  CASH ONLY!

h80lUlJXzBik-JmQYCEmBg.review_text: Made it just in time before closing at 2pm and got a sandwich with arugula, chorizo and poached baby octopus. Apparently they don't always have this sandwich on the menu, and it was a great mix of flavors and textures-- unique and tasty, if a little small. I wouldn't eat this every day, but definitely worth a try if you're in the mood for something out of the ordinary. The place is a little hard to find-- it just looks like a kitchen for the bar next door--  but keep an eye out for the sign on the sidewalk outside. There's a counter with a few stools for eating in, or you can dine on the adjacent patio as we did. Staff were friendly, helpful, and really apologetic when they forgot to substitute my arugula for pea shoots. Oh well, it was still good!

FtGEpYCF6DYwiBL4zFMfRA.review_text: Kind of an odd space to go for lunch. They've got jazz music blasting inside, forcing you to go sit outside, where they have tables and upholstered benches. Strange.  As everyone has said, the fried chicken sandwich is really the only thing worth getting on the menu. And I really have no complaints about it, though it wasn't the best of its kind I've had in the city (that's at Market & Rye).  So yeah, it was decent, but with all the other great lunch spots in the city, I doubt I'll be returning any time soon.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Remember that horrifying nightmare in high school? The one where you're walking down the hallway naked while everyone gawks, leers, and/or stares in disgust (geez, am I really drooping like an 80 year-old grandma?!?!)? I never really understood that dream but just the name, "Naked Lunch" brought me back to those days. No, you don't go to lunch "naked" at Naked Lunch though sexual deviants (*ahem* like some people I know) may think that's the idea since San Francisco has NO law against public nudity. To each and their own for wanting to let it hang loose. Not my thing but I certainly would be ogling. OK, enough with the naked talk... Naked Lunch has been on my bookmarks for their Signature Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich. With the upcoming Foie Gras ban coming into effect in less than 6 weeks, this was not a bookmark I was going to let fall by the wayside. Naked Lunch is located next door to Txoko's (old Enrico's), their basque restaurant where you can sit at the outdoor patio to enjoy your lunch (my Txoko review: yelp.com/biz/txoko-san-f…). I didn't even have to look at their daily changing menu with three sandwich, one soup, and one salad option; I came for one thing and one thing ONLY: The Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich. Most of Naked Lunch's customers are from the FiDi and they tend to sell out of the foie sandwich early on the weekdays so you'll have better luck if you come on a Saturday (we came at 12:45 pm). CASH ONLY but there's an ATM inside Naked Lunch. As a foie gras lover on PETA's hit list, the Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich ($16) was an indulgent guilty pleasure. yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao… Crusty soft Acme bread layered with silky smooth foie gras torchon, salty duck prosciutto, tangy tomato slices and crisp butter lettuce was the perfect melding of simplicity and luxury. The truffle salt was a bit over-the-top as it made the sandwich overwhelming salty. It thoroughly satisfied my foie gras craving but I'm not sure if it warrants a $16 price tag. Nonetheless, if you're a foie gras lover, it's something to definitely try before the ban. You're already ordering the most decadent sandwich on the menu so to hell with watching your caloric and fat intake. Make sure to add a bag of 4505's FoodGASMIC Chicharonnes ($3) to your meal and wash it down everything with a refreshing glass of Cinnamon Sweet Tea (Free refills - $2). yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao… Living in one of the most liberal cities in the country, *cheers* to Naked Lunch for serving foie gras and to "naked" lunches. But PLEASE, PLEASE don't go bare butt booty naked on public seats. Spank you very much.

eJy1DkAJw5nnCAXwgc9pOA.review_text: 1 block, 2 blocks, 8 blocks to naked lunch we go a sandwich on a sunny friday afternoon would sure make me glow a short trek it wasn't -but better than vincent van gogh the lamb cheesesteak is bomb go ask your bro the chef, i hear, is no stranger to Gary Danko so if you are ever in north beach, don't ever pass and not go

PJ68jL84YyDr0EKd4p5Wtg.review_text: Great chill spot, pool tables, food. Beer, cocktails, I dig it.   Spacious and good noise level for Convo when I was present, I'd come back I was there on a Thursday night, I recommend the fried chicken sandwich same as everyone else =). Life is a garden so dig it!

Gcjr__StoE_lpZjDGc31Ew.review_text: I came here a couple days after the California Foie Gras ban so unfortunately I wasn't able to get their famous foie gras sandwich. But I did end up getting their fried chicken sandwich! Not the best I've ever had (Bakesale Betty is my #1), but it was still very good.

S0yLkzB9QHC3Q4BpfM_iCw.review_text: Naked Lunch, located in the heart of the strip club district of North Beach, is extremely misleading. Yes, it's true that a novel of the same name was written by a "hippie" and the area has a rich "beat" history, but... COME ON. It's by Garden of Eden and Larry Flynt's Hustler Club. I bet they get a lot of traffic from saps they've tricked. Local strip clubs, are you listening??  They're lucky that was a goddam good chicken sandwich.

3e-BITbm264Cq4pS_kF8rw.review_text: I love this place.  It's as if the whole dearth of amazing lunch spots in San Francisco created a vacuum and nature, abhorring it, filled the whole thing with the Naked Lunch.  The sandwiches are perfect.  The ratio of bread to ingredients; the choice of bread; the preparation of what goes into it, the amount of dressing, the perfect seasoning of every element.  The fried chicken sandwich is hands down better than any I've had in the South (where I grew up, and lived for much of my adult life); the essence of it is perfectly crisp, fresh fried chicken with just the right amount of acid to balance it.  The refreshments are always spot-on; they sell those damned amazing chicharrones ....  And best of all:  they are open for lunch on Saturday.  The void has been filled, and how!  Go here.  You'll love it.

73DZUFYAXuycbJ_eEAox1Q.review_text: I have never read Naked Lunch, but I have eaten there. I have no regrets. Neither, apparently, did William S. Burroughs, despite having his novel disparaged as obscene. But he was not deterred. He believed in the power of his voice and vision. That level of commitment is refreshing, even if his writing is not to everyone's tastes. You can't please everyone if you hope to make something lasting. Naked Lunch became a classic in spite of the detractors.  There is nothing obscene about Naked Lunch, the North Beach San Francisco sandwich spot, either. It, too, has the potential to become a classic, because I got the sense that the chef-owners are committed to their vision and don't try to be all things to all people. Just make lunch. A little something new every day. No megamenus. No exploding taste-bombs. But make it all good. Make it local. Make it seasonal. Make it linger. Make your customer smile. With subtle touches, not splashy displays of culinary cuteness. Have the courage to be understated. Let them find you. They will come!  The chalkboard menu of shifting sandwiches, soups, salads, and fresh juice drinks is casual elegant in its simplicity and gently inspired in its creative combinations of ingredients you can see, taste, and feel. It's wholesome and nutritious, not decadent and dripping with amped-up flavors. I am very drawn to this style of cooking and find it all too rare in the restaurantscape. Simple does not mean easy to make, to prepare, or to plate. It just means that you have pared things down to their essence.   Case in point: the lunch for two ($27, plus $5 tip) my sister and I enjoyed here one sunny spring afternoon. We slipped in shortly after noon, glanced at the chalkboard, asked a few questions about the menu, ordered, and grabbed an outdoor table. While we waited, we sipped a delicious honey tangerine cooler flavored with freshly-crushed juniper berries - orange bliss in a glass with a whiff of gin from the berries.       The meal was a 3-course tasting menu in miniature: potato and green garlic soup, superbly seasonal with a pleasant mouthfeel and subtle, tangy creaminess. Many soups like this are all heavy cream and starch. This was like springtime in a cup.  Then a feather-light asparagus salad with manchego slivers, preserved Meyer lemon, mizuna greens, and filigree-thin fresh chives. It was seasoned with cracked pepper, a coarse salt, and olive oil. The lemon zests, pepper, and cheese were the high notes, the crisp asparagus pieces the steady beat. A toe-tapping musical improvisation of Californian cuisine in April.  Last was a ciopollini confit with melted manchego, balsamic, and spinach served on a small ciabatta roll sliced for two. The sweet and tangy onion marmalade pressed into the nooks and crannies of the bread and mixed with the cheese and vinegar-softened greens. A light breeze of a sandwich without dripping sauces or smoked proteins.  Next time, we'll try the Flash Freeze sorbet. Today's flavor was blood orange and fennel.   Some people want orgasmic food experiences. Me, not so much. (I don't need a meal for that). Naked Lunch is about another sort of nakedness - lacking embellishment, unadorned, nothing hidden, no disguises. It's what Burroughs called "a frozen moment when everyone sees what is on the end of every fork."   The next time you go out for a midday meal, take a look at what's on the end of YOUR fork. If you don't like what you see, maybe you need a Naked Lunch. Because we all can use a few more frozen moments in our hectic hyperlives.

tQJJtHShOujzml37qTX_4Q.review_text: I tried their fried chicken sandwich as well as their butterfish sandwich. For both sandwiches the bread was good and the sauces very fatty and delicious. However, the fish sandwich was a little bit lackluster and it was odd eating not fully cooked fish in a sandwich... The fried chicken sandwich was better but at the same time, not amazing.   It's a bit far from the financial district, but doable for lunch.   There are lots of seats indoor and outdoor. It feels like a good place to go with a group of people due to all the large tables. I went with one other person and the smallest table there fit four.   Was there around noon and there wasn't a crowd. Quiet actually..

BnTCwfUaEmUehQZJmeGZVA.review_text: So a friend told me about this place and was told it was one of the best fried chicken sandwiches she's ever. So right from the start...the expectations were set.   Out of everywhere in world, it was this bar that found it's homey place on a street with a random museum and a montage of porn blasting with corny porn music. Hell let's give it a try!  The bar was cool. Probably a cool spot to shoot some pool and hang with some people. The bartender was nice and courteous. For lunchtime it was pretty quiet for being super awesome. But never the less, the food came quick. Got out of there for 14 bucks for the sandwich and fries.   I open the bag and I notice two items, a brown item wrapped. Thinking it was the fries but it was the sandwich. No prob. Still pretty large. Then right under is a big white box. Open the sucker and out explodes fries on fries!!!! And they are delicious!!! Got a little Cajun spice and crispy.  I open the main meal. Added a little hot sauce on that bad boy and into the mouth it goes. Filtering through endless amount coleslaw in my mouth I finally taste the ever so famous chicken. Pretty good! I would probably say that there was a little too much coleslaw. The chicken could have used a little more seasoning but I don't know if it was because of the coleslaw surrounding the chicken like the walls of Alcatraz or not.   Regardless, the meal was filling and did enjoy it. Now do I agree with my friend about best fried chicken sandwich....absolutely not. Apparently she has never been to chick fil a. Then again this is probably way healthier than fast food.  Overall pretty good.

dlAxvWcrqZJPkhFTWru6Ew.review_text: SUPER TASTY hole in the wall joint with great sandwiches and soups. Menu changes daily so check their website or twitter. Had the best vegetarian sandwich of my life here -- roasted butternut squash, goat cheddar, melted onions, balsamic, arugula. Definitely FTW!

pypZb3V5TXHOnlTj-qLSrw.review_text: Perhaps it's fitting that they named this gourmet sandwich shop "Naked Lunch," given its location at the heart of San Francisco's red light district. The name, however, won't tell you much about the super-fantastic Fulton Valley Fried Chicken Sandwich they serve on Tuesdays. That sandwich features perfectly fried, juicy chicken breast (with the dark meat taste), served with coleslaw and garlic aioli on Pain De Mie. Nom Nom Nom. yelp.com/user_local_phot… I agree 100% with reviewer Phil H. in comparing Naked's quality to the famed fried chicken sandwich at Bakesale Betty's.  Simply put, it doesn't.  As much as I like BB, Naked's fried chicken sandwich is just in a different league...in the same way Tara Reid and Aubrey Hepburn are both actresses, but safe to say that Tara would not have taken any roles from Aubrey.  Plus, Naked serves the fried chicken patty while still warm and fresh. And as Christine C. puts it, definitely top-five sandwich of the year worthy (now I have to rerank my list). I also had the Salty Dulce Ice Cream, though I didn't enjoy it as much. I first thought $3 for such a small offering was a little high. But the flavor was so rich, it was actually plenty.  It was good, but way too sweet and not salty enough. Perhaps the sweetened condensed milk overpowered the french sea salt, so it tasted more like frozen condensed milk.   Service was down to earth, accommodating, efficient, and very friendly. Prices are higher, but fair for what you get. Also on a sour note, they are open for only 3 or so hours a day and they are a cash only establishment (with an ATM that charges $2.50 per transaction). And, oh, one more thing, they serve the always awesome 4505 Chicharrones.  I'll be back.  Count on it.

txCNxFglBL02qyaLj-pTMw.review_text: Man this place is good! I was tempted to give them 4 stars seeing as they can be a bit pricey but then I thought about it. If you go and buy a sandwich anywhere else, say Specialty's you'll pay maybe a dollar less but the quality is about 75% less! At the Naked Lunch you get such a unique combination of flavors, and everything is just so tasty. You now they make everything with love. I've had the shrimp sandwich, warm cod sandwich, garlic and potato soup, and fennel salad and all of those items have left me thinking, "Damn, that was the best lunch I've had in a while" And the owner Ryan is so nice and helpful. Once when I had to wait just ten minutes extra he gave me my ice cream for free.  So, yes not a super cheap lunch, but you get a lot of love and flavor for what you pay.

3idgX-PvIIU841rhXlQiKA.review_text: There's only one day of the week you need to remember... Tuesday, because Tuesday means the FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH ($8) is on the menu. Since these babies sometimes take a bit of time, if you're strapped for time (and dont mind your food being less than hot hot,) you should call in your order for pick up, or eat in -- takes about 10 minutes -- nbd.  Cash only, often a line out the door, you've been warned. Add some hot sauce to that fried chicken sandwich and you'll want another. Truth.

CMFhpK3uqm-s-BiHBsCBbg.review_text: Great arugula salad,  yummy beer,  fun pool tables,  and pretty awesome view of the Transamerica tower.

BNfRzELQo-4CN-PH_veiBw.review_text: I walked over here for lunch today. I ordered the Grilled Peach and Goat Cheese sandwich that has caramelized onions and greens. I would continue to write about how good I think this sandwich is, but I'm afraid I'd use expletives because it is THAT GOOD.  I got this for take out which I think may be a good move because seating looked pretty limited. Still, the place had a cool, small vibe with some nice wall art and friendly workers.  I will be going back there for lunch in the near future.

sjgU3xhSTWjMWdVykPCC6w.review_text: I nearly give this 5.  I don't know what more they could do, but I'm trying not to hand out too many 5s.  Some things to know: only open for lunch starting at 11:30...limited menu that is always changing...not a stellar location or ambiance.  All that being said, this place is perfect.  'Gourmet' doesn't do these sandwiches justice.  We had the specialty, the foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich and an egg and chorizo sandwich.  They were both great, but the foie was a little too decadent for me.  The chorizo sandwich was just right...I could have one of those everyday.  The guys running the place were so welcoming.  It was like eating over at an old friends place who you hadn't hung out with in a long time.  If I lived in San Fran I would be here often.

JxKgwQUWG-RUNklb-ZJgSQ.review_text: There are a number of restaurants with sandwiches similar to those you'll find at Naked Lunch (The Sentinel comes to mind). I ordered a lamb with pesto here, and it was out of this world -- one of the better sandwiches I've ever eaten.   But it's not why I'm giving this place five stars. I challenge you to find nice outdoor seating in North Beach and not pay way too much for crappy Italian food. Miraculously, this little hole-in-the-wall offers the most luxurious patio space in town. How's that, you ask? The good people at the restaurant next door (I'm blanking on the name, sorry) have offered up their posh patio to Naked Lunch during the day.   Eating on this decadent patio should not be so cheap. But it is! Next nice day, cruise down Broadway and get yourself a sandwich and some sunshine.

Eq3mNcLDCrlJrRqweLWL6A.review_text: I'm currently working in the North Beach area for a project and I've been going to Naked Lunch practically every other day for both lunch AND dinner. Yes, I'm hopelessly addicted.  Is the food that great? Not really. I mean, it's good food for sure. But what I like most about Naked Lunch is the atmosphere. It's a pretty big, comfortable space that's not trying too hard and is rarely suffocatingly packed like most good places in the city. It doesn't give off hipster vibes, it doesn't attract a Marina crowd even though it has two pool tables and a basketball game, and it's not filled with suits from the Financial District. It's an eclectic, diverse group of customers and I always end up having a good conversation with someone interesting.  The rotating beers on taps are solid and the sandwiches, especially the fried chicken sandwich and the cheeseburger, are delicious.   Most of all, it doesn't cost too much (as far as prices in SF go). I've always been able to find a seat here and while I don't want that to change, I have a feeling Naked Lunch will get even more crowded once people learn about the good food and good people who come here.

rp9my_uNCGKYgAh4FN29Pg.review_text: Holy awesome. I've found my 'last meal' requests: Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich with Potato & Garlic Soup. Wow. Seriously. If I had to pick items for my very last meal in this world, these 2 things would be on the menu. Yum.  One star off for the pricey menu but the food is amazing and the patio seating with strong ass heaters to keep my acclimated-to-LA-wussy-ass warm and a view of the Transamerica building is unbeatable.

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: i really wanted to love the foie gras torchon and duck proscuitto sandwich. i mean, c'mon...it sounds all kinds of amazing. but sadly my tongue rejects the texture of the torchon. personally i feel the texture is similar to that of a deflated balloon that's been dipped in liquid wax. it's not their fault. i'm sure the technique was perfect and it was exactly as they anticipated it to be. i just can't do the texture.  the flavor is there but for the life of me i just couldn't get it down and i can hardly believe that i let a $15 sandwich go to waste.   i love the idea of all these sandwich shops with daily changed menus that have been popping up in SF. and i love that naked lunch offers seating at Enrico's next door. and i love that the people there seem friendly and excited about what they're doing. i will definitely be back to try a different sandwich.

yD2S3LZxCI9D9_joS2VJ0g.review_text: My experience here was fair, the burger was pretty good and the staff was not unfriendly.   It's getting 1 star because they decided to run the same charges on my card 3 times with no explanation on 9/27/13.

g5i3PBXtESVzqH8b8nojHQ.review_text: I like how often the menu changes here. Over the years I've had sandwiches that have blown me away and others that have been only OK (foie gras was too complex to enjoy). The only problem with the atmosphere is that it smells like a campfire sometimes and makes you smell like you were camping

GF8nVcQbFg_lJRLMoegSYQ.review_text: this place only deserves a 3 but i have a 4 instead. the menu is not very big its about 4 sandwiches granted they are all really good but expensive.  we had the foie grad sandwich, egg sandwich and also the asparagus sandwich. they were all well done made really well but expensive. always have a back up when you get to this restaurant though. my cousin does not like anything they had so she had to venture down the block and grab a pizza slice instead because it is so small it doesn't offer many choices and if you can't decide then your screwed.. but if you do like it then it is a decent place to go. im glad i tried it will i come back not sure unless im in the area.

6J-iHIXs0BZ7LTyHpL1Hgw.review_text: Delicious sandwich. I had the Smokey Heirloom Tomato sand and it was awesome. Fresh ingredients and a small smart menu- I'll be back.

zcWunpvRVtKntD5ouICl-Q.review_text: Yummy fried chicken sandwich.   My foodie friend described it best with, "It's like Asian fried chicken.. but in a sandwich."   So... there you go. Pretty good stuff. Add crystal hot sauce.. It gives it zing..  FYI, if you order the duck prosciutto sandwich... You'll likely find yourself reminiscing to Wendy's old advertising campaign... "Where's the meat?" Well, I did, at least...

8mLfO4uNtbYWCQJ5pbjB0A.review_text: I'm not a sandwich girl. I could never understand how people can get by eating sandwiches for dinner, let alone for lunch! But Naked Lunch is a different story. Their sandwiches are so good in every aspect, from taste to texture. The menu changes day to day, but  stays interesting. One of my favorites was a fried fish sandwich with very thin slices of apples and fennel. It was amazingly light but flavorful, and the fish remained tender and airily crisp. I only wish I was able to try the fois gras sandwich before I moved to an office no longer within walking distance.   Definitely try one of their iced drinks- sooo refreshing, hand made with unexpected herbs, spices and fruits; for those who eat in, the guys offer free refills!

rTBD-JSXeY5cLGguGyvWmg.review_text: I walked into Naked Lunch and was greeted by a friendly employee who was all smiles. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and cinnamon sweet tea.  The fried chicken sandwich was great, not the best I ever had but If I am around the area I would go back. The sandwich was surprisingly juicy but still had the crunch. I don't know how they did it but good job there!  The cinnamon sweet tea was strange but did not disappoint since it did taste exactly like it was supposed to. The flavors stood out at separate times, the first taste was cinnamony but the last taste is the tea.  Don't be discouraged by the lack of tables because the tables right next to the store is theirs.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: OMG, fried chicken sandwich at Naked Lunch FTW!! Nom nom nom.*  *translation for anyone over the age of 23 - the fried chicken sandwiches are fantastic, probably the best fried chicken sandwich that I've had the pleasure of consuming (I'm looking at you, Bakesale Betty.) Service was enthusiastic and friendly, I highly recommend Naked Lunch!

P7wBwBsriO-39cnlrVyyNg.review_text: In contrast to the sunny day, I entered a dark bar. I noticed a chalk board with lunch items. The Grilled Asparagus Sandwich sounded good. Since I was looking for a salad, I chose the Grilled County Line Farms Chicories Salad, after I made sure it was vegetarian. The interesting description: St. Agur Blue Cheese, Citrus, Arugula, Sherry Vinegar, in addition to the emphasis on the farm's name, caught my attention. The nice bartender took my order, I paid and received a number which I brought to my table. I sat outside on a comfy couch; there is also seating indoors. There was a group of ladies and a couple of families with small kids.  Quickly I received a beautiful, good sized salad. The sweetness of the blue cheese is a good counterpart to the almost earthy taste of the chicories. They reminded me of bok choy or endive. The citrus pieces balanced the arugula and cheese. There maybe was shaved fennel also. I loved the green garlic sauce on the side. All together the dish is a great combination of flavors and fresh produce. County Line Farms has a CSA and is at the Ferry Plaza Farmers Market, so check them out. Great produce for a delicious salad!

Og5lv2yeSg-JRxbxc5_8PQ.review_text: I'm curious about the name.  I kinda wonder if it's because it's located near all the strip clubs.. lol.   One of the BETTER chicken sandwiches I've had.  "Better" because I prefer Bakesale Betty's :)  The first thing I said after taking a bite, I compared it to BB's...  Then I saw the Yelp reviews and noticed I'm not the only one who compares the two places.   I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and the cinnamon sweet tea (recommendation from my friend).    The fried chicken sandwich was savory (salty), juicy, but too oily.  The mayo just made it much worse.  There was so much oil from the chicken, and the mayo just tasted like grease from the heat.  As flavorful and juicy as the chicken was, I felt a bit grossed out after eating it.   BUT, I think the cinnamon sweet tea really balanced it out.  I don't know why it would taste tangy but it does.  It's sweet but tangy and hence very refreshing and energizing because it boosts up your sugar level.  The best of all?  You can get the left over drink to go and they give you a to-go cup and actually fill up the whole cup for you.  That makes two drinks.. or more if you go through more than 1 during lunch.   I guess my experience at this place was actually not that bad, but I'm being a bit harsh and difficult because I keep comparing to Bakesale Betty's.

XMZtV131x-0JmVUVY6mEWA.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
XMZtV131x-0JmVUVY6mEWA.review_text: Came here for the first time at 12:30 today and they're out of Foie Gras!! I really wanted to try it due to the yelp hype. Pretty packed with people waiting in line, eating inside, outside, and next door.  Ended getting a steak sandwich. It was pretty good but will not return for it but will return for the Foie Gras. The cinnamon tea was a nice combination. I really liked it.   Overall I think it's pretty pricey for a sandwich. Will only come here for Foie Gras sandwich and tea.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: Before embarking on a long day of shopping my friend and I met up with her boyfriend for lunch at Naked Lunch. He had heard good things about this place so we figured it was worth a try.  The ambiance is dimly lit with ample seating inside as well as a small outdoor area. They have a couple pool tables + a basketball arcade game. Overall, I feel like this would be a great place to come and hang out especially for their happy hour specials.  For lunch, I decided to try their Fried Chicken Sandwich + an order of fries. The portion of chicken was good and felt it was cooked well. I would say my biggest gripe about the dish would have to be the buttermilk slaw. It was too wet and ended up making the bread too soggy. I did like that it lent a nice bite of acidity to the dish but overall could not get over the texture of the bread.   The fries were cooked well, crispy on the outside and fluffy light on the inside.   Overall Thoughts  I could see myself coming back for lunch/happy hour with higher hopes

k6zYbMle3LI9jhMuY4Tc4w.review_text: When I decide to work from home, my first thought is not "I'll get so much work done!" or "I can wear yoga pants all day!". It is: "I GET TO EAT AT NAKED LUNCH!" It is certainly worth the walk down (and back up) the 155 steps on Kearny. Yes, I've counted. And it's worth the walk if you're on the north end of the financial district too. They only offer a few items, but they do them very well. Fried chicken is always good, though I recommend eating as soon as possible--don't bring this back to your desk and wait 30 minutes. It will be soggy! Cinnamon sweet tea is a nice change from other flavored iced teas. All the sandwiches I've tried have been flavorful and fresh, without going overboard on ingredients. I find them to be perfectly sized, though some of my male friends say they are on the small size. Go when they open at 11:30, as the line gets long and they can run out of items early.

jhSyh22UHrctUPWpHEtDMQ.review_text: I came here on a Tuesday because my coworker was raving about the fried chicken sandwich. I have to admit that I am happy that I came to try it out. It was definitely delicious. I came around noon and just a few minutes after my order, the sandwich was sold out already. Then again they do close pretty early.   They use really fresh ingredients, and you can just tell by taking a bite into the sandwich. The hot sauce is good and really gave the chicken sandwich that extra punch of flavor.   This place really is a hole in the wall, seriously. I swear I would have missed it if it wasn't for the line out the door. I was told there was always a line, because it's good and the place is pretty tiny. How else can all those people fit in this place?! The lines moves pretty quick. The place is really simple, but honestly nobody needs a fancy place when the food itself attracts the customers.   The service here is awesome! The workers are pretty chill and very friendly. People should definitely give this place a try.

4i9EHcsuiymA22IcoTLNEQ.review_text: That fried chicken sandwich was seriously effing delicious. I immediately wanted to eat a second one. The place is tiny though, w/ maybe 5 seats, so you might only be able to take out. But it's right down the hill from Coit tower so you could just go sit on the grass there.

Y9Pq0OyF--iKUYmjMMnIxg.review_text: Not one complaint. They literally couldn't do anything better.   5 for food 5 for service  One happy loud mouth customer who will sing their praises to all her friends and to anyone else who will listen.   Nom nom nom.

8KWbYdHsiVaHaZ0y881Pig.review_text: Oh mee-gosh! What a fantastic lunch spot! I went for the first time yesterday and had the Toy Box Melon Salad and the Sweet Corn Soup it was so delicious! The soup is not served with bread so I asked for some and it came out perfectly toasted and soft. Overall a fantastic spot with some seating which is great. I will FOR SURE be back next Tuesday for the fried chicken!

SgYLiSgba_vDhJ401XvX6w.review_text: Sweet tea here is so yummy and so is the chicken sandwich! It's a bit pricey for what it is but it'll make you as full as any other nine dollar meal. Also, if you're a tourist and visiting the Beat Museum and City Lights Books, why wouldn't you go to the place next door called Naked Lunch?   If you want to eat somewhere quiet - away from the yuppies and loud music (the atmosphere when I went anyway) - get your food to go. Washington Square Park is only a short walk away!

mShoxUbxBNMRClzo7XcTlg.review_text: Support this place! It is tiny and needs enough business to stick around for a while. Excellent, small selection of gourmet sandwiches. Local ice cream from a small purveyor in the Bay Area that are easy to take back to the office and a delicious fancy ice tea which was to die for. It is a bit pricey, so maybe a good Friday "here comes the weekend" kind of treat. Also, you can sit outside at Enrico's for lunch!

xkV_dLl9_26mlOrbDIDl5A.review_text: I finally got to try one of their famous, soft shell crab sandwich.  I've never had a soft shell crab sandwich and it sounded really interesting.  I just had to try it.    for $12, which is a little pricey for sandwich, you get a crispy soft-shell crab topped with aioli, pickled radish, basil and arugula in freshly baked buns.  it's a tiny little thing but it's kind of cool to see the fried up little sucker trapped in between two buns with its claws and legs hanging out the edges.  I'm sorry but I devoured the little guy.  he was very crunchy and tasty.    was it worth $12?  no...  was it really tasty?  yes...  would I come back?  definite yes!

FoDc-669tD5tFTBImm1I7g.review_text: The husband dragged me here across town, saying we had to have their chicken sandwich. I hate admitting when he's right! That chicken sandwich was a crunchy, creamy delight. A cinnamon flavor was a nice touch on the sweet tea. I also tried a goat cheese sandwich that was pretty good, but the chicken sandwich was the real standout!

lzQLHoJdaMNwiNt76wrc4g.review_text: Naked Lunch is an interesting concept. I like the idea of using the kitchen  of a dinner only, fine dining restaurant to do a casual lunch place under a different name. It really allows them to do two things well but in entirely different service systems.  We arrived at Naked Lunch and found it to be a tiny storefront that is a part of the main kitchen at Enrico's. Very compact with a bit of indoor seating and some adjacent outdoor (but heated and covered) seating that is also a part of Enrico's. We were warmly welcomed and enjoyed the buzz of the culinary staff prepping for dinner, as well as making lunch.  The menu is a small blackboard with perhaps ten selections featuring local/seasonal ingredients. We tried sunchoke soup, a fried chicken sandwich, radish/grapefruit/manchego salad, and meyer lemonade+clove. All are served in disposable wares (recyclable, compostable mainly). The flavors were excellent and of fine dining quality. It represents quite a value.  I would have rated it 5 stars, except for the use of disposables, which makes the experience less appealing. Please note that the staff was, without exception, helpful and informative.

jVWAsjG0nHQfVufNLZsbLA.review_text: Naked lunch is a great find. Despite being located next to the North Beach strip clubs...this place has a great bar vibe and a very nice interior that's perfect for a Friday happy hour. The pop-a-shot basketball game is a nice touch too, although I doubt I'd ever play unless I was either A) very drunk or B) very bored, neither of which I hope I'll ever be at happy hour, especially when I'm with work friends.   Food looked pretty good as well. That being said, the reviews that said this place has "the best chicken sandwiches they've ever had" need to be..well...taken with a grain of salt, because my friend said hers was decent, but nothing life-changing. Honestly, the gap between those two sentiments is so large, if I come back I'm definitely planning on ordering one myself, just to see what the deal is. (Fries were good though!!)  Can't say the staff was that friendly though. When our food came I tried to go out of my way to show my gratitude (my friends had been complaining about being hungry for hours in typical girl fashion), yet she barely acknowledged what I had said, which I found odd. Regardless I wasn't bothered much by it, as she easily could've just been having a bad day.  Sidenote: This is one of those times Yelp needs a 3.5 star option. This place isn't a 4 star place, as that assessment would seem to be an insult to the many great restaurants I've reviewed that are fully deserving of 4 stars (and maybe more). But at the same time, 3 stars seems a bit harsh, since this is a place I'd gladly come to again.   Anyway it's too bad it's so far away from the heart of the financial district, or else I'd definitely come here again for happy hour - perhaps even every week. But at bare minimum, if I ever find myself in North Beach again and in need of a place to drink, a return trip is likely.

pdilmEaeXuntV4eTnc9KcQ.review_text: They reopened in the space Txoko just closed in.  The old Enrico's. And it's great. More casual than Txoko, but still a great space to eat and drink. Happy hours specials on beer ($4 drafts, $2 PBR). Try something from the tasty menu of sandwiches for those who can't swing by for lunch.  I thought the chicken sandwich was very good.  And the Alaskan Cod, also very good. The Txoko cocktail menu is gone. And they added 2 pool tables and one of those basketball throwing games... And ironic Lynyrd Skynyrd's Freebird playing loudly.  Maybe not ironically, it's not like the young crowd there last night lived through that music when it was new and it was played over and over and over on classic rock radio, over and over and over. Other music played was fine.  Jammy blues and classic rock.  Wasn't just Skynyrd, but you know, Skynyrd leaves a mark. And old news, the foie gras is gone too.

iAZH8a5teELieRBV8Acb6g.review_text: it ain't cheap, but it's damned tasty.  of course i HAD to have the regular sandwich of foie gras, duck proscuitto, truffle salt and more.  it was good, almost too good.  i would have loved some fruit, as Mark A. suggested.  my friend had the whitefish sandwich, which was also very good.  sandwiches change daily/weekly so i would like to go back and try a few other things.  interesting looking salads too.  and ice cream!  if i ever make it out of the office for lunch, this is the place i will come to.

85APSA4bITPzKiKC2bm3wg.review_text: BEST FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH EVER!!!!   It's finger-lickin good-- imagine the most perfectly seasoned and flavored juicy, non greasy fried chicken doused in a garlic aioli coleslaw on pan de mie.  That's right: drool.....  Very cool little spot with a daily menu... I think the FCS might be a Tuesday thing. Go early to avoid the lunch rush (they open at 11:30)!    I can't wait to go back and try other things!!!

EyH5U-4GTabSkKcl2JX2VA.review_text: Wow!  I am not generally a huge fan of sandwiches, but this place is sooooo good!  Had their fried chicken sandwich with a Watermelon Cooler.  One of the best sandwiches I have ever had.  The chicken was lightly battered, and had oh so much flavor.  Will definetely come back again.

kvrNLQwXBnEiZRrB847BpQ.review_text: I visited SF recently for a 5 day trip and ended up getting naked lunch 2 days in a row. It is just that good. I tried their veggie sandwiches (nectarine, white peach) and the highly coveted fried chicken sandwich and oh my... I just died. Everything was amazing and the place itself was roomy and had a nice vibe. It wasn't a small and cramped place like most of the restaurants i visited in sf. I am probably going to get naked lunch the next time i'm in SF. Currently craving a sandwich right now...

c_6Rg9wiRdhTJXPnEPVKzA.review_text: This is a super tasty lunch spot worth going out of your way for. Ryan and Ian really know what they are doing with the sandwich/soup menu and refreshing daily drinks.   Go on Tuesday and line up for the delicious Fried Chicken Sandwiches. Save some room for the Yummy Ice Cream... mmm...

_aSs5dSAabuwnXUGBPzASw.review_text: Date & Time:  Saturday December 19, 2009 @ 1pm Crowd:  Couples in Alma Mater Sweatshirts & William Rast Jeans  Atmosphere:  Cozy Decor:  Cute, Small Space Adjacent to Enrico's Service:  Cool Friendly Guys Imbibe:  Blood Orange Lemonade Devour:   House Marinated Olives, Pancetta & Egg Sandwiches, Celery Root Soup & Salty Dulce De Leche Ice Cream  Total:  $31

PJT0aWX9sKIl-JxKxGl_XA.review_text: Mixed feelings? first time i went, the duck + prosciutto sandwich hit the SPOT. but the second time i got a different sandwich. it was really small, on pan de mie that melted in my mouth, and the meat was scant.  try again? it's a pricey gamble, fellas.

-JV_oFXKowWrDVANADJxqg.review_text: I love eating lunch naked! ... I mean I love eating Naked Lunch!   The foie gras and duck prosciutto is bomb. The fried chicken sandwich is a must especially with the Crystal hot sauce they provide. But this isn't anything new if you've read the other Yelp reviews. Now, I'm a meat lover but one day they were out of protein sandwiches so I exhausted my options and went with the asparagus sandwich. I was a little hesitant about eating a veggie sandwich but after my first bite I was in awe. Never before has anyone actually created a vegetable dish I instantly liked. Also had the pleasure to try the soup of the day which was an amazing mushroom truffle soup.   Naked Lunch is great for any day for whatever on the menu. You will not be disappointed.

bWvELivVIa81tFEqiLxS4A.review_text: The stars lined up for me Tuesday and I go to try what my friend claimed to be the 'best chicken sandwich' in the city.  I must admit, it was freaking good.  The staff was friendly and the line & wait was manageable.  I ordered the chicken sandwich, filled the cup (thank you for the large cups) with water, and sat next door at one of many tables available.  It was drizzling off and on that day, but the semi-patio seating was a nice breath of fresh air.    The chicken sandwich first looked small, but it was filling (my eyes are often bigger than my stomach).  For the heavy eaters, you may want to add something on the side though.  The chicken was crispy and well cooked,  but what really made the sandwich great was the perfectly toasted bread.  Must try for fried chicken lovers!

Pw_Sja-vJ1xiUrjXZb6QBg.review_text: so happy this place expanded and does a night scene.  Literally the best vegetarian sandwich I have ever had.

KI7gPbRvdngGcgq3-RD7Gw.review_text: If there's no line and you are looking for a quick, good meal -- I'd definitely stop by Nake Lunch and grab a sandwich/soup to go.  Good food, fast service, fair pricing. They only have a few options each day, so helps with the decision making too!  The staff was ultra-nice too. Point in case -- my friend ask him to help nuke a coffee she had from earlier in the day, unfortunately, they didn't have a microwave.  But instead of rejecting her, they reheated it in a pot on the stove and pour it back into her to-go cup, brought it out with her order, and threw in a smile.  We ordered: --Chicken Sandwich ($9)-- great chicken in a soft bun.  Their staple item, with good reason. --Salmon & Poached Egg ($12) -- a hearty piece of salmon under a runny poached egg.  Surrounded by a moat of spicy tomato and cucumber. Tasty.  BUT -- a nice sit down experience, Nake Lunch is not.  Inside basically looks like a a burned down kitchen.  You can sit outside the next door (sister) restaurant, TXOKO, but there you'll be taking in the glorious view of strip clubs and video stores.  Like I said, great for take out!

si_JzsBn0s98cKPf4T1qhw.review_text: Some friends' have been telling me about this place, so I decided to give it a try. There were about 6 people in front (and eventually behind) us, but they were pretty efficient and we moved through with our order in less than 10 minutes.   I had the Fried Chicken Sandwich (which most people here are mentioning about) with some Cinnamon tea. Now, cinnamon tea wasn't something I would have attempted to ever try because I don't really fancy the idea of drinking herbs or spices. But since my coworker recommended it, I thought I'd give it a go. Thanks to my coworker, I actually really really enjoyed the tea!  Now for the chicken sandwich. A lot of people here are comparing it to Bakesale Betty's, but I actually think the sandwiches of both are quite different. Bakesale piles on a whole lot of their jalapeno cilantro slaw while Naked could have used more slaw and/or aioli. Bakesale's sandwich is noticeably larger and taller while Naked's chicken had a bit more flavor to it. Naked uses a delicious Pain de Mie bun while Bakesale uses a more chewy roll.  Both have good and not as good qualities. I enjoy both! One should try and make ones own choice.

pcxNoqnwrrU9tfv0KITN4Q.review_text: This place is hip, loud and super yummy!! I had the Brussel sprout sandwich which may sound weird but I promise you, it was delish!!!! The French fries is a must and plenty to share with a friend. The beer selection isn't super large but the nice lady at the bar was helpful with suggestions. I only gave 4 stars because it was almost too loud with the music blaring but the other reason is because I don't know if they serve coke over Pepsi. I had a beer. I would definitely go back. Next time I'm trying the fried chicken sandwhich!!

jyvStrzsSoaSpzuFPhxIBA.review_text: What a great place! It's one of the few places in Sf with spacious outside seating and their signature chicken sandwich is just delicious! Make sure to try the ice tea as well!

GnSaOLsfQdnq_C6AsnxUkg.review_text: If God was making sandwiches, I'm pretty sure this is the spot.  I've been to Naked Lunch a few times before when it was a hole in the wall a few years ago, and was pleasantly surprise to see it grow into a big restaurant... with only four items on the menu!  That should tell you about the quality of the food.  While the menu may elicit the 'boooring' reaction with items like cheeseburger or tomato soup, they will knock what you are used to having under that name out of the ballpark.  Definitely recommend to stop by there if you haven't. It's worth a drive

SFPNtzidtT14DT_fZahH7w.review_text: called in my order, in and out in less than a minute.  HOLY FIRED CHICKEN SANDWICH!! so f'n good.   greenbacks only.

tMym5FBTh76TzlQCsY6VWA.review_text: So, the girls and I went to Naked Lunch for an overdue meet up and eat up. The menu that day had three sandwiches: duck prosciutto with foie gras, poached shrimp mousse cakes with avocado, and grilled eggplant with peppers and aioli. There were also two soups, a couple of designer drinks and some rarefied sorbet and ice cream for dessert.  Sharing bites amongst us, we managed to sample every sandwich. The general consensus was that everything was just a bit too rich and/or unbalanced. Certain ingredients overpowered others (foie gras, the salt in the salty plum drink was too strong) and there were also some texture issues. My shrimp mousse cakes were super squishy, sliding all over and out of the sides of the roll. (Which I would have preferred toasted).  The eggplant & peppers was the best sandwich we tried. The heirloom tomato gazpacho was also a hit, refreshing and flavorful. Service was friendly, although slow, during a time when it wasn't busy.  I dunnno. It's pretty pricey. None of us felt wowed. If I'm getting naked for lunch, I want some wow. Three stars.

VOBK6OaCyK_32B0_lsjOPw.review_text: Brussel sprouts with caramelized onions in a sandwich - da bomb!

eGs6GlsMG9hTRVnYyEk16Q.review_text: Naked? Lunch? Naked Lunch! Does anyone know if this is ironically named for all the other naked spots in the area?  I've been here for lunch 2 or 3 times with coworkers. It has a very relaxed, neat atmosphere, and is convenient for take-out or sit-down. Order at the bar on the right when you walk in. The signature menu item is the Fried Chicken Sandwich, which you definitely need to experience once in your life. My co-worker literally comes here every week just for this masterpiece and has tried to order two in one sitting. Yes, it is that great. I decided to change things up and got the vegetarian sandwich, which was tastier than expected and had a good mesh of textures compared to a lot of other vegetarian sandwiches. All sandwiches are about $11 here.  I believe the menu rotates throughout the week, so you can always come back for nice pescetarian and vegetarian surprises. The interior is spacious with a few large tables with enough space for 5-6 people. There's also outdoor seating on a warm day.

mOCM896HwdM4sL961RRNHg.review_text: Dear lord this beat every expectation I had.   Lets see, to begin I ordered the sandwich with bacon in it. This was basically the best BLT I have ever had. The roll was fresh and soft with a crunchy crust. The bacon was prepared perfectly and was topped with just the right amount of lettuce and other things which blended together perfectly. For me, this sandwich was the perfect portion for lunch though I could have eaten a few more.   I also ordered the Salty Dulce de Leche ice cream which was recommended as their signature flavor. It was a rare warm day in SF and this was a perfect compliment. It's major ingredients were condensed milk and sea salt. It was creamy and tasted a bit like carmel. Somebody I know who swears by the bi-rite salty carmel told me that this was better in her opinion -- WHOH  The space is extremely minimalist and you will feel like you are ordering right in a kitchen. Patio seating is available at Enricos next door who I am guessing has a space sharing deal. The patio at Enricos is nice with comfy seats though there were a lot of gnats.   This is on the upper cost scale for lunch and the wait is a bit long so keep that in mind before deciding to come. I do think this is completely worth both the wait and cost.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: No Foie Gras and Duck Prosciutto sandwich?!  #whatthehell.  Coming on a Thursday, I already knew I was going to miss out on their Fried Chicken Sandwich (Tuesdays only).  But to deprive me of my Foie and Duck Prosciutto sandwich consolation prize/meal as well?  That's just mean!  Especially after I saw it listed on their daily menu the night before too.  Seriously, what are the odds that on the one random day I take off from work, they'd be shorthanded and unable to prep the foie for cooking?  Ugh...poop.  Thank goodness for their Pig and Fig sandwich though!  Filled with pork tenderloin, fig, bacon, and arugula, I had already felt tempted to order it before I found out about their foie sandwich.  So despite my order having been decided for me, at least I didn't have to worry about second guessing what I got.  When my sandwich was brought out, it looked delicious.  The tenderloin was seasoned and moist, and I really liked how the sweetness of the fig complemented the pork.  The basalmic vinegar and the arugula gave it a nice finish as well.  Oddly enough, I thought the bacon was the weakest part, as the taste didn't really come through for me.  Weird since bacon usually adds so much flavor, but I guess it just shows good the rest of it was.  In a way, the Pig and Fig reminded me of the pork porchetta sandwich at Roli Roti, except not as salty and sweeter because of the fig.  Not really sure which is better/worse, but I guess it depends more on your taste buds and the cut you get.  While this one was balanced with mostly meat and a little fat, the Roli Roti one can range from being dry or fatty depending on the mound in the sandwich.  Both are obviously good though, and this one was a nice consolation prize for the original consolation prize that went missing.  But for now, only four stars.  Why?  Well, I'll make you a deal Naked Lunch - give me a tasty foie or fried chicken sandwich, and I'll give you your fifth star!

u_7ZKHc5YNY2_mlE4Ext9A.review_text: This place is awesome. If someone didn't tell me about it I would have never have found it. The egg chorizo sando I got the other day was amazing. I didn't expect it to be that good.  Needless to say, I'll be back.

lcBxErp_W1aNAPD_2RikcA.review_text: few selections, but they were BOMB. the guy who was working was awesome too, he gave great suggestions. it seems like itd be a fun sports bar too! there are lots of tv's and some games.

eyt40SUZ8VWXyqxCxGfZTA.review_text: OMG, the food is great here!  We had sandwiches that were delicious, and I'm not even a sandwich person.  We got a soup that was perfection in a cup!  Everyone that works here is so nice and super friendly.  I wish I had tried their other restaurant, Txoko, before it closed, cos' if it was 1/2 as good as Naked Lunch, it must have been the bomb!  I hope Naked Lunch hangs around, cos' whenever I'm in the city at lunchtime, I'd like to stop by for soup and a sandwich!

7uTPernFCpg2U8PZS4iDfg.review_text: Can't remember the exact name of the soup I had a while back, but it was garlicy and creamy and off the HOOK!  And the bald guy who works the counter is fine as HELL!

mOnYWi_51_RfEuDhAW0ddw.review_text: Very good chicken sandwich!  Friendly staff and quick service.  I ordered to-go and go my sandwich in few minutes after I ordered.  It is a bit expensive for what you get ($9 total for just a sandwich).

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: It's been a long time since I've had Bakesale Betty's, but I think Naked Lunch's Fried Chicken Sandwich is way better. They use dark meat (at least mine was), and it made the sandwich extra juicy and flavorful. I liked everything better from the coleslaw to the garlic aioli; it was an overall more delicious and cohesive sandwich. The only fault is that maybe the chicken could be crispier.  They serve the fried chicken daily now (not just Tuesdays); I can't wait to return and try their other sandwiches!

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Went back to try something besides the fried chicken sandwich, and both were amazing!!!  Loch Duart Salmon Sandwich Olive, Cucumber, Dill, Pea Shoots, Horseradish Aioli $11    The other was a goat cheese + apples warm sandwich - WOWEE.  Not sure why I don't come here more often.  Probably the $11 sambo price tag. :)  DELISH!!!

fh29re0a3ktGCHQsmlu0hQ.review_text: My first time at NAKED LUNCH...All I can say is "Delicioso".  Alaskan Banded Rock Fish Sandwich Cucumber Pickles, Espelette, Capers, Garlic Aioli, Arugula

a4bOzepR-6fm6ixBo24ucw.review_text: Incredible fried chicken sandwich!  I was passing through the neighborhood, and stepped in to grab lunch. Everyone seemed to be getting the Fried Chicken Sandwich, and when in Rome ... The sandwich is great; the chicken is moist, the dressing decadent, and the bun plays the role of support character to perfection. Definitely get some of their hot sauce in there too. Also, the staff are incredibly friendly too. The waitress noticed my backpack, and we chatted a while a bit my travels.

PBUlB1-9PlL1YF1LF_jiWA.review_text: Really AWESOME staff-very accommodating and will you give you their honest opinions about the menu.  My braised pork sandwich was the bomb diggity (I was indecisive about it but I'm glad I went with it).  Would have been awesome if it came with a little bit of a side dish but it was still good on its own.   My man friend's fried chicken sandwich was so so...but he was satisfied with it.   It's also really nice that you can sit on the Enrico's heated lounge while you lunch.

6Ct6xwJt7AJD9amnMkNckA.review_text: 4.0 Stars  Say goodbye to Foie Gras in California on Sunday 7/1. With that said, tomorrow is the last time you can order the famous Foie Gras sandwich at Naked Lunch.   To avoid the crazy weekend rush, I made sure to come out extra early today to ensure I got my hands on this delicious sandwich. There are severely limited quantities of this sandwich and if you don't go early enough this place will run out. Today there were only 19 Foie Gras sandwiches available and I came as early as 10:30AM to line up for their opening at 11:30AM.  Now outside of the crazy wait, let's talk about the Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich itself. The Foie Gras is very rich, but is also a little sweet. It has a nice smooth/buttery texture that goes well with the tomatoes, butter lettuce, and black truffle salt. The sandwich isn't really big, but after eating half of it, I had to take a small break because it was so rich. Overall, I really enjoyed the texture and flavor of the sandwich, but the I wished the french baguette it was served on tasted better. The bread was pretty hard to chew and tore up the roof of my mouth. If the bread was slightly warm and crispy, the sandwich would have been perfect.  The price of Foie Gras has also skyrocketed within the last week in preparation for the ban. I remember when my friends first told me about this sandwich when it was $16. The price today was a whopping $25!  If you love Foie Gras, tomorrow is your last chance to get it in California. Come early to Naked Lunch and expect to wait! It's well worth it.  CASH ONLY. You don't want to wait in the long line and find out you can't pay with credit card. Don't make this mistake. You will be very sad.  == A MUST TRY! ==

vWdPsy4qe37W_lKlOIdszQ.review_text: Had a fried chicken sandwich, based on their recommendation that it's their most popular sandwich (or perhaps at least their most popular sandwich on rotation). Not cheap at $8, but really good. Good-sized solid piece of battered, deep-fried dark chicken meat on a bun with coleslaw and a hefty portion of mayo. Highly recommend it!

NeXRy1C7PxS7bvIcQ3SymA.review_text: Move over Bakesale Betty's.  All I can say is that I'm so thankful to be working in this area, only on Tuesdays might I add, and to have easy access to the fried chicken sandwich.  Let's see.  You unwrap the white paper and you look at this thing they call the FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH, which looks like a way better version of Jack in the Box's chicken sandwich.  And I'm being completely serious because it has the same, basic structure with similar ingredients:  1. Jack in the Box - Hamburger bun, lettuce, mayo, fried chicken (source unknown) 2. Naked Lunch - Pain de mie, coleslaw, green garlic aioli, fried chicken (Fulton Valley Farms)  See what I mean?  But boy, anyone who says they can't taste any difference between free range chicken meat and industrially processed chicken meat is a FOOL.  I looked at it with low expectations but as soon as I sank my teeth into the first bite, it was so juicy and flavorful.  The high quality ingredients literally transforms this from simple to amazing.  They do slather the aioli on quite a bit which gave my stomach a warning sign but luckily it coped.  Now I really believe that the marketing brains and food scientists behind fast food chains are geniuses.  Constantly pumping out new combinations, they're giving their better version of the industry ideas on what to serve.  All you need is better quality stuff.
