bZGJW4ppJILAfFdAmFj7xw.review_text: 4.5 stars.   A good friend suggested we go here during our lunch break. We got the battered cod sandwich with marinated cucumbers and pickles, and fuya persimmon sandwich with arugula, chevre, and balsamic onions.   The cod must have been at least half an inch thick, but was the most moist battered cod piece i have ever tasted. Marinated cucumbers worked well and gave it a nice texture.  What surprised me more was the persimmon sandwich. I don't even like persimmon that much, and that combined with chevre, arugula and balsamic onions sounded a little weird. It turned out to be a great combination however, and I fell in love with this place soon after eating.  minor con: they don't take credit cards.   Conclusion: prices are a bit steep for the size of the sandwich but i didn't mind.

cie1b9elyL3Xd-aXLvi6DA.review_text: Being from the 'hood and having worked in the area as well, North Beach is pretty synonymous with rinse-repeat lunch options. While other neighborhoods have been infused with experimental foodie outlets, NB generally gets relegated to strip clubs and usually tourist targeted crappy food... most times, both are the same place (yeah, Hustler club).  Now insert Naked Lunch. Right on Broadway in a leased out portion of Enricos. It's simple, quick, clean and offers up gourmet sandwiches for a very reasonable price. With a menu that changes daily, I inhaled my fried chicken sandwich in minutes. Juicy, crispy and topped with a delicious slaw, I was definitely impressed. And if that wasn't enticing enough, if you dine in, you have a perfect shot of the Transamerica building basking in the sun, lost tourists confused by all the seedy businesses on Broadway and seeing day-shift strippers hoping out for a smoke.    I'm hoping all goes well for this place - as well as hoping that their menu continues to change and involve to keep up with fickle people like me - and appreciate this much welcomed addition to the area.

Muw_I2W2T032PleLH3HItQ.review_text: Super cool place! It's one really big room with tables and booths around the edges so you can sit down and enjoy your food (To reiterate what everyone else has said, the fried chicken sandwich is so good!). There are two pool tables, a basketball shooter and the TV was were playing the March Madness games. The bar area is great also great for just standing around with people and having a drink.   Happy hour  is sweet too - you can get a bucket of 6 PBRs for $10!

D-_5rw7GQuYhp-i5K11RxQ.review_text: There aren't many options on the menu at Naked Lunch, but I can appreciate how it makes choosing something a lot simpler. I got a cheeseburger, my date got a chicken sandwich, and we split an order of fries. We ate our lunch outside since the weather was nice. The burger was commendable, but not quite exceptional. I had a bit of the chicken sandwich, which was pretty good. The fries were well seasoned and tasted great with and without the dip.

zIjAnlO8_MqXXNTI_LvdOg.review_text: Six words for Naked Lunch: Finger-lickin'-good fried chicken sandwich.

pSjVzqKoLbhREfa6kOtfeA.review_text: This ain't subway, y'all.  I finally hit up Naked Lunch yesterday...it's only a few blocks from the office, totally walkable for me.  Why haven't I come before??    Had the skirt steak with blue chese aioli, arugula, and some kind of onion jam I think.  It was heavenly!  I've never had skirt steak so tender...the blue cheese was piquant but not overwhelming, the arugula a nice soft peppery bite, and the onion jam was sweet and set everything off perfectly.  I honestly can't remember ever having a better sandwich.  Yes, it's a bit pricey, but it is phenomenal.  The cinnamon sweet tea and bag of 4505 Chicharrones were pretty darn fabulous too.  I'll be hitting this place up on a regular basis...and next time I'm trying that foie gras sandwich.

KbYzTFbhR4FFyWAILb-4lg.review_text: WOW.  Just wow!  Some of the BEST sandwiches I have ever tasted in my life and I'm usually not even a sandwich person!  Without any hesitation, I went for the foie gras torchon and duck prosciutto.  A lil on the pricier side, but that baby melted in my mouth like rich butter!  The hubby had his heart set of the soft shell crab sammy, but sadly, they were all sold out.  Instead, he opted for the veggies sandwich with asparagus and manchego cheese and OMG, that sandwich totally stole the show!  As mentioned, I'm usually not a sandwich person, let alone a veggie sandwich, but my goodness, that sandwich was so addicting, I almost ate the whole thing for him.  :P  I have yet to try their ice cream, but I have heard great things about it.  Another reason I need to come back!    Too bad they're only open for a small window of the day + they're closed on Sundays or Mondays, but this is one place I always look forward to whenever I'm out in the North Beach area!

5SBWWScaC4QNql6XkHJPmw.review_text: A note to tourists-- Naked Lunch rents a space next to an italian restaurant that is only open for dinner--so there is no bathroom.  However, they do have outdoor seating with heaters in order to sit and enjoy their delicious sandwiches and salads.  I ordered the roasted fennel, spinach, and goat cheese sandwich and my friend the asparagus salad.  Even though I could have scarfed down my entire sandwich, I saved half of it for my plane ride home.  This place is so good, now I have to read the book.

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: I think I've found my dream gourmet sandwich.  While Naked Lunch is justifiably known for it's fried chicken sandwich (yes, it's very very good), my heart goes out to the fois gras and duck sandwich.  Of course I do have a soft spot for fois gras.  And if you do too then you really need to come here.  It's not too busy.  Usually there's just a couple of other customers there.  The sandwich takes about 5-10 minutes to make and off you go.  I also recommend getting the chicharrones to snack on.

YOChRzTztTL_KooP9wEtSQ.review_text: Best chicken sandwich ever!  After hearing about the chicken sandwich for weeks, I finally had the chance to try it.  I decided to order Mary's Farm Fried Chicken Sandwich ($9).  The sandwich absolutely blew my mind!  The chicken thigh was lightly breaded and extremely moist and tender and placed in a soft bun.  Upon the first bite the juices from the coleslaw and garlic aioli drips outs.  Be sure to splash on some Crystal hot sauce on every bite (or a few bites under your bun, depending on how spicy you like your food).  To accompany my chicken sandwich, I ordered a pomegranate mimosa.  My only disappointment was that they were sold out of 4505 chicharonnes.  WHAT TO KNOW: *CASH ONLY!! *Menu changes daily *Only open for lunch Monday through Saturday 11:30-2:00pm *Indoor bar seating (approx 4 bar stools) or outdoor seating next door in front of Txoko  I can't wait to come back!

LV3YdkfD85Ib5iEZ7sxC3Q.review_text: DAMN!!! That is a mighty fine thing you are doing there guys. I have had many sandwiches at this establishment that made me bow to the ground and call my mama with tears from the deliciousness that is naked lunch running down my face. I always seem to have an adrenaline rush when I try to make it before they close because if you miss it, nothing will taste good for the rest of the day because your mind was set on the finest sandwich in the city. The duck one ain't my favorite, although its your signature thing. A little bit to fatty even though I am a duck addict (that sounds good out loud). EVERYTHING else I have ever tried, which is quite a few of em, were life changing however.

gvyYZgFdBbcT3xGjWOvZag.review_text: Three reasons why you need to go to Naked Lunch:  1. North Beach is a great SF hang-out. Just a block away from City Lights books and other wonderful Beat Lit. haunts.  2. Naked Lunch was a pretty good book, so it can be assumed that a place bearing its name should serve pretty good food.  3. FOIE GRAS DUCK PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH.   I repeat: FOIE GRAS DUCK PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH.   Sure, it's a little pricey, but HELLO, DECADENCE! Not for the weak of heart.

5B96o1oJNMy348z_W0z_ng.review_text: I didn't have the foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich even though its their signature sandwich. I couldn't rationalize the $16 spent for lunch even if it's the Bentley of all sandwiches. Maybe on another day when I'm feeling the need to splurge and treat myself to such a fine sandwich.   Today I had the chorizo and egg sandwich with garlic confit, pequillo peppers, pickled onions, basil and arugula. This cost $9 which is still a pricier lunch option for me. I usually try to keep it around $7 or bring my own food but I wanted to try something new and I'm glad I did. It was so good. The ingredients were really fresh. The egg was cooked over medium and stayed that way even as I was walking the 3 or 4 bocks back to the office. It smelled amazing the whole time and when I finally got to devour it, I ate it super slowly just to savor each bite.   Yes. It was one of those meals. The kind you remember. The kind that Sally would have did the fake orgasm scene for.  I can only imagine what the foie gras and duck prosciutto (I thought proscuitto was pork?)sandwich is like.

fitXjNnwVB_HzqaBSrIGXQ.review_text: Great lunch spot in North Beach. The fried chicken sandwich is incredibly satisfying. The place itself has great seating and venue design. The only downside right now is that the menu isn't very extensive so it's possible you won't find what you want if you aren't in the mood for the fried chicken sandwich (the main staple).

tEStbT_jIZzmGrkBwLx-kw.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
tEStbT_jIZzmGrkBwLx-kw.review_text: I've been coming to this wonderful place often since I moved to the neighborhood a couple years ago. I love the large, open atmosphere with the option of great front row seating to all of Broadway's shenanigans. Great place to hang out with friends after work or meet up with colleagues for a drink or bite to eat.    The food is the real reason why I frequent this place. They are best known for the fried chicken sandwich. I also believe they have the best burger in North Beach, which is often on the menu. I usually get the specialty salad when it's available, or the vegetarian sandwich (based on what's in season). On Sunday nights, they have an amazing Asian-fusion popup called Chao Mien. This is some of the best asian-fusion food I've ever had, and it's quite reasonably priced. The drink cocktails are quite excellent too! Highly recommended!

UyhnjAlyMXtbR-qB5kkhlQ.review_text: I realized that my last review was terribly outdated. What's changed in the last 3+ years?  - Naked Lunch has expanded into the space next door (RIP Txoko), so there are plenty of indoor seats available now. - Open for dinner and on weekends too - Wine and beer available - Credit cards accepted - RIP foie gras duck prosciutto sandwich, thanks to the foie gras ban. The fried chicken sandwich is now on. the menu every day.   Despite the above changes, Naked Lunch still offers consistently good food and is a great neighborhood go-to place.   I don't like sandwiches in general, but I like the sandwiches here.

j2ikzb9WbFvObcFTcESh8Q.review_text: Known for their fried chicken sandwiches, I opted to take a walk up here for lunch.  Some of their other options sounded pretty appetizing but I just had to try the chicken.  I wish I had tried something else.  It was a good sandwich, but I was expecting something extraordinary for the hype and money.  The chicken was crispy and juicy but could have been seasoned more.  After trying one of Bakesale Bettys flavor-packed chicken sandwiches, I was not blown away by Naked Lunch.  Nevertheless, they do serve a good sandwich!  I hope to try some of their other options sometime.

XvKdp9PB4rKJKwI798mJgg.review_text: Not a huge menu, but it is a bar. I got the salad and it was GREAT! Had pomegranate seeds, blue cheese, and walnuts. So good. My friend got the pork burger and said it was great. The waitress/bartender was also really friendly and knew a lot about the ingredients!

F5PeWdJZqT8BAQD7LnY6_Q.review_text: I work pretty close to this place but  have never been for lunch because they have a limited menu and I just assumed the food wouldn't be that great.  Yesterday my coworker suggested we try it and I am so glad we did! First of all, amazing that there is actually a place in north beach for salad! Granted there was only one but it was delicious (manchego cheese, nuff said!). And their asparagus sandwich was perfect for a hot day. Amazingly enough the asparagus was cooked perfectly, not too chewy or too soft which is a feat I've never been able to accomplish.  Really appreciate the outdoor seating as well. It's a little noisy because it's right on Broadway but it was nice nonetheless. To top it off nothing was over $12! Another great find for this expensive neighborhood.

Za1grDmkLhT8I77974QjaA.review_text: Time: Lunch Price: $11 for just the sandwich Atmosphere: Casual, friendly, local (outdoor seating great on a nice day!) Menu: They always have something new, but everything is delicious Food: I got the Pork Belly sandwich. My advice... get the pork belly sandwich. It was deliciously tender and juicy. Its not huge, but it will fill you up. Service: Great friendly people.  Awesome place for some lunch. Its a little pricey, but its comparable to most of the restaurants around that area. Food is top notch!  CASH ONLY! (Wells fargo across the street)

fZ3HxBq8ZCZ6WcULylTlvg.review_text: What a hidden gem.   On a balmy Saturday night the crowd was semi-Marina and fratty. Some young faced mixed with some not, the bar had a really chill vibe, not to crowded and a great beer selection. The burger with manchengo was amazing! It was a great night to sit outside, the heat lamps made it even better.  There were TV's with the Warriors game on, a pool table and a few other games. Seems like a low key and chill place to get a late night dinner and beer with friends.

Hj_GF8MnikDy4BQzf0B8Dg.review_text: TO DIE...for!  Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich (Tomato, Butter Lettuce, Black Truffle Salt).  This is a perfect sandwich to share since it's packed with flavor and buttery goodness.    Soft Shell Crab Sandwich.  Delish.  Roasted Asparagus & Sheep's Ricotta Sandwich.  Surprisingly, my 2nd runner up.    Cinnamon Sweet Tea and 4505 Chicharrones.  A hit!    Must...try...now!

VXkWdpyo6fEd3RsfpBDwmQ.review_text: Amazing foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich, with heirloom tomato..mmm.mmm.  If I could eat this every day for the rest of my life, I'd die a happy girl.  Staff is very friendly, service is prompt.  Location a little inconvenient but that sando, whoa....worth every penny!

DVl7v-7aNaDsMMFcEyxbrA.review_text: Ate here for the first time yesteray and will definitely be going back.  Skirt steak sandwich with piquillo peppers, arugula, aoili was ridiculous.    Juicy, perfectly cooked (medium) steak chopped into little chunks smothered in the sauce and fixins, on their delicious coal-fire toasted bread.  The sandwich is so good I couldn't slow down to savor it...no talking or enjoying the sunshine, just demolition.   My friend had the fried sweet potato sandwich with some kind of french (brie style, but stronger) cheese which was also amazing.  Plus the cinnamon ice tea is bomb!  Only knock is value (11 bucks for steak, 9 for sweet potato) since the sandwiches are not big.  But Im a straight baller so value is not really an issue for me.

OIGusm5JjFCkGglzgrdOoQ.review_text: Maybe their drinks are good or maybe the food tastes a lot better after some drinks but on their own, let's just say I've had better food at Disneyland. Tried their famous chicken sandwich, as well as the fries, and wouldn't recommend either for a sober stomach. The service was good and everyone seemed nice, but that will only get you so far in this city.

Ow-Xwx0TtjDoYB0ooWNKlA.review_text: Ever since people bet the farm, and lost it, on Las Vegas real estate, aspirational cuisine has got it stuck in its head that we all want to eat out of food trucks, on sidewalks in front of abandoned buildings, and to eat overly fancy burgers (e.g., Hubert Keller's Burger Bar), pizza (Delfina Pizzeria), and sandwiches (Tom Colicchio's 'wichcraft) for a premium price. The object is to make us believe we are not spending much money for fine dining, in a no-frills airline sort of way, while still charging us far more than the typical fare of a roach coach or corner dive than we're used to.  What we diners get is faux austerity. We essentially pay a premium to get better-than-average food in exchange for a run-down setting and the false veneer of not blowing our budget on amenities, like a toilet or plastic forks. In the end, what we really get is a tricked out Honda Civic for the same price we could have bought a BMW.  Naked Lunch plays this post-economic-crash mind game to a "T". The sandwiches are inventive, somewhat creative, and tastier than your typical sandwich. They'll even offer an interesting soup and/or salad for $6-$7.  But no matter what bread you use and what you put on it, sandwiches are lazy and boring. While the food is of good quality overall (this is no traditional chain fast food joint), it exemplifies this lazy, pedestrian formula towards aspirational cuisine at the semi-affordable end: grade school cafeteria menus with big pants ingredients - and prices.  Come on, chefs! So you want us to eat out more thinking we're spending less. I don't care if you're a five-star chef: it's still a burger. You just managed to charge me double what I would normally pay for it. Can't you honestly be more creative and thoughtful than pushing downmarket sandwiches, burgers, and pizza with upscale ambitions?  I understand these are not high times to be spending money on lavish lunches. And the slight of hand here partially works. But the suspension of disbelief only goes so far before you realize you just paid $16 for a pretty good sandwich at a place that has neither a toilet nor silverware and makes you sit in front of the abandoned Enrico's next door. Even their $6 soup comes in a disposable coffee cup.  Three stars -- as no one can rationally compare the quality of a no-frills sandwich pusher with food truck envy to the care, quality, and preparation that goes into something like a five-star French Laundry (what? are you guys on drugs? at least pretend like you get out to eat once in a while to make a rational quality comparison). No sandwich shop could, nor should, ever receive more than four stars. That and we have honestly had a rare but slightly better sandwich elsewhere.  I'd go back if I was in the mood for a sandwich, but I rarely am. And how much effort does it really take to make an excellent sandwich yourself at home?

9wU9uMzC0O3b9HMNElKNuw.review_text: Delicious fried chicken sandwich. Perfect proportion of coleslaw and chicken, try it with the spicy sauce to give it a little kick.  The decor is hipster Western, but definitely a welcoming environment. I got here around 12 on Friday with no line, by the time we left at 12:45 there was a line out the door. This is definitely my new go to lunch spot.

hEc9VHdbec_Lhi6Qtdq6Og.review_text: Great place with a very simple menu. I ordered the classic fried chicken sandwich and was quite impressed. The sandwich itself is not that big, but the ingredients used were simply wonderful.   I will definitely go back and try something different. I will say that the sandwich did not completely fill me up, but I also didn't feel like I needed much more (maybe a side of chips would have curbed that feeling).   Neverthemore, great place :)

IcShovp4fE-FQQ-0H5MHCA.review_text: Came here on Valentine's Day right in time for Fried Chicken Tuesday! I was super excited, but alas, I think it was just ok. I still stay true to my true love of fried chicken sandwiches, Bakesale Betty's in Oakland. Here's what we ordered at Naked Lunch:  Fried Chicken Sandwich (3 stars): The bff and I both ordered this. For $8, I think you get a fairly decent portion. The chicken was crispy, very moist and tender since it was dark meat. But the sandwich as a whole was just ok. I wasn't a huge fan of the creamy, sweet mayo-ish sauce they had in the sandwich, and I would've liked more veggies as well. I think the sandwich needed more zest, and I had to add hot sauce on every bite.  Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich (2.5 stars): The bf ordered this. Maybe we didn't know what we were getting into... but woweeee, this sandwich was wayyyy too rich. There's definitely $16 worth of foie gras in there, but I think it's just too overwhelming to have all that in one sandwich. I'd only recommend to order this if you know you LOVE foie gras.  Cinnamon Iced Tea (3 stars): Not bad, I just thought it was a little too sweet for my taste. Cinnamon with iced tea is a really interesting combination though.  I may come back in the future to try other sandwiches, but for now I'll just stick with 3-stars. Here are some last tips: parking is a BEEZY, menus are posted online, and it's CASH ONLY.

ZC5XEWsIbxsxSQb5zN1gpA.review_text: i still cannot give them anything higher than a 3 because i haven't tried the foie sandwich yet!! I'M SO BUMMMMMMEEEED!!!!  naked lunch is on broadway up kearny... so that is FAAAR from my work... seriously... FAR! it's like crossing two neighbor hoods before reaching it! so in order for me to get there, i con my friends that either has a day off or are in the area with a car to get there... so it's WORK to eat lunch here...   i was SO excited that i got my friend to agree to come here to try lunch as i had to sell him on their menu by looking at yelp pictures... so we were so psyched to come here and i was SOOO excited to FINALLY try their foie and duck procuitto sandwich...   BUT TO MY SUPRISE they didn't have it AGAIN! ughhh.... soooo disappointed!   instead i had their chicken bacon sandwich.  the chicken sandwich was good and the chicken was tender, so i'm not saying that they don't have good sandwiches... but i'm just dying to write a review saying how great their foie sandiwch is... i'm determined to write that review....   so anyone wanna drive me to naked lunch for lunch?!?!?!?!

-aT1RSHfHDgqE5lFK-S9MA.review_text: You must try the Asparagus Sandwich. It's to die for. Or like, really, really want it. Lost a star because they moved the location into the bar and forget about waiting 20 minutes in line for a sandwich. You have to call in unless you want to waste half of your lunch break waiting.

X7NruZXmLRCXnYpa6ylwRg.review_text: I love fried chicken. And I love foie gras. Knowing well that I love those two things, Linda L. insisted she takes me to a lunch that would satisfy on both fronts. Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich with Heirloom Tomato, Butter Lettuce and Black Truffle Salt. Just the name alone had me salivating. Creamy, velvety foie gras torchon with slices of aromatic duck prosciutto create one luxe sandwich. The Fulton Valley Farms Fried Chicken Sandwich with Creamy Coleslaw and Garlic Aioli on Pain De Mie is one of the top 5 best sandwiches I have had this year. Juicy, tender pieces of fried chicken with a lightly breaded crispy skin are topped with a creamy cole slaw. Don't forget to utilize the bottle of Louisiana Crystal Hot Sauce at the table to its full extent. The bread soaks up all the mayonnaise, fried chicken juices, and hot sauce. yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao… Total fried chicken heaven.

0G-QF457q_0Z_jKqh6xWiA.review_text: Sandwiches seem *too* simple but like an excerpt from any of Hemingway's work, that simplicity is oh-so-deceiving. When you dive in, you delight in the complexity contained within. It's all about reading between the slices of (scrumptious) bread, so to speak.   I eyed the chalkboard menu with suspicion when I entered Naked Lunch. It changes daily and today's displayed four choices, one of which was vegetarian. Ho hum, I'm thinking. The description of the vegwich was not exciting. Why oh why do I continue to be all about the bells and whistles? I need to trust in good sandwich shops (I should just think of Kansas City's famous Happy Gillis and be reminded of how good they can be. To be fair, HG warrants the full five stars for its darling decor with seating and the side of fruit that garnishes the sandwiches. Plus they have a dozen more options. Just sayin'). I was also kind of put off by the hipster foie gras t-shirts the staff wore, but since they (the staff, not the shirts) were so awesome, I got over that mighty quick. Like the "I live for bacon" trend, I find the foie gras celebration to be so fucking tired. Just call me a jaded vegetarian. It's too boring to even be offended by it. Besides, *no one* can top Anthony Bourdain shouting "I'll force feed you and dine on your liver" (poorly paraphrased) to a goose.   So, I grudgingly ordered the veg sandwich which came with summer squash, red peppers (usually a flag for me), onions (an even redder flag), chevre and avocado. To drink? The cinnamon/lemon iced tea. They need to be more effusive when describing this exquisite concoction. I normally stick to water, but the mention of cinnamon that got me. This was easily the BEST iced tea I've ever had in my life. I say this without hesitation.   There is no seating inside this tiny storefront obviously, but you get to sit in a lovely sidewalk cafe next door where they bring you your order. Loved this shaded area. Idyllic, really.  The sandwich came with little fanfare, wrapped in wax paper (love that). I unwrapped it and knew i was in for it. DIEVINE!!! I do not exaggerate! I appreciated that the veggies were stacked high, the peppers and onion were used sparingly, as they should be: a *condiment* (at least in my world). The chevre, absolutely perfect.   I feel compelled to go on again about that iced tea. I hate sweet tea (makes me nauseous), but this was sweet/spicy/lemony and oh dear god, I might find myself hiking up here again this week just to grab an iced tea. It's that bad. I mean, I have it *that bad* for the iced tea.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: The fried chicken sammie and cinnamon sweet tea are a MUST TRY! Order at the bar counter, get a number, grab utensils and then grab a seat.  There is outdoor seating in the front and great to soak in some sunshine and people watch.  Cool place in the midst of a bunch of strip clubs!

PoFUmeVGahgjlJoiv3Uf-A.review_text: This is a really great lunch spot in the location next door to Enrico's in North Beach.  The menu is fairly small, but it changes every day.  There are generally 2 or 3 sandwiches, a soup and a salad.  Sounds limiting, but everything on the menu is good so you don't mind.  I'd seen the Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto sandwich before, but it's not always on the menu.  Today someone suggested we go for luch, so I checked their site beforehand to confirm it was on the daily menu.  It was, so we headed up the hill.  The sandwich is as decadent as it sounds.  There's no big mystery to be explained; this is just a pile of unctuous ingredients.  "If you take medication for chest pains, you should not try Cialis...or this sandwich."  They only have a small counter inside the restaurant, so most people dine on the patio at Enrico's.  It's a great location and a great meal.  Remember to bring cash.  The reason it's taken me so long to come here is that they're cash only, and I rarely carry legal tender anymore.  Also, their ATM was out of order.

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: The chicken sandwich rivals that of Bakesale Betty's across the bay.  The fried chicken is steaming hot but goes well with the creamy slaw and the side of hot sauce.  Yes, it's messy but one of the best sandwiches I've had of late.  I literally devoured it while standing beside my car on Broadway and using the hood as a tabletop.  Classy.  Plus, to celebrate the 1-year anniversary of Naked Lunch, the chicken was only $4 (half off).  So naturally, I got two.  Luckily, I was the third person in line and by the time I got my sammies, the wait was considerable.    Even at regular price, it's worth it for something this good.  But at half off, I felt like I won the lotto.  Kind of.

a0DwyYWrg4LbrSinWd1Beg.review_text: Wow. Amazing friend chicken sandwich. Super brussels sprout sandwich (what?!) but they could figure a better way of ordering. Having 15 people at the bar and not in a line is just chaos and doesn't make any sense. However, this is a super casual place, so ordering food is kind of like ordering a drink at a bar. Except they say, "who's next" as if there's an order. There's not.   We'll be back no matter.  Oh, and sitting outside on the patio was great. Lots of cute dogs to watch.

uRkKGeT58wdUxEEA6O4LIw.review_text: Fried chicken sandwich.  Get it, and be sure to grab the hot sauce.

gk5BjGoT--YRci9ZJ_WElQ.review_text: Decided to come here again . Their butternut squash soup isn't that great ... the soup is too thin . However , their fried chicken sandwich which they only have on Tuesdays is awesome !! The fried chicken sandwich itself already deserves 5 stars regardless of whatever else they have . I didn't expect much from the fried chicken sandwich . It expected it to be oily and greasy like how most fried foods are but the sandwich was anything but that . The chicken was nice and juicy . The chicken was very tender and packed with flavor . It was so yummy ... the best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had !! I will definitely be back again for their fried chicken sandwich .

bd8ReDCweBV48OynZ0Vnvw.review_text: I usually spend M-F in Downtown Oakland, but because I had a Friday off, I trekked over to Naked Lunch, determined to try a place that's been so lauded. Sadly, it wasn't Tuesday so I couldn't try their fried chicken sandwich, but the pork tenderloin/bacon/cabbage/arugala on Acme was a delicious choice. Great flavors. From the times I've checked out Naked Lunch's website, it seems like they have a knack for identifying tasty combinations.   I sat at the counter, where there's about five seats, but they also have a heated patio next door with a fair amount of seating.   At $11, I do think the sandwich is overpriced. The ingredients are high quality, obviously, but still, over $10 for a not so huge sandwich at a takeout place is steep.

i-DWCn1Xk5-exHi0mBDO1g.review_text: Nice place to hang out, although in the midst of many strip clubs...this place is not like one of those though. :P  Fried chicken sandwich = excellent, pretty much lives up to the hype  Selection of drinks = unimpressive, stick to beers and wines that you know...they're not very good at making cocktails  Play pool or shoot some basketball here, around $1 I think.

qu-r6QIV46StPjPYKt51Og.review_text: The foie gras ban is fast approaching, and my co-workers and I are determined to consume as much as we can in the next month. Today we tried the foie gras torchon and proscuitto sandwich. It was pretty good, but a bit salty. It also cost $18 so we were a bit disappointed that it only came with some lettuce and tomatoes.  We got there a little past noon and scored the last 2 foie gras sandwiches. This worked out well because we were able to split one other kind. We decided on the fried chicken sandwich and were pleasantly surprised. The chicken was crispy and flavorful and came with coleslaw and garlic aioli. For $8, it seemed like quite the deal compared to the foie gras sandwich.  The owners of Naked Lunch also own Txoko's, which is right next door. If you're a fellow foie gras lover, you'll be happy to know that they are hosting foie gras dinners on Wednesdays. Make a reservation before it's too late!

SuMBnQQ7G1dKAP7ciIC82w.review_text: If you like fried chicken sandwiches DO NOT GO ANYWHERE ELSE ON TUESDAY. . . but try to keep it a local secret ; )

H-qiPCLVKFKi4uBiOgTauA.review_text: Fried Chicken sandwich,  beer braised pork sandwich, and incredibly warm and fast service. Loved it.

G_wTpaDdpcPlqQmGIhWcyg.review_text: Naked Lunch has been on my "to try" list for weeks and I finally made it there yesterday.  To help you find it, it is in the Enrico's take-out space - during the day it is Naked Lunch and at night it reverts to Enrico's.  If you get overwhelmed by choice, Naked Lunch's compact menu will be a relief.  I had the Fra' Mani chorizo sandwich with bacon, D'Anjou pears and baby greens ($9) and it was delicious!  I literally inhaled the first half of this sandwich (and I am not one to swoon over a sandwich), took a breath and decided to save the other half for later - still delicious hours later!    I wonder if you can sit at Enrico's outside tables?  There is one lonely table in front of Naked Lunch, so we nabbed it.

qLUkZ4vhK73qzjB3k8LKVw.review_text: foie gras and duck prosciutto on crusty bread... is this even legal? it's certainly not healthy. but who cares--it is AWESOME! sure, at $16 or so it's a bit steep for lunch, but sometimes you just need to treat yourself with something that might just kill you. the sandwich was tasty, savory, super rich and quite satisfying. even the lettuce is butter lettuce (haha).  also had the refreshing watermelon mint cooler, which went very nicely with the rich sandwich.

ErB6CWYEcE1BJ7pRjEygzg.review_text: This review is kinda overdue but what the heck. I came in sometime last year. I work in FiDi and was getting tired of the choices there so I took the MUNI out to Naked Lunch. I'm not originally from SF BTW. Anyway, so the minute I got off the bus I then knew why the place was called Naked Lunch! Ha!   I ordered the foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich, asparagus salad and the dulce de leche ice cream. I loved the bread. I believe they use Acme. The asparagus was crunchy and fresh and blended well with the manchego and preserved meyer lemon. The ice cream was salty and sweet indeed, just like I like it. I went all out! The price was steep...a little over $25. Whatever. The guys working the place were awesome. Very nice people. Everything was yummy, though I don't know if I'll splurge on a sandwich like that anytime soon. I will probably come back to try out that fried chicken sandwich that everyone keeps talking about though.

5tPrJtegCcpS4vrudCpkNg.review_text: I am seriously in love with the Naked Lunch. I am a weekly customer and I have been trying to write a review for this place for weeks... but it must be perfect. Until that time comes, let me just say this:  Naked Lunch is that REALLY hot girl at school that doesn't know she's sexy yet. Trust me though, she will find out soon. Better hit on her before her milkshake brings the rest of the city/bay area to her yard.

srj-v0WSYa-1gpmffbeypg.review_text: Finally tried their Fried Chicken Sandwich yesterday.  I've been burning with curiosity about this place and, in particular, this sandwich, since they opened.  I ordered one to go and ate it at home, knowing how messy it might be and I might need to wash my face afterwards :-)   Well, it wasn't quite that bad but I'm still glad I took it home to eat.  Since I did that, i have to excuse it a bit for not being as crunchy as it can be.  The aioli is such a tasty addition to the mix.  The chicken was seasoned just right. The portion was fair for the price.  I just wish they have a smaller version for those of us who ended up overeating because we don't want to waste the last 3 or 4 bites of it but it's not quite enough to share with another on its own.

MlP4oTTCc09lnvo6OYjNKA.review_text: Wonderful food. I love how often their menu changes. Everything is creative and unusual. Chicken sandwich is a great go-to meal, but a little greasy. Soups and salads are some of the best I've ever had (I usually get both, which adds up to $16 but it's like a culinary experience or whatever).   Also, this place is AWESOME for after-work drinks. Not nearly as busy as many other places in North Beach, even on weekends. Love playing pool here and getting a pint or two!

z5GeSn_G5B85vZ6FKIfDew.review_text: i go pretty much every Friday, and most of the time the sandwiches are worth the price.  for example, the basque cheese steak was worth it - very delicious tender steak with yummy sauce.

VjUuaL2A0QwrRZ8hDdFf7Q.review_text: hot damn.  thumbs up:  Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich Braised Artichoke & Triple Cream Cheese Sandwich Basil Limeade 4505 Chicharrones    best thursday afternoon ever.

9d9kgq7womnxi_NGKsJMEA.review_text: Solid lunch spot that is definitely worth a try but is probably not a place I would go to on a regular basis.  Pros: The sandwiches are good Daily changing menu, with the fried chicken sandwich a constant  Cons: Very small menu and if you are not feeling what they have that day they won't just put together a sandwich the way you want it Overpriced for what you get, the sandwiches are not that big

wkklbFK50TTkd1GJXXAntA.review_text: I ate at this restaurant because they were profiled in the local newspaper.  Great decision!  Food was yum.  I had the steak sandwich.  Steak was a little more medium than I like--just meant it was tender!  I recommend it!

dTdltcr2EC5oMZ1rs795PA.review_text: Stop messing around and order the chicken sando + fries.  Or get the burger.    They know what they're doing here people.  They've also got an assortment of other sandwiches on a daily rotation, which they can be hit or miss.  but sometimes huge hits and near misses.    I keep asking them every time, when they're going to bring back the 2 person ribeye, but my wishes are still yet unfulfilled . . .

Lzj2XrHofaMtvqtwKmYCeg.review_text: The Naked Lunch is now responsible for 5 of my favorite lunch food items, Ive just realized.  1. The bacon, chorizo, etc 2. Today's marinated skirt steak 3. The pig and peach 4. The best lemonade I have ever tasted 5. The best pork skins Ive ever tasted. (I know they dont make them, but they introduced me to them)  My friend and I walked up to NL today and waited for maybe 5 minutes before our food showed up. Incidentally, the waiter at NL is also a DJ who plays around town and played for us at a Chinatown bar called Li Po last night, so that was interesting.  I sat down and started in on my marinated, grilled skirt steak sandwich but before I took a bite, my buddy gave me a sip of his lemonade. The yellow liquid gushed and squirted in great rivulets, running down my cheeks and face, all over my chest and lap into a golden pool at my feet. Fellow patrons at the outdoor seating area at NL today were treated to a surprise they werent expecting, I think its fair to say. Next, I took a crap in a bag and.... wait....  So as I was saying, the opposition to prop19 really succeeded in presenting fear and misinformation to the masses. I find 'masses' to be a really cool word, especially when used to describe unusual growths found inside the body!  Oh Im so sorry! Juggling food reviews, office work, erotic story writing, and political tomfoolery can be a challenge. You really have to be careful with that windows clipboard. Seriously.  So the skirt steak. It was marinated in something I cannot identify, but can take a guess at. It was slightly salty and quite savory, a little sweet but not overly so. I detected garlic, but no citrus or anything acidic. The marinade was very mellow and the meat also had a nice smokey taste from the grill. The texture and consistency of this skirt steak was perfectly suited for a sandwich and all my usual complaints about the chore of eating steak inside bread were not heard. This meat was so succulent and tender that I never found myself wanting to rip it from between the bread with my bare hands, as with many other steak sandwiches Ive had. The bread was super fresh, as always, the garlic aioli was on time and evenly distributed, and everything came together excellently. This sandwich is easily my #2 all time fav sandwich and was perfectly sized for my appetite.  About that lemonade. My buddy really *did* let me sample his lemonade which caused me to run back to the counter and order one of my own. This lemonade was hands-down the best Ive had. It was freshly squeezed juice, water, a reasonable amount of sugar, and the very light essences of ginger and anise. These flavors were balanced so well that one would think a team of scientists had slaved over the periodic table for years to arrive at the conclusion that led to the discovery of this lemonade. The anise and ginger were flavors that did not affect the actual taste of the lemonade much, but interacted almost exclusively with the acidity of the lemon juice. These 2 essences smoothed almost all acid in the taste, yet left all the strength of the lemon. The anise is very slightly detected by the palate if you swish the stuff around and look for it. Superb lemonade.  The Naked Lunch is totally awesome and their great staff well deserving of the 2 tips I left them during this visit.  I expected the food to be great so I left 2 bucks in the can.  After eating our meal, both my buddy and I walked right back up to the counter and placed additional dollars in the can to show our appreciation.

eYEvxALCtggvPI_Z8IgFVA.review_text: I don't even like tomato soup, but I was feeling lousy the day my friends all dragged me to Naked Lunch, so I ordered the soup.  Wow, that's some amazing soup.  They claim not to put much in it, just some cream and a few spices, but it really hits the spot.  The toasted croutons on top were just right (staying crunchy throughout), and the chives were chopped thin so they're not overpowering.  Naked Lunch has great presentation, as hopefully is evident in my photos, but the food tastes even better than it looks.  I just hope they bring back the seared tuna sandwich, as I've yet to try it...

T212EYmHggSZ4_2ALmGs-g.review_text: I've said it before, and I will say it again... I am not a sandwich fan.   I don't know if it's the fact that I am getting older, or if I am finally discovering the best sandwiches on earth, either way I am happy with the situation.   I went here with a coworker on a whim and what uncovered was one of the best lunches I've had in a very long time. I literally cannot stop evangelizing this place... someone will be speaking and I interrupt them to say, "naked lunch needs to happen again, like now." Thank goodness I convinced my coworkers to come here tomorrow and I am already excited.   Now to the food... I had the fig situation. I really wanted to try the chicken sandwich but am trying to lose some pounds so decided to be a little good for once. The sandwich was delicious on crispy warm bread, they layered: goat cheese, arugula and fig which worked harmoniously together. Just think that I was thinking fried chicken and was more than satisfied with a fig sandwich... now that's something.  I am giving 4.5 stars since this place is cash only... and would love if they would take cards so that I could order even more.

9IF2ZMnkrZlvxCHcO0h1EQ.review_text: One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. There's a lot to be said about doing a few things and doing them well.   The summer bean sandwich was a sublime combo for a sandwich. The beans provided great flavor, crunchiness and the creamy avocados provided a great balance. The cinnamon ice tea was perfect for an Indian summer day in SF.  The rotating menu will keep me coming back, although I work nowhere near North Beach, it's a great destination spot.

vOfgzbeS8igE_nYj8Y3DQA.review_text: Fried chicken sandwich...meh. Not crispy! And it was fatty thigh meat, skimpy on the cole slaw and on a soggy bottom bun. I'll save my fried chicken sandwich craving for bake sale betty's or 3-sum eats.   The butternut squash sando on the other hand was amazing! Thinly sliced roasted sweet butternut with a layer of goat cheese, crumbled walnuts and pea spouts on a nice ciabatta (or some equally lovely bun).   Go for the daily specials and skip the chicken.

gnqnA1xybLn09w85gtm9fw.review_text: hands down the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. juicy fried whole pieces of boneless chicken fried in crispy batter. not sure what kind of sauce they put on top but it is darned good.  a bit expensive... for $10 you get a sandwich and nothing more.  Fries are an additional $4 I think.  but pay up and enjoy one cuz it is totally worth it!

Dsn0E5ad3oom8iGIrFXPsQ.review_text: HOLY MOTHER OF SANDWICHES. The first time I had a Naked Lunch fried chicken sandwich, I almost cried. The perfect combination of fresh, seasoned, crispy, moist chicken and cool coleslaw on amazing bread left me breathless.  Despite it being bikini season, I wanted another. I thought about it for a solid 10 minutes and said, "NO, DON'T DO IT." I then regretfully walked away. As I walked away, I turned my head back and saw Naked Lunch fading into the distance, like a scene from a love story.  Since that day, I've been thinking about them non-stop. I can't wait until I have another opportunity to go to back on a Tuesday. I LIVE FOR IT.

hLZhIcq9qupYTeW5FHInEA.review_text: 3.5, I really can't push it further and here's why... Anyway, after working tirelessly for months on end without a consistent schedule in sight, my first back to back days off has arrived. I earned it so I figured a stroll in the city would do me justice. Switched on the Yelp app, walked through FiDi and lost my bearings a few times thanks to Apple maps calibration issues and lacking common sense of true north. I finally stumbled into the establishment after finding out it's close to the North Beach/Chinatown triangle. I was enticed with the words 'foie-gras sandwich' only to be disappointed that majority of what was mentioned was available pre-foie gras ban (and in 2012 mind you). So, I sat at the bar and was helped by the bartender Stephanie?? (I think, she might punch me in the face if she reads this review since I forgot). She took the following order: Evan Williams and Coke w/ Mary's Farm Fried Chicken (instagram.com/p/mBP0FxHh…) Let's start with the Evan William's x Coke. I'm more of a jack and coke person and EW seems to be a bit more on the sweeter side than I'm accustomed to otherwise it served its purpose for lunchtime alcoholism. The Farm fried chicken, the bread was nicely toasted, the coleslaw lacked some flavor and the aioli made things really sloppy. Chicken was a bit rare in the interior as a chowed down through the meal. So what made the whole sandwich hold up? Crystal's hot sauce. It gave the simplistic sandwich a bit of complexity and lifted the blandness of the aioli and slaw. Customer service was excellent and it was nice to get a break from the grindstone of life by chatting it up and eating a casual lunch in the city. After $20.00 plus tax and some added tip I was ready to call it a day. They also have an indie pop-up on sundays called Chao-Mien which i have yet to try and apparently their dinner sandwiches are more amazing so until I try those elements of this location, this is my preliminary rating for now. Cheers!

-iOm-4QGjxA6bv6GNiAhwg.review_text: When they're tolerating lactose and gluten and aren't prone to Veganism, Hipsters have some great food.  And this is one of the great ones.  Fried Chicken Sandwich and fries; can't go wrong!

J5N5WIv7KIAxcZuPElt9KA.review_text: Enjoying a superb "cold cuts" sammy from this new joint as I write this. Snake Rivers "Kobe" tri-tip seared super rare, and sliced ultra thin, with some delicious orange heirloom tomato, lettuce and horseradish aioli on an ACME torpedo roll. Superb. I'll def be hitting this place often.

9sxvJvvTtw8y2YRDcaL9nw.review_text: What a treat to have this great hidden lunch spot!  It is tucked in the annex of Enrico on the corner of Broadway and Kearny.   Try not to drive too fast. Otherwise you will miss it.   It is Naked Lunch's 1 year anniversary today and selling their popular fried chicken sandwich for $4. Line was out the door!   Within 45 minutes of opening, the Foie Gras Torchon and Duck Prosciutto Sandwich with Heirloom Tomato was sold out. (sad face)  The Fulton Valley Farms Fried Chicken Sandwich with coleslaw and Garlic Aioli on a toasted Acme Pain De Mie was delicious. (happy face) I peeked in their kitchen and noticed they use local and fresh ingredients. Buns are toasted in a wood-fired oven. I ordered 3 chicken sandwiches. I was hungry after my 9 mile run. Needed major protein! (Well I shared 1 sandwich.)  I liked everything about the chicken sandwich. Chicken was tender and flavorful. The garlic aioli was the star of the sandwich and with the hot sauce, it was like soul food!   Although seating is limited inside, there is plenty of room in Enrico's sidewalk area. Great for small groups.   My only suggestion to the owners is to have fries or sweet potato fries.

-zzSnUrAIEbYy_JLTU36eQ.review_text: My coworkers and I go here all the time - there isn't a ton around, and it's great to get a good, gourmet sandwich for a reasonable price and not rjs...  The Foie Gras sandwich is a little on the heavy side, but their other sandwiches have been really good (I had the skirt steak a couple of times, and my friend had a veggie sandwich).  I would also definitely suggest getting the soup if you're hungry.  Try the cinnamon sweet tea, too, it's a slightly new twist on something i miss from the south.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I am always looking for new lunch spots and when I heard about Naked Lunch I was excited to try it our as it is relatively close to my work.  The atmosphere is very bare but that makes it have some charm.  The person taking the orders was very nice and helpful.  The sandwich that I ordered was excellent.  They change the menus all the time but I would definitely go back and try whatever else they have on there.  It took a little while to get the food delivered to our table but once we had it I had no complaints.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: I've still got a list of fried chicken sandwich places to try in the city but I'm officially calling the search off - Naked Lunch absolutely has the best chicken sandwich. Can't believe it took me this long to get to Naked Lunch especially since it's so close to work and man have I been missing out on lunch. The fried chicken sandwich is a thing of simple beauty (yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao…) - a generous piece of boneless dark meat fried to a gorgeous golden brown, slathered with a rich and creamy garlic aioli, coleslaw, and encased by a soft acme bun. The proof of greatness however is in the taste and my first bite was a sneak taste of the chicken on its own and wow it's a nice tasting piece of chicken. The second bite revealed the true brilliance of the symphony of ingredients working together effortlessly. Have no doubt that the chicken is still the star, but all the other elements work to make it shine even more. I've found my favorite fried chicken sandwich in the city and when you add a bag of 4505 chicharrones that melt in your mouth, you've found yourself a great lunch escape. Bring cash to Naked Lunch on Tuesday - it's the perfect early-in-the-workweek savory treat.

fL2GtY4DIS8Z-p6eZCpv6Q.review_text: Appreciating the concept but the execution still needs some work.  I chalk it up to growing pains, the place was slammed when I went in at noon.  The Bakesale Betty fried chicken sandwich comparison is misguided.  This sandwich has all the mayo I wish the BB sandwich had but when topped with a big wet pile of bun-soaking iceberg in lieu of BB's beautifully crisp mounds of crunchy, spicy slaw it's just not even in the same league!  I will try again in a month or so, it's nice to have a new option in the wasteland up there.  But next time?  I want some sage in my "sage lemonade!"

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Awesome fried chicken sandwich.  hit the spot.  nice and meaty and seasoned perfectly.  good garnishments.  just right amount of aoli.  nice seating outside.  quick service.  Not a great location, which is why took me a while to make it here, but worth going out of your way to.  Limeade was ok, but I could do without it and just get water to save $3 next time.

Z6cvyZxAIh-WpsQ2I32i5w.review_text: After making an off-hand remark that I would have loved a glass of white wine with my yummy braised artichoke & manchego sammich this afternoon, one of the very nice gentleman who works there told me a little secret: it's perfectly acceptable to bring wine and sit at Enrico's outdoor courtyard to enjoy your Naked Lunch. I'm sneaking a bottle in my purse next time!

002slNgnEtAvsNYFLw7rGA.review_text: my coworkers don't like the price / volume ratios and refuse to come here with me.  I don't care.  They make foie gras sandwiches.  FOIE GRAS SANDWICHES.  NL's sandwiches are generally high-end gut-bombs (steak, fried chicken, smoked herring, etc) and way too rich to eat more than once every few weeks (unless you want to get the gout).

uKqkquINCbM-j2ZgvAfYsA.review_text: Amazing sandwiches! Their menu changes often and I was lucky to have a Braised Short Rib Sandwich when I went. It was perfectly juicy with a balance of all the flavors.

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: Tucked away in the side room of Enrico's of North Beach, lies the kitchen of Nakedlunch, a pure word of mouth, Twitter, Yelp and publicity-driven lunch joint in what seems like the daytime no man's land -- Broadway.  A bit on the pricey side, but ingredients are top-notch, fresh, and most importantly, decadent. Gotta make sure that midday meal counts! Oh and it will, after noshing on a cholesterol and yumminess-laden duck prosciutto and foie gras torchon, well I suppose there's some veggies in there, sandwich. Can you say food coma (and then heart attack)? Great, but the bun is a little too subdued and boring. Though it is a $15 sandwich, I just felt I had to try it! I also loved the "grilled cheese sandy" w/ Cowgirl Creamery Mt. Tam, piquillo peppers, heirloom tomatoes, & some kind of olive tapenade, which is on a toasted foccacia bread. Yum.  It's pretty darn good, and the place is definitely unique. Check 'em out if you're in the 'hood (and not when it's after dark and you're en route to a strip club).

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Chill bar in North Beach with great food. I've had the fried chicken sandwich, the burger and the fries. Everything is executed well.   Couple pool tables, TVs showing sports and an indoor basketball game keeps patrons busy.   Currently on Sundays, they have a Mien pop up that I'm curious about.

CI9cxb-iDl1xlxFF0jEquQ.review_text: Oh Naked Lunch....you are just scrumptious!  Lunch spots like this totally make me miss working in North Beach!  There's a different menu every day and the ingredients are always just so fresh!  It's a small little hidden spot on Broadway, but they always sell out of certain items....and by certain I mean these 2 very specific sandwiches below:  Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich Tomato, Butter Lettuce, Black Truffle Salt $16  Fulton Valley Farms Fried Chicken Sandwich Green Garlic Aioli, Pain De Mie, Creamy Coleslaw $8  Yes, it's a $16 sandwich but DAMNNNNN it's the best $16 sandwich I've ever had.  The thought of the foie gras and duck prosciutto sammy brings joy to my heart, I kid you not.  It's de-freakin-LISH!  Oh and do I really even need to explain the hotness that is the fried chicken sandwich??  Just get it!  It's a must!!  Will definitely go back whenever I'm in the area during their lunch hours.....mmmm mmmm yummmm!

chfjGkhaIyLePHWUTK2TAw.review_text: Seriously, people, this is the best lunch spot in San Francisco.    If I lived nearby I think I'd be eating lunch there every day.  Ian and Ryan take extra special care to prepare their food and it shows.  They use unbelievably fresh produce in their recipes -- the quality really comes through in how the food tastes!    I've been a regular there since August.  My brother and try to go at least once a week.  He loves the Foie Gras Sandy and I am in love with all of their vegetarian selections.  It's great to sit out on the Enrico's patio and watch the world drive by while you're having lunch.    Go in and try something!  Their menus change daily so there's always something new!  :)  Tell them I said HI and be sure to chat with them - they are super-friendly guys!  You.  Will.  NOT.  Be. Disappointed!!!!

L5rgOg0CI-VoVpW49jZX-g.review_text: This place has a pretty solid fried chicken sandwich.  The bread is toasted nicely, and the chicken is fried to perfection.  The chicken meat was very moist, which is hard to do.  Most places tend to over cook chicken, leaving it dry and chewy.  I also got to try the cinnamon ice tea.  It's a must!  I took out a star because my sandwich ended up leaking like crazy, I hate messy sandwiches and this started to become one.    I still prefer Bakesale Betty's chicken sandwich in Oakland.  Their coleslaw is much better.

kTNAQo8XNyAHuVjlWNVzvg.review_text: I had the ever popular duck prosciutto/foie gras/heirloom tomato/black truffle salted sandwich on perfectly crunchy acme bread. This bread alone I could write novels about, but the credit goes solely to acme. I was a little disappointed with my choices, I would normally never order the same sandwich as the person I'm with, but since my other selections were peach/goat cheese and salmon/capers I made an exception. Boy, am I glad I made the exception because this was one tasty, fragrant sammie. The scent of black truffle wafts towards you when you unwrap the paper, there is this irresistible crunch that occurs when you bite down into the crust of the bread, then there's this gorgeous melting sensation of rich, fatty flavor from the foie gras that contrasts the chewier and saltier prosciutto, finished with a perfectly ripe tomato that adds just a little acidic sweetness.   And a glass of the fabulous sweet cinnamon iced tea. I'm totally going to start adding cinnamon to my own iced tea. I liked it specifically because it was sweet without being overly sweet like most southern sweet teas. Altho I hafta say I did swirl my drink for the first 10 minutes waiting for the ice to melt a little. But there's the beauty of iced tea, make it a little sweeter let the ice do its job.   My only complaints, showed up at 11:25p they made us wait for 15 minutes before opening and I thought the sammie was a little small for $18. But they use high quality ingredients, so it's prolly not fair for me to complain. Would have loved to try the mushroom soup, but thought $30+ was rather pricey for a lunch.

FD3y3Dg7tSgRR1Xcj09b-A.review_text: Like ohmagawd my fired chicken sandwich was great. Yep, the food was so good I had talk like a 19-year-old sorority girl. A buddy of mine recommended this place so I swung by for lunch. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and a cup of curry soup. The sandwich was superb. Great lightly battered and fried chicken cutlets, spice mayo sauce, and good thick bread to sop it all up. If they had a magic pill to unclog my arteries afterward I'd be over the moon.

HnJTVSEVjj08XdY2sOBKDQ.review_text: best quick lunch i've had in the city.  it's walking distance from my office and every time i eat here, i wonder to myself why i don't go more often.   simple blackboard menu that rotates daily with about 6-10 items -- couple/few sandwiches, salads, soups, and desserts/drinks.  gourmet with fresh ingredients...everything i've had here is DELICIOUS!  order and pick up at the counter.  there are some tables set-up outside enrico's to eat there or you can get it to go.

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich with tomato, butter lettuce, black truffle salt.    Doesn't that just sound amazing? It tasted even more amazing.    This was the most amazing sandwich I have *ever* had.  The prosciutto was amazing in flavor.  The foie gras was amazing, and there was even a generous amount of it.  The sandwich overall was rich, but not in an overpowerful way.   I had the Cinnamon Sweet Tea with this.  Also great.  Not too cinnamony, not too sweet.  So satisfying.  I had a sip of my friend's Basil Lemonade.  Ahh also 'just right'.  I normally hate lemonade, but this was actually not too overbearing in sweetness/tartness.  The restaurant itself is very small and unassuming.  (One might even call it 'divey'.)  There's only like 5 bar seats within the restaurant building itself, but there is an empty business/storefront to the side with some tables and chairs that Naked Lunch has seemed to taken over.  I got here at noon on a weekday, and the line was actually... nonexistant.  ::gasp::  I wish I could give this place more than five stars, or maybe I should go back to all my five-star reviewed places and really re-evaluate what I was thinking.

TNza8Epo8mS_TIwg3-ZAMA.review_text: Well I almost got sucker punched in the face by a homeless lady while I was looking the other way trying to find this place so that put a bad taste in my mouth. Mind you, this was on a bright, sunny Sunday at 11:45 AM, not 2AM on a Friday night, and all I was doing was walking by her. Luckily she had some sanity to stop a centimeter from my face but continued to keep yelling  threats at me and calling me a ho as I walked away. Unfortunately I had to hang out in front of the restaurant while the crazy lady was still yelling at me because the place wasn't open and didn't open until 12:10, 10 minutes later than advertised. Surprisingly none of the outside seating was set up, 10 mins before opening time, and the guy working there kind of made me feel like I was in his way no matter where I stood so my friend and I walked somewhere else to get coffee first. When we got back and were standing outside of the restaurant waiting for it to open, the same lady who just fake punched me asked me for money. At this point, I felt like I should have returned to Columbus St. where I knew this lady wouldn't follow me to.  Still I wanted to check out this place that yelpers rave about so I stuck it out. You have to order the food from the bar and I got a fig sandwich and paid extra for fries. The sandwich was good and the fries were ok. Even though only two other people were eating at the restaurant the waitress kept asking me and my friend if we were done so she could take the plates away. Calm down lady! You can take our plates when we leave!   Maybe it's better when there are actually people near the restaurant, say after 1pm, but the good sandwich wasn't worth me risking getting my face  bashed in by a crazy homeless person. I should have gone to another restaurant in North Beach where people looked like they were enjoying their Sunday morning.

e58WqXc-MbCHGCC_XfVKkg.review_text: I've been waiting a month for a free Tuesday or Wednesday to come check out Naked Lunch, and finally, I was able to.  Why Tuesday or Wednesday you ask? Because I wanted to eat that danky goodness that's known as the Fried Chicken Sandwich. Although their yelp page says they only serve it on Tuesday, after a few weeks of stalking their menu, I've noticed that on Wednesdays they also serve the Fried Chicken Sandwich.   I was planning on getting there right when they opened for I feared that they would run out of Chicken Sandwiches, but as I was driving to North Beach, I RAN OUT OF GAS. I was furious with myself; I swear, I was about to have a tantrum. After AAA came, I looked at the clock and it was already noon. My spirits were dampened, but I chanced it and drove there anyways.   Surprise! Even at around 12:15 pm, they hadn't run out of the Fried Chicken Sandwich, so fuck yeah! And there was no line. Sweet!  I split a Foie Gras Sandwich and a Fried Chicken Sandwich with a friend, and we both ordered the cocunut and blood orange juice.   The Foie Gras Sandwich was good, but I was glad I only ate half because it is pretty rich. Although I love fatty duck liver, I could not handle all the decadence that was oozing out of my sandwich. They don't skimp on it either. Every bite is filled with luxurious cream.  As for the Fried Chicken Sandwich, after I finished my half, I promptly ordered another one. It was bombay! Thick, tender thigh meat, covered in your basic salt and pepper batter, topped off with a sweet slaw, and sandwiched between a glossy bun. I mean, this sandwich doesn't have any funky twists or fusion elements, but man, it is done proper!  Also, they have a sweet heated patio that overlooks Broadway in case you'd like to people watch.  I'm definitely planning a return trip. Glad I tried the foie gras sandwich, but Naked Lunch, I'm coming for your chickens!

bvfRCpgnJGyeakYhLHKGxw.review_text: AMAZINGLY delicious sandwiches.  I almost got talked out of giving this place five stars because of the high price, but if you know your sandwich will cost $16,  you know what to expect and Naked Lunch delivers.  That sandwich is worth every penny!

ou_nE1efTxY0LoVW0Au-yQ.review_text: Came for the Foie Gras, but staying for the Fried Chicken....  After weeks of my fellow eaters (Linda L., Christine C. , and Brian P.) mentioning FOIE GRAS sandwich.. I was DYING to have it.  Maybe its the hype..or maybe its just me.. But the Foie Gras wasn't THAT great.  It was good no doubt... but perhaps it was the combo of the thick slice of foie gras and the salty duck prosciutto, that was just toooo intense in richness for me.  I think sharing half of this sucker would have been sufficient...  Linda L. kept mentioning something or another about BEST Fried Chicken...so I came back....  NOTE: I don't like chicken, I don't like fried chicken, (heck I don't even like dark meat), I don't like coleslaw, and I don't like mayo.......with that said.....  I F$%KING LOVE THEIR FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH!!!  Every bite was never enough, after I splashed on the hotsauce, I was hurrying for the next bite.  It was gross how FAST I devoured the poor little thing.. it never stood a chance...  This sando is definitely NOT for the faint at heart.. no seriously if you have a heart condition, its probably safe to say that your doctor will tell you to steer away from the BEST Fried Chicken sandwich west of Louisiana....  But thats what makes this sandwich soo GOOD, the soft toasty bread, the creaminess of the mayo, the crispiness of the chicken, with a lil texture of the coleslaw....  Money CAN buy happiness.... and it costs $8 @ Naked Lunch =)

8xzY7IePCaaaTY8iWSGOEw.review_text: Alright... for those of you that are looking for something thats off the normal trourist-track in north beach... well this is it. The sando's kill it, and i don't just mean "yumi-for-your-tummy" i mean KILL IT. The Salmon is the regular one that's always on the menu and its so tender it almost seems like some space-salmon-of-the-future sort of thing...un real brah. And the bread...ah the bread that they use for all of the sandwiches have gotta be hand picked every day or something. Top it off with being able to sit in the huge patio, on a couch (thats right..a couch) and bask in the sun. Ya can't beat it.

jAd_EbJNdSSOGu_Nzt3vhw.review_text: Came here on vacation with the wife, and we had to try the fried chicken sandwich that everyone was raving about.  We have to admit it lived up to all its hype.  It was super crunchy on the outside, and the chicken was super juicey/tender on the inside too!  Does not get any better than that.  We also got the salad of the day, which was just average at best, but definitely go there for the friend chicken sandwhich.    The workers their were always very friendly, and chill.

ebbw0Ei8wGKvyzIkdzb9bg.review_text: Nestled between strip clubs in the oh-so-classy part of North Beach, Naked Lunch is the place for a funky, flavorful sandwich you will not forget. The Foie Gras and Duck Proscuitto on Ciabatta almost made me weep. I was hungover and craving something out of this world so we headed to Naked and got our groove on.  You walk in and think, "Uh... Am I in the right place," because it's definitely raw and not restaurant-like. However, their redeeming quality is the focus on high quality and clean ingredients. I left feeling über hip having finished my Foie Gras and Duck Proscuitto sandwich in this hole-in-the-wall... and feeling not as hungover, of course. :)

Py1CYjgdkfBC23AaMpsvRA.review_text: Stopped by for the fried chicken sandwich. As advertised, just the right amount of crisp and seasoning on the outside and juicy on the inside. Will be back for it again or perhaps to try their other sandwiches which sounded interesting...

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: It was a public transportation lunch coin flip - which would come first, the N towards downtown or the 12 towards North Beach. Just as the N was rounding the corner I spotted the 12 headed towards the embarcadero and took that as a sign of fate I needed to try Naked Lunch.  A few minutes later the 12 delivered me a block from my destination and what would be an outstanding sandwich. Roasted butternut squash, lettuce and fennel on warm bread. Every bite was outstanding, and the service was friendly and accommodating. Dug the space too. I can see why there is much yelp love.  But as much as I loved my sandwich, the $9 I paid seemed a bit excessive. The small size (it was average at best) and lack of sides didn't justify the price.  Five stars for taste, two for price.

y93UOc8Vg0BtEJPb724KrQ.review_text: I LOVE their sandwiches!!!  I have never had a sandwich that I didn't like.  From the fried chicken and pork belly to the vegetarian, it's all good.  The soups are also phenomenal.  Chef Ian Begg, puts his culinary skills to use and comes up with tasty creations.  Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I make a point to get lunch there.  Don't walk, RUN!

C2XAhXAz2OSkNzJxpt3yBw.review_text: Naked Lunch makes tasty, slightly unusual sandwiches. They present a small, but varied menu that seems to always consist of a chicken sandwich, a burger, a veggie sandwich, a salad, a soup, fries, and some random sides. Sandwiches (fries not included at $5) usually cost around $10, soups $8. The atmosphere is warm and spacious, with a great, breezy outdoor area in the front. Staff are pleasant, the wait time is decently fast, and they have some nice beers on tap.  Here are some things I have tried:  Chicken coleslaw sandwich (signature item): The chicken was moist, juicy and fried to perfection. I don't like the taste of coleslaw very much, so I've only had this once, but it does go well with the chicken.    The burger: Also great -- I really dig the cheese crisp thing they put on it (manchego?)  The vegetarian sandwich: Favorite one! Seems to always be goat cheese, arugula, some caramelized vegetable, and maybe fruit. I think this is the tastiest of all the options, although I have to psych myself up before ordering something vegetarian. Would maybe be healthy if it weren't for all the cheese and greasy goodness.  Fries: Fine. Served with a garlic aoli/ketchup mix and tastes like it's seasoned with Lawry's spice and sugar. For $5 the order size is a bit small. The sandwiches themselves are all very filling, so you probably wouldn't need to order fries anyway.  They've also been known to randomly change up a menu for a day or invite in guest chefs to serve up something different, but I've never eaten there when that happens so I can't say what that's like either way.

OYaZ6agL-OMiugwqezBnCQ.review_text: Easily the best sandwich I've ever had.  Ever!  Ever, ever!  And I'm not a huge sandwich fan (mostly find them as a means to keep myself from starving at lunch)  They were out of the pork belly, which I was hoping for, but the guy suggested the lamb with pesto, mint, etc etc.  I heard "lamb" and I was hooked.  Bring it on!  I thought that I'd have to sit inside, but holy crap there's an outdoor patio.  And it was the middle of December and nice out (I live in New York so this was a revelation to me).  Anyways, the lamb was cooked perfectly.  I bit into it and was wowed.  I mean, the lamb definitely took center stage in this sandwich.  There was an amazingly fatty, rich brown sauce that I greedily licked off of the wrapping.  There was spinach and pesto and the bread was soft on the inside yet had a good amount of crunch on the outside.  I mean, I could eat this every day for a month, easy.  It was that good.  (Sure, I'd probably have a heart attack by the end of the month, but whatever).    Definitely worth checking out.  I want to go to there.

AnmClFOyOkhvzh2_T2EfJQ.review_text: Best sandwich I've ever had and try the salad please. Pig fig sandwich was awesome.

d713UyvUdDubAajWZGrj8Q.review_text: it's perfect. i love the "squatter restaurant" feel (you order in the Enrico's side door and eat on the patio of their closed restaurant)...   the food is first-rate. in addition to their signature foie gras and duck prosciutto sandwich (which is AMAZING btw), they do tasty fish sandwiches as well -- i've had the cod and the salmon and both rocked.   the chef isn't afraid to skip the sweet/citrus note that usually accompanies vinegar and oil-based sauces/dressings. it's actually a refreshing change.   (the star anise lemonade is really good too!)

i1_rmYDvXxR5-TDvpQ49Ww.review_text: Lord, Naked Lunch is good. It's pretty pricey for a single girl in the financial district and the portions can be small, but this is some of the best food in the Bay Area - they've never let me down. I just inhaled their buttery roasted tomato soup and the tangy spring salad. You boys really make lunch worth working for.

7d6LQAxkLO8Y5EfviOgs3g.review_text: Used to love Bakesale Betty's fried chicken sandwich, until I met Naked Lunch's. Of course, still enjoy both, but the chicken sandwich here is such a savory kinda good. Also, huge plus that its a good place to have drinks too.

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: Neat bar and eatery with a very chill environment.   Ordered the chicken sandwich burger and it was bomb. Friends ordered the cheeseburger which was also good but super drippy. Ended up staining a lot of pants that night.  The best part was the $10 bucket of PBR (includes 6 bottles). HAHA! I came with cheap student-folk, and they nearly shit their pants. They proceeded to order 5 more buckets...

irlefzOmbcjqJLVQihA_vQ.review_text: FINALLY tried Naked Lunch and I LOVE it! Actually I was going to rate 4.5 because I felt like the foie gras & duck prosciutto sandwich (which is heavenly good, btw) would be the most perfect sandwich ever if they only seared the foie gras. But I'm not complaining and would happily come here everyday for the rest of my life if I could because I've never had a sandwich like it! The cipollini & manchego sandwich (vegetarian) was also superb!! Can't wait to come here again (and again and again)!

IIurtwGhcPMxHd3VSKmeJw.review_text: The peach sandwich thing I tried here was insane.  Great service and food.

tT8eNf7cdSX_Zx3noSJPdQ.review_text: Honestly, I was flat out blown away by the asparagus sandwich. The best tasting, flavorful, textured sandwich I've ever had. I was somewhat intrigued by the chilled cucumber soup, and the chili oil, avocado and radish made it a really unique dish. Went REALLY well with the sandwich. The environment welcomes people who want to chill out and play pool with beer, or more active with the hoops. It also has the cozy lighting and seating that welcomes writers/laptop/homework people (but no wifi) - this is now one my new fav spots in the city

qQr0p5_eHnimsWGYBVnaJA.review_text: best sandwiches in San Francisco, hands down, if not some of the best I've had ever. Always seasonal, fresh, creative ingredients. I was really great about bringing my lunch to work everyday until I started working closer to Naked Lunch.

k4iRxs9W-ULLQQr5OTUtSw.review_text: I'm always on the lookout for good places to eat lunch alone when I'm working remotely here, and this is definitely one. It's a casual, intimate lunch counter atmosphere with delicious, unique sandwiches and drinks. I started with a refreshing Juniper and Watermelon drink and then ordered the Poached Caribbean White Shrimp Sandwich with Avocado, Heirloom Tomato, Black Olive and Basil. The price at first seemed high for a sandwich place ($10-15), but for the quality of ingredients, it's actually quite reasonable. The people who work there were also super friendly and make you want to stay and enjoy your lunch while you watch people stroll by.

kliaIrCOEk9RZo7kI25xXg.review_text: AMAZING. Seriously awesome sandwiches. 4 stars because its not a place to sit down and enjoy. No seating.

JFlkL4IOV2QsgbTah-hAAA.review_text: Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich, Smoked Pork Loin and Chorizo Sandwich, and 4505 Chicharrones  Read that first sandwich name again. Take a second to reflect.  Add to it that it is served with a slice of heirloom tomato which reminded me all over of what an actual tomato tastes like, butter lettuce, and black truffle salt, an ingredient that I have come to appreciate the power of in my home kitchen. I loved this sandwich so much that had I not been scheduled to take care of the little girl, I might have run back up to see if I could score another one. And I nearly strapped her into the baby Bjorn and did so anyway. It defines the word unctuous, with just enough herb from the lettuce and acid from the tomato to balance things out. And as over the top as foie gras on a sandwich sounds, duck prosciutto is even more so, in a good way.  I'd read a few reviews talking about the sandwich being very rich, so we decided to venture a try on chef Ryan Maxey's latest brain child, a smoked pork loin and chorizo sandwich. It seems odd to call a pork and sausage sandwich light, but it certainly felt light next to the foie gras. Very thinly sliced pork loin with the perfect amount of smoke, just a touch of chorizo, and a creamy sauce. If I'd gone back for another foie gras, I might have needed to grab one of these to throw in the fridge and eat later on.  I'd also read nice things about 4505 Chicharrones, so I grabbed a bag.  Quick side note: after some hard-won weight loss over the past few years, I am a diet-controlled diabetic. When I was first diagnosed, I turned to pork rinds as a low carb snack for my Friday night game nights. Although they provided me with something to cram in my gob to help me avoid eating the other snack delights that generally grace the gaming table, even the hot variety that I could find locally available had the personality, texture, and flavor of packing peanuts. This goes by way of saying that my expectations for what a chicharron could be were fairly low - I figured I'd done my time in that particular circle of gastrointestinal hell and they just weren't my thing.  Here's to my sweet pork skin. I was so very wrong.  These little crunchy treats are light and airy. They coat the inside of your entire mouth from the first bite with a pleasant film of porky goodness. The seasoning on them is at once spicy, sweet, and happiness inducing. Had I gone back up with Ainsley to grab another couple of sandwiches, several bags of these would have been acquired, too. Fortunately, although I didn't make it back up to North Beach for food, we did run across the 4505 booth at the Ferry Building just as they were closing down on Saturday and snagged another couple of bags, including a big one that I shared with my gaming group this past Friday. I was crushed to find out that FDA regulations prevent them from shipping out of state, but plans are in the works to have locals acquire a life-giving box of them to be smuggled across state lines.  Like Dynamo, Bi-Rite, and Out the Door, Naked Lunch has entered my list of places that I'll need to hit at least once during a trip to San Francisco in order for the trip to be complete.
