There is some crazy alchemy going on there and I wish I could make myself a regular customer. Hear that, universe? Move the Naked Lunch madmen to Utah, please.

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: I hate sandwiches.  No seriously. I HATE sandwiches. To get me to eat a sandwich it better be the Johnny Depp of sandwiches.  If Johnny Depp was a sandwich he would be the foie gras sandwich from Naked Lunch and I would eat him. Every. Day. Foie gras, duck prosciutto, Acme bread. It's like foreplay for my tastebuds just saying the words. Eating them in the sandwich is like...well...EATING JOHNNY DEPP!!! And Johnny Depp tastes gooooooood. So, so gooooood.

NM8xzqVmP3GcLuc2_INvXQ.review_text: Ah Naked Lunch.    Why must you be so far away from FiDi?  (Come to think of it, it is actually good thing, don't have to deal with a longer line.)  I get my haircut two blocks away and once I am done,  I will most likely stop by here and grab one of the awesome sandwiches that they have here.    I totally in love with their Tombo Tuna Sandwich. Nicely seared tuna with arugula, aoili and the nice egg on top.  If I can make it out to Tuesday, I would get their Fried Chicken sandwich.  I think I made it to about half of their sandwiches that they have on rotation but all the ones I have to date are fabulous and AMAZING.  This is the only place where I can order a sandwich paid 10 bucks and feel good about it.  Another not to miss is their awesome drinks that they make fresh daily....I am still thinking about their Plum & Mint drink that they made a few weeks ago....so good!!!  The guys that run this are super friendly every time I go there.  Always with a smile.

NnHrukmjYkouob_YwJTh9A.review_text: Top notch food. Lots of interesting selections. Do the staff and yourself a favor and know exactly what it is you're ordering before you order it. These guys are super friendly and will be more than happy to fill you in.

BaCt_HPKZhnErG2d_AwVDQ.review_text: I went right at 11:30AM on a Tuesday and I'm glad I did since it got pretty crowded pretty fast. I had the foie gras sandwich + tea + some blood orange drink. It was so amazingly delicious. And the counter guy was SO nice! It was affordable too. Will go back whenever I can. Great job!  Cash only.

fLZvdubdwK1VK6wjAl20HQ.review_text: Can't say enough about this place.  I go pretty often - probably been there dozens of times and I've tried a lot of different things.  And I can honestly say that I've never been disappointed.  For everyone who focuses on the foie gras, yes it is good.  But there is SO much more to this place.  Their daily selections are always terrific - as good, if not better than the foie gras.  I won't go too much into menu specifics, since it changes every day.  But trust me, it's worth the trek into North Beach.

8xDD2sm0yhlWy1BSARag2Q.review_text: Hand's down my favorite place for sandwiches.  They don't offer the foie gras sandwich anymore since there is a ban, but now they offer their chicken sandwich everyday.  Other sandwiches rotate on the menu, so check their website out.

BwFEjsr9yLqdszAmAxFYQg.review_text: Naked Lunch is an obscure little place that would, at first glance, strike you as just another of the many hole in the walls that make SF so much fun to explore. One meal was enough to change my mind.. and (I hope) the next few stops I make will confirm it, as they edit their limited menu every day to serve scrumptious combinations of things one would never think they would find in a sandwich.  It was 1:38pm on a Saturday when I walked in hesitantly. And before I even had the time to examine the small cozy space, I'm instantly greeted with a warm welcome from some laid back friendly guys who ask me what I'd like to have & whether or not I'll be eating there. Of course, I checked their ever-changing menu before heading there, so I knew what I wanted. I say "The foie gras - take-out." The guy grins and says something in approval. They seem relaxed but efficient & quick to act. They asked me how long it'd be until I get to my next destination to eat, offered to pack my ice cream in ice if I needed it, and reminded another customer that there was a perishable item in their order. The folks at Naked Lunch and I were off to a good start.  As I rummage through the cluttered contents of my purse, I realize I don't have cash. They smile and let me know that there's an ATM right by the door and a Wells Fargo on Columbus, if I'd like to just place my order and come back afterwards to pick it up. Of course, being rather lazy on a Saturday afternoon, I opt for the closest thing.  The wait is a pleasant one.. the interior, though modest, allows for a peaceful time with a book and an iPod over lunch. Everyone seems so relaxed, the environment on a Saturday is conducive to destressing.   The "ARTISAN FOIE GRAS TORCHON & DUCK PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH," ($15) was indeed a mouthful..... I should preface this section of the review with a statement: I enjoy foie gras. My husband, my flatmate, and many of my friends don't - so I would never recommend it to them. Those of you who like foie gras, on the other hand, will LOVE this sandwich. Although the taste of the smooth, creamy, delectable foie gras was easily the dominant flavor in the sandwich, the duck prosciutto was DELICIOUS, not too dry and perfectly cured. The butter lettuce and tomato provided a balance between the whelming flavor of the foie gras and the less obvious (though still discernible) duck prosciutto. Foie gras is by nature, very rich and filling, so expect to feel stuffed after the sandwich.  I finished off with the "THAI ICED TEA ICE CREAM," ($3) which my husband and I shared. I love Thai Iced Tea, so I can be rather harsh when I try things like Thai Tea donuts, pastries, cake, and various other innovative desserts. Their ice cream was not too sweet and a pleasure to eat. Well done, Flash Freeze.  I can't wait to go back and try the various daily specials as the powers behind Naked Lunch continue to play with their menu.

QuLh9_7mM1o7n2HRYkvXvg.review_text: excellent chicken sandwich! get that! i'm just bummed that they don't offer any sides, such as fries, onion rings, etc.

D7tDHwe2zHVrRBK55b_0Nw.review_text: Still amazing!  Tuesday's fried chicken sandwich was delicious.  At first I thought it was a little bland, and then I put on their hot sauce... nom nom nom!

-lZy2olORacHqx-LQuGR7w.review_text: Incredible, my fav lunch spot in the whole of SF

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: OMG - these sandwiches are amazing, and I am shocked it is so under the radar. Under the radar since I can go grab a sandwich and not have to wait 30+ minutes (like for Curry Up Now or Sentinel in the area).   I have had:  Cookie - YUM, super soft, tasty and full of chocolate. There were raisins in it, which I liked but beware if you're not a raisin fan.  Cinnamon sweet tea - I generally don't like sweet tea, but this was definitely an exception. It was sweet, but the cinnamon was spicy towards the end which was nice.  Artisan Foie Gras Torchon & Duck Prosciutto - three letters only, OMG. Initially i thought the foie gras and duck together might be too much, but it worked out so well. I fuckin loved it.  Lamb cheesesteak with arugula - I can't decide if I liked this sandwich, or the foie gras one more. It was delicious, and the peppery arugula complimented everything.  I cannot wait to go back and get to try ALL the different options. Cash only. Food can be taken to go, or you can sit next door at their sister restaurant. patio (which is covered). Cash only.

y3IH1jtMxGkSvZYnCnh5Yg.review_text: The Fois Gras Duck Prosciutto sandwich is a must!!  Since it's really popular, call when this place opens, order it, and have them hold it for you. They sold out of it yesterday and today.   Cash only.   Very little seating inside and one 2 chair table outside. I recommend taking food out to go.   Parking is metered on the street.

aKndC_HHcLSYuC0Z6EtkXA.review_text: This food is to die for. So delicious. Had the mushroom soup and it tasted so fresh I wonder if they are growing their own in a corner of the restaurant. Can't wait for their expansion into the old Enricos next month.

1dW1kLdcKuQprnhi4pC_iQ.review_text: Best Cauliflower Soup w/ curried apples & chives !!EVER!!!

RIZe3gi79Ko28xgG3dyzNQ.review_text: Despite the walk, this place has me hooked.  After seeing @nakedlunchsf tweets on a special sandwich, my friend Samson M and I completed a mission last month: Soft Shell Crab Sandwich with avocado, arugula, cucumber, and daikon $12 (yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao…) I didn't order a drink this time to make room for a refreshing dessert: Watermelon Basil Sorbet by Flash Freeze $3 (yelp.com/biz_photos/K9ao…) Yes, lunch was pricey, but it's a whole fried soft shell crab that fit perfectly into a sandwich!  Only hands and napkin required; no utensils needed.  I should have let the sorbet thaw a bit before scraping shavings into my mouth, but I couldn't wait.  It was a hot day. Staying on schedule, my next visit will be in August...if I can control my gourmet sandwich craving. Samson M's review: yelp.com/biz/naked-lunch…

qZmAcUcbp4Q9l7NO4IcGSw.review_text: Awesome lunch spot, especially if you want to watch World Cup 2014!  They have a full bar, plus delicious eats as well, and a bottle of Crystal Hot Sauce on each table.  I always get the fried chicken sandwich with the garlic aioli on the side, and a cinnamon sweet tea to wash it all down.  The fried chicken sandwich is well seasoned and delicious, and served with a buttermilk slaw on a fresh pain de mie bun.  The fries are a nice side to share with friends, and comes with a side of ketchup/garlic aioli.  The pimenton really gives these fries an extra kick.

hizGc5W1tBHPghM5YKCAtg.review_text: While walking around SF, basking in the sunshine's rare appearance, I stopped in to Naked Lunch after seeing happy folks noshing on the patio. The menu was a chalkboard up on the wall and the peach sandwich was practically screaming at me to order it, so I did, along with an IPA, because what's a lovely patio sesh without a cold beer in hand?!?  I sat down and read the paper while enjoying my IPA and when the sandwich arrived, it was the perfect complement to the experience. While not as fruity as I imagined, the white peaches blended nicely with the ricotta, manchego, basil, toasted almonds, honey, and arugula for a light bite.  Some people watching, an ice cold brew, farm-fresh sandwich, and sun. What more could an LA girl want from an SF afternoon?

E7VoZjS0m6gvVBWjfzFWNg.review_text: This place is totally creative and if you love food, you must go!!!  Its kind of funny, I go to eat foie gras and duck prosciutto... their speacialty and there is a SF protest outside...protesting foie gras !  It was a sad one person protest, so i gues people really like foie gras!  I gave the newspaper report a pic of my sandwich and was on her way.  As for the sandwich and the homemade crispy headcheese and egg dish, was rich and to die for... Im not a foodie, but it was worth checking out.  I want to go back for the fried chicken sandwhich.  BTW the menu changes daily...

t9VOBwR_1X_TWBhwxZqIdA.review_text: Imagine you could eat a meal worthy of Chez Panisse in a setting straight out of Damon Runyon.  Run, do not walk, to Naked Lunch. Tell your friends about the exquisite fried chicken sandwich or the tasty Mahi Mahi burger. Gulp down gallons of Southern sweet tea.  People watch in the finest outdoor patio in all of San Francisco. It don't get no better than this!

S4MB2dpIaBJwDAw2pxkqKA.review_text: I had a birthday gathering for a friend here last night, and my expectations were officially exceeded. It was my first time at Naked Lunch and I'll absolutely be back.  It's a great, cheap change of scenery with an awesome selection of drinks from craft beers to crazy cocktails (tequila and chili pepper?). My favorite Sierra Nevada brew called "Old Chico" was $5 for a bottle. Pop-a-Shot, billiards and plenty of tables.  The service is fantastic--thanks guys--and this was just a great experience and a great venue to drink some Fall Down Juice at. Just try not to spill into the strip clubs after last call because they're front and center when you walk out the door. Save your money[dignity] and grab a slice of Nizzarios instead.

NSIsTiFU9mVmmwxQk2JBYA.review_text: I was here at night, so didn't have a chance to try the food.  But the casual atmosphere, great location and awesome wait staff made for the perfect evening.  Can't wait to go back!

Ldgpm1iNH0KlxQshmL1hFg.review_text: I wasn't expecting much when a friend asked me to split a sandwich with her when I looked at the description: Broccoli Rabe Sandwich, Manchego, Bellwether Farms Ricotta, Onion, Almonds, Salsa Verde, Lemon Zest, Green Garlic Aioli, Arugula, and Boquerones but I am so glad she offered me half!  Such a great flavor combination - one I have definitely never had before.  Maybe one of the best sandwiches I have ever had (mind you, I ordered their signature fried chicken sandwich and it was blown out of the water).  Kudos to you Naked Lunch.

zhbuv98kaozSOU4N_gPMXg.review_text: The fried chicken sandwich was greasy and not crispy. The fries were soggy. The burger was a complete mess. Everything tasted okay, but did not live up to the "best fried chicken sandwich in San Francisco hype."

rO2YKN1PqAJjd6YgP0PM0A.review_text: 3.5 stars if I could. I want to like this place with their healthy sounding farm-to-table menu but if you get down to it, they have a lot of fattening foods that taste good at first but then you get kinda sick of them (but hey, you are in a bar).   The place also has a a weird table layout with the pool tables taking up most of the space. You end up standing near the bar (because the heaters outside do not work)

zpT7HWE3o77YVfG4S07H9A.review_text: All I can say is: wow.    I am impressed with their fried chicken sandwich. It was worth the $8. It was worth every penny! I wish I had gotten two, I wish I can come every Tuesday. It had me at first bite. This sandwich is so finger-licking good. I giggled and found myself in bliss. Amazing. I'm speechless. It was so good! The soft acme bun, the juicy and tender lightly fried chicken breast, the creamy garlid aioli sauce and the cole slaw made this little sandwich ol' so perfect. This just might be the last meal I want on earth.   Another highlight about Naked Lunch is their $16 Artisan Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto sandwich. It's definitely good, I love foie gras and I love proscuitto but I just couldn't get past the "duck". Personally, I don't eat duck but I did give it a try. It was interesting. Yes, I am being bias. I couldn't give it more than a couple bites. What a shame, I know. If you love foie gras and duck proscuitto, then this is the sammy for you.   Cash only.

6rP5cX_UBf5NZHsQBgAgpg.review_text: I love this place. Not only do they serve the best chicken sandwich, but they are now a bar with a great atmosphere and set up. I've told everyone i know about this place, and everyone who has gone there agrees - it's awesome. They play good music, have a couple of pool tables, good beer selection, and the staff is very cool. Definitely check it out.

gEx19xm2RZQo4XdobKGkWQ.review_text: how can one not like the combo of foie gras torchon, duck prosciutto and fresh heirloom tomatoes?  this is one hell of a sandwich with every component adding its own layer.  the foie was this beautiful spread and the richness was what i looking for.  one component that is very underlooked but brought the sandwich together was the bread.  just perfect.  pricey (hence the docking of one star) though but great lunch eats near work.

dkxag3u0JSl0bFfLti7nRw.review_text: Had the cod sandwich a couple days ago and while it did the trick for lunch that day, I don't think I'll need to have it again. Tried their foie gras sandwich today--- because I love foie gras in any form--- and was super dissapointed. It was inedibly salty. The bread was great however do after scraping half of it off I managed to get through it. The staff is extremely friendly and for that reason I will probably be back for the fried chicken sandwich soon and hope to raise this up to 3 stars!!

JGC4y5LZOmcw-PU4KFrt4g.review_text: This place rocks! Great lunch destination! Get the freshly brewed cinnamon tea! The vegetarian grilled asparagus sandwich rocked my world. The bar tender was extremely nice and told me the recipe for the tea.

QZ3lwjncTpTMekLH5_K3TA.review_text: I love this place-- yum, yum, yum.

pSms5uzIwl_eM6Gi7vVFYQ.review_text: My lovely coworkers introduced me to NL today. I had a braised artichoke & chevre sandwich with sweet onion, spinach, thyme and preserved meyer lemon zest. For $9 I was expecting more. Honestly there wasn't much cheese (protein) in the sandwich so I was hungry less than two hours later.  Also, given the amount of olive oil applied to the bread, I think it should have made the cut for the ingredients list.   I am giving NL 3 stars because I enjoyed my blood orange & fennel sorbet immensely and well, I like the creative concept behind the place and want to see them do well and prosper. I will drop by again and hopefully they can lighten up the sandwich mix. Please?

Dq72CBbpBaVClal9fzfqIQ.review_text: 10/19/10...  * Fried Chicken Sammie - available Tuesdays only! To die for!  So simple and so tasty.  Add a splash or two or ten of hot sauce. Good chicken, good bun, good slaw, good aioli...  GOOD GOD!  * Salmon Sammie w/ Fried Egg Yummy but messy!  Their housemade drinks leave much to be desired but the sammies more than make up for that.  So grab a sammie and some water and a bunch of napkins and you've got all you need for a satisfying lunch.  If anyone ever asks you if you want "Naked Lunch" the answer is "YES PLEASE!"

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pics)  Such a lovely name matches this neighbourhood with The Hustler and other similar establishments just around the corner!  No sign on the wall outside but you know it when you see a line forming outside.  Went there too late to get the foie gras but was able to get the roasted pork loin sandwich with bacon, aioli and arugula. It was amazingly fresh taste and the crunchy bread was just a perfect companion. Arugula is always an excellent choice for sandwiches.  Also got the fresh (sweetened) blood orange blaster, so yummy and perfect for this really warm, almost burning hot sunny corner!  Well, why stop there while you can get their ice-cream for dessert as well. Today they have Salty Dulce de Leche, BB espresso, and blackberry sage sorbet. I got the Leche and it was just incredible and is fairly sweet!  An absolute 5 star place full of great food and super friendly service that brings you lots of sunshine smiles. That oven with logs of wood totally mesmerized me.  They also carry bags of 4505 Chicharrones but I am too full to try it today.

3Q8xmjnmIIjjD_9-ohwOPA.review_text: Foie Gras Duck Prosciutto Sandwich $22 Worth trying.  Cinnamon sweet tea on the side, yum.  It's not too sweet, but I sorta diluted it with water cause it was too flavorful by itself (didn't get sandwich yet) whatever, still good.  Foie is fresh and melts in your mouth. Duck proscuitto gives the sandwich a delicious saltiness.  Come early. I thought it opened at 11, and got here at 11:10, but it opens at 11:30.  Came here on a Tuesday lunch day, and there was a line. They only have about 15 foie sandwiches available, so if you're not the first 15... you gotta get something else! SORRY!  Boo California S.B. 1520

ClFG-FZU56rXFekF_PWRiA.review_text: Very good!  Customer service was friendly and efficient, food came out in a reasonable amount of time, place is clean (including bathrooms), and most of all, the fried chicken sandwich was excellent.

718BqSoKm6D2qUY1D96_3A.review_text: I'm a fan. Atop the financial district where $12 salads are the norm and the DIY buffet never weighs in under $10.50 no matter what, a hefty sandwich for $8 or $9 is really reasonable. The pork belly sandwich was cooked perfectly and man, pork and leek marry together in a way my old boyfriend and I never did. My co-workers looked on in envy as I housed both halves. (Dang, I missed Ahi Tuna today?!) Pretty good bang for your buck, but more importantly, it tastes rad. Run yourselves on over there, everyone needs lunch. Naked.

aRWgizJ671rpnkabFCr_Bg.review_text: Food is meh. Over rated. Very rude bar tender / manager. I politely asked if he would turn on the volume on tv and got in return an extremely rude response

npTgcWBFx1bXcHrNoZhoLQ.review_text: Their Fried Chicken Sandwich is probably the best I've tasted in a while! The place could use more seating as I could see it getting busy soon.   There are a couple of pool tables as well as a basketball arcade.

NFo1WMzgrt_1Jv_DrdQzAw.review_text: Naked Lunch. I remember when my co-worker suggested it as the place to go for lunch- myself and my co-workers decided to have lunch with her since it was her last day :(. Anyways, this was like 3 blocks from our workplace. I must say, when I first entered, I was appalled by the prices- but I kid you not, the food is delicious and of high quality. Pretty much, you get what you paid for.   The store itself has an interesting presentation- unique, unorthodox, and small. They have seating area, right next door in front of Enrico- I think Enrico owns this place. We sat outdoor and not only enjoyed the food, but the view and day. It was awesome. There was about 6 of us and we were able to eat comfortably. I ordered the sandwich with the kobe cold cuts. The portions was pretty small for a sandwich, but you're paying a premium for the quality and uniqueness of it. Did I mention that it is Out of this world GOOD!. Although pricey, it is definitely worth it.     The service was dope. The guy who accomodated us was friendly, hip, and energetic. Overall, this place is worth many visits!

VfkA4OlerlF2LRq_m3ql5Q.review_text: quality lunch, handcrafted with care. finally.  about time naked lunch came around the far borders of fidi. I was exhausting all my lunch spots around my work place. subway blah. specialties, again!? mixt green... too long of a wait. the lunch gods finally answered my prayers. all except that this place is cash only :(  All the sandwiches are uniquely tasty and true to only naked lunch. The menu changes daily and it's great everyday except for mondays, because they're not open.  One thing that doesn't change is their iced tea. It's spicy (cinnamon), it's a bit sweet, it quenches thirst. It's the perfect drink to wash away the first  half of your dull or stressful or -___- work day.  if you work within the area definitely make a trip here for lunch, it's work every step and penny!!

Reu6Gi1N5H6UqV4CeNUqRQ.review_text: The food was good. Let's start here. Went with two others from the Financial District for lunch. Ordered salads and sandwiches. We heard about a sandwich from some girls who had already ordered. Sounded soooo good. When we got to the front of the line and ordered two...we could only get one as they were selling out with more than an hour to go for their lunch time.  We got our food and sat under the arcade of Enrico's (another great place in SF). The food was fabulous. Have been back there two other times. All good experiences. They ran out of one of their salads the last time. Still good with what I got. Mmm...better than Ike's.

4cVS1n-CR6GNRKxtzC2Vpg.review_text: Wow!!! The place does the most amazingly delicious sandwiches I have ever tasted! I hate to say sandwiches because it really doesn't do any justice to the delectable pieces of art these guys are creating and at such reasonable prices.   Some may think that an average of $10 a sandwich is a bit pricey but for what you are getting this is a steal! There are no slices of processed, pre-packaged meats here and the sandwich is more like a gourmet meal in bread.  My ultimate fave is the Grilled Skirt Steak and what prompted me to finally get my ass on here and write a review today was the Grilled Cheese Onion - oh my...!

HHxkcUhkbDc7Gaw8PK70lA.review_text: I came in on tues. For the fried  chicken sandwich, nice and moist great sandwich..but the place is small, I'm going to come back and try different items there menu changes daily

QxicE6c4zNxYYJh_aeywlA.review_text: Da-yum.  Fried Chicken Sandwich..... Ginger Iced Tea...... Cookie.....  Freakin' orgasmic.

tTQ0XMlEGBLfBysMTsHfXw.review_text: Get the fried chicken sandwich.  You won't regret it.

q6ImOFjIpQXK0Kt-JL6x8A.review_text: I just don't have enough nice things to say about this place and the people that work there-truly splendid.  I mean, they are the reason I signed up to write review in the first place!! I ate there once and cannot stay away. The food is amazing, unique and very reasonably priced and it switches up often. The best part, however, was the life-changing corn chowder that was a defining culinary moment for me- off the charts! Their rotating freshly made lemonades and teas are wonderful, their sandwiches are ridic, both vegetarian and meat options. Can't say enough, need to shout from the roof tops like a madwoman!!!

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: So I had to try that $15 decadence called the foie gras sandwich. I feel like I should like it because of what it cost... but it was just okay. And my cholesterol level probably spiked quite a bit...

07191dQwiRtPAmBvPYdwew.review_text: Disappointed...   Great concept - you take a chicken, fry it, and put it on a bun w/fixins... sounds good, right?  Problem is, they use nasty chicken... not the juicy, tender, white meat you would want. They served greazy, darkish, rubber chicken. Ugh!  Maybe it was bum luck and I got handed a bum chicken... Whatever. They ain't taking my money again. Fugedaboudit.

nwVWyxI1AbiVwspEgfB92g.review_text: it was a good sandwich service was not that hospitable and i was still hungry after the sandwich? I cant give it a great rating

Qq_fV6NFDnu7sKuScVS5Gg.review_text: The fried chicken sandwich here is the must-order item. It's incredible. It's huge, juicy and perfectly seasoned and fried.  The set up is a bit odd. You basically walk in and order at the bar, get a number and then find a table. They'll bring the food to you.   Although the other food is good, the fried chicken sandwich really is the "go to" item. This place also gets very busy during lunch and people aren't necessarily nice about not vulture-ing over tables.   But the fried chicken is worth it.

jjuxiwKoiz8voegbWEJVMg.review_text: I will bet you that you'll enjoy your meal at Naked Lunch or I will eat my lunch naked.  Seriously, though, this place is an absolute GEM sandwiched between the seedy gentleman's clubs on Broadway Street.  From today's menu (as it changes daily) I ordered the crispy soft-shell crab sandwich with aioli, pickled radish, basil and arugula ($11) and the mushroom/chevre/chive soup ($6) [yes, I was feeling rather indulgent, and obviously, this is an occasional stop or else I'd have to take on shifts at the strip club next door just to pay for a decent lunch].  Both were AMAZING!  The soft-shell crab was crunchy and tasty, albeit a tad oily.  The soup was even more oily but had a delicious lemon-chevre (goat cheese) floating in there to enhance the flavor.  Deliciousness was had all around.  Tips: Sit outside on the patio outside Enrico's where there's ample seating area, and bring cash as that's all they accept.

58AH_EMcw8QS-UD12JyMmg.review_text: Love the outdoor seating with two high back velvet seats.  Pool Tables inside and lots of seating area.

q91eY-Twd5i-idnAIAK5oA.review_text: Was in the area with a friend and came in here pretty randomly. The decor and layout is super interesting in here. There are pool tables and a really pretty bar area. It's also super spacious and there's a great out door space as well.  Service was good too. It's a little difficult to find where to order but just go up to anyone at the bar. They were really prompt with service once we were seated too and the food came out pretty fast.   My friend and I ordered the grilled asparagus sandwich and fried chicken sandwich. We also got fries. The fries were super fresh and well seasoned and they gave us (what I think was) homemade ketchup. The asparagus sandwich, oh my goodness. So I knew the fried chicken sandwich was going to be good--you can't go wrong with fried chicken. But wow that grilled asparagus was so on point. It was super filling despite being a vegetarian sandwich. The coleslaw in the fried chicken sandwich was awesome as well. Food here is great.  Definitely coming back to try other things on the menu. Their creamy tomato soup looked really delicious too.

XCddLVoK-huzJnkZnHnNEw.review_text: Been here twice now and I am obsessed!  Love love love the duck proscuitto and foie gras sandwich. Obviously its a little on the rich side but its soooo delicious- I've literally never had anything like it before. The butter lettuce and tomato compliments the richness of the foie gras perfectly making it feel like a "sandwich".   Have also had the fried chicken sandwich which was delicious (as expected). Foie gras is my favorite though. I plan on going back to try the honey and brie sandwich and other goodies.  Delicious, fresh yummy SF food. Only in this city could you find such culinary excellence in a sandwich.

KDewJBJknfWvQyHHFNbfdg.review_text: They have a pop a shot basketball game. Regulation size rim + ball, one shooter at a time. When you walk in it looks like an ornament. When you walk in your first question might be: where the hell is everyone? And the second question is: I thought this was a lunch place?   With giant booths, giant open space, two pool tables with plenty of elbow room, and plenty of room of room to actually play the pop a shot, I don't see why this wouldn't be a staple saloon to take shots in many ways in North Beach. With bar invasions by Marina bros up Green + Grant, this is an antidote to that scene and a nice pairing with a quieter higher end cocktail around the corner at 15 Romolo.   These guys just want to sling good drinks, cheap drinks and be kind. It's certainly a bar where I could *burrough* into and relax for a long while.

_AMGp5KhZ-K8hZkDqpBCOQ.review_text: by the time we got here friday night, the kitchen was closed, but we were able to order drinks and they were delicious :) bartender made me amazing mojito even tho it was off menu :) we played several games of pool ($1 per game, can get change at the bar) and basketball shots ($1 for 4 games?) love the spacious , woody atmosphere. will have to come back to try the food!

WfhOBWLJKn7flyUbh3dH8Q.review_text: 3.5 stars for Naked Lunch.  Real simple and short menu for the day and the area's okay. A bit of an LOL as we parked near The Lusty Lady. Thank goodness my 6 year old nephew was oblivious.  It has a relaxed atmosphere. The staff is polite. I went here yesterday with my husband and visiting sil and nephew. I had the grilled salad. Really interesting how even the lettuce was grilled. That gave the baby romaine some nice flavor and texture. I also liked how the brie chunk was grilled and how its rind was crispy. I got to try some of the fried chicken of my husband's sammie. OMGosh it was so moist in its fried skin. Amazing!

nJ6_4VXENum3Uuuf-jifjg.review_text: I absolutely love this place! Ryan and the staff are the sweetest people! I can't believe I haven't written about them before.  I sleep and dream about their sammies! On my last trip up, I fell in love with their Fried Chicken Sandwich, which they are using to celebrate their 1 year anniversary on 9/4 and selling them at HALF price for $4.  I am sooo jealous of people who live here and enjoy this awesome deal!  This is how much I love them... I just attended the SF Chefs 2010 and all I can think about is getting NAKED... Naked Lunch that is =D Then I got deathly ill, which I still am.. but is that going to stop me?  HECK NO! What kind of foodie/writer/photographer would I be if it did.  I took the Muni by myself just to get my chicken on!   Was I about to pass out from my fever? probably... Was it worth it? Well... I happily devoured my sandwiches... and saved none for my sister! MWAHAHAH Hey I earned them because I ventured out O=D  Be sure to call ahead so that they don't run out before you get there... Sucker! I took the last 3 chicken sammies this Tuesday O=P they only had 1 left after I arrived.  I silently thought to myself... haha that's right! the early bird gets the worm and these sammies will be that much tastier since they were the last!! O=)  I love how tender and flavorful the chicken is.  Along with the light yet accentuating dressing enveloping the fried chicken.  I love the bread they use too.  Everything is just so great that I wish it was Tuesday again or that I was around 9/4/10 for the fun! I'd order 8 of them with that great deal!  Ryan was so sweet when I told him how much I loved them and especially took a bus ride out to get their sammies.  He gave me the Strawberry & Mint Cream drink for free.  So sweet! I am so tipping them this Friday when I come back for more! Considering I am here for a short time and try to find ANY opportunity or time to go see them tells you a lot.  They get a coveted 5 stars from me.  I heart u guys! ^_~

1fFtLp94A1n7AhKtiSjdtA.review_text: This is my favorite lunch spot in SF. But they just gave me the wrong to-go order. I'm disappointed, the vegi sandwich (that I didn't want) is bitter.   Ill still be back

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Must get their signature Fried Chicken Sandwich!  It's so yummy with the batter perfected, bread splendidly toasted and spread that is so nice with the moist chicken meat!  It's a bar with spacious, antique loungewear as well as a few arcade games scattered in the dining area.    It's a great bar place to whine down at and to shoot some hoops, play a little pool, drink some drinks, watch a sport's game and grab some munchies.

8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng.review_text: This new gourmet sandwich shop just opened in the North Beach area. static4.px.yelp.com/bpho…  It's located in the right side corner spot of Enrico's. If you don't want your order to go, there are a few very comfy stools inside by the window. Or you could also enjoy the food while having a drink at Enrico's bar. It's a welcome addition for downtown workers looking for a new lunch spot. static3.px.yelp.com/bpho… But prices are more expensive than I had originally anticipate ($10 was quoted as the average price in pre-opening announcements) - for example, the most expensive item in the menu is a $15 foie gras & prosciutto sandwich. This sandwich was different from what I expected. I thought I'd get slices, instead the foie gras was a spread (like cream cheese) - the foie gras probably melted when it was heated. Also it was a little too salty. Not sure if the cause was the prosciutto or if it was over seasoned. The heirloom tomatoes inside were really good. static2.px.yelp.com/bpho… Also on the menu this week: Pork belly sandwich - $9 Roasted eggplant with peppers, goat cheese, & figs sandwich - $8 Sweet corn soup - $5 static4.px.yelp.com/bpho… Lychee limeonade - $2 On the 2nd day, the pork belly was replaced by an ahi tuna sandwich. And instead of Lychee, they had a very refreshing watermelon limeonade. Update: LOVE the fried chicken sandwich. media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bp… I bought one of the "Flash Freeze Ice Cream" (cute logo) static1.px.yelp.com/bpho… mini cups ($3 - ouch!) - salty caramel flavor. static1.px.yelp.com/bpho… Made by a 3rd party vendor who is a friend of them. I was told that the sorbets were not available yet because they had melted. The ice cream texture was fine and the caramel flavor was okay, but it was too salty for my taste. Since it's new, I guess they are still working at fine tuning the operation. My initial rating was 3.25 stars for the food, bumped up to 4 stars for the very friendly service. The sandwich shop concept is simple, so I have no doubt that they'll be able to change or modify whatever isn't working. Revised hours: Tue-Sat 11:30am-2pm Phone: (415) 577-4951

PRz9byVY33lTtUaqFMan3w.review_text: i think i must be the only one that doesn't like chicken skin on my fried chicken sandwich.

ceowV9LSKZEb397yVDqdgA.review_text: How is it that salads and wraps run about $10, but a delicious homemade fried chicken sandwich made with great ingredients is $8?? Such a deal. I despise mayo and normally would ask for no aioli but this seemed liked the kind of place they'd be annoyed at you for asking, so I went for it. It was okay, but really I just can't handle a lot of any kind of goop that's like mayo so next time I'll definitely ask for it without. The chicken was super  moist (still crispy though too) and the slaw offered enough to it that if you're not a mayo fan, you can get by without the aioli. I added hot sauce and it was perfect. I also got a chocolate chunk cookie and it was excellent. I'll definitely be back here, but the fried chicken sandwich is certainly a treat, not a daily thing, although I think they only serve it Tuesdays anyway!

7QgJHvGSCndSf-zOsAHf3A.review_text: Greatest fried chicken sandwich ever. It's true.

jel0aaCVehfyd-rx9B6iQw.review_text: The prelude: my co-worker ordered a sandwich and a drink, then realized he was short a few bucks. The cashier told him not to worry about it. So he was stiffed a few bucks on the order *and* on the tip jar. I appreciated that (on my co-worker's behalf) and made up the difference on my order.  I ordered the headliner: "Foie Gras & Duck Prosciutto Sandwich".  The people are nice (see "stiffed a few bucks", above), and the sandwich was very tasty, but $15 for a sandwich is just too much.  Cash only.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: I'm finding that any place that is probably considered a destination bar never opens on time when they also serve lunch. Naked was no exception - we rolled up at 11:45 and despite "opening" at 11:30 - we were informed they "weren't quite open yet."  That was it.  No, have a seat, we'll be right with you, nothing. So we went back out and sat down outside.  Eventually the same girl came back and told us that we could now order inside. We had some drinks, a few nibbles and went on our way.  The fries were really good, and that cinnamon sweet tea is delish.  My friends got the fried chicken sandwich, but since I was about to try on wedding dresses, food was the enemy on my visit.  I'm in no rush to go back, but based on everyone else's reviews, I feel like I should give it another shot.
